title: Senior Human Resource Business Partner, Tech
description: ABOUT THIS ROLE  We have an opening for a People and Culture Senior Business Partner who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore.  Reporting to Head of People Partnering, the successful candidate will be supporting our managers through a mixture of strategy development and execution of people programs and initiatives, creating a high-performance environment for Circles.Life during our hyper growth, and ensuring alignment of our      organisational strategy with our people strategy and using data to develop best practices derived from first principles  S/he will be expected to coach and advise managers on how to build high performing and engaged teams including talent review, team development/career planning, succession planning, recognition, employee relations concerns, performance management, leaves of absence, local labor laws, global mobility, compensation and benefits.  This is a group-level role based in SingaporeABOUT CIRCLES LIFE  Circles.Life is Asia‚Äôs first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016, and have since expanded to Australia, Taiwan, Indonesia and Japan. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth.  Circles.Life was founded by Rameez Ansar (ex-Temasek, BCG), Abhishek Gupta (ex-McKinsey, Bain Capital, StanChart PE)  Adeel Najam (ex- Nokia, Huawei, Starhub), who are supported by an all-star leadership team      including C-suite executives from Tata Docomo, Paypal, Vodafone, Bharti Airtel, Hooq/ Singtel, and Flipkart (to name a few)  It now employs 400+ people over 5 APAC offices. It is the portfolio company of Warburg Pincus and Sequoia Notable accolades from past years include: Top 5 most loved Singapore brands (2nd year running) - YouGov Customer's Choice; Top Telco for Customer Service- Seedly; and Top Employer- Influential Brands (2019)WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE  Unparalleled access - Not only will the successful candidate have broad content knowledge across departments, but they also understand how the Founder and leadership team think and know what‚Äôs top of mind. They should use this to connect dots across projects, people, and departments to improve decision-making and make the organization work better.  Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment.  Create your own path - autonomy and freedom to define the vision and be the one responsible to make it happen  10X - Be part of a fast-growing organisation with ambitious plans to expand into multiple more markets and verticals, and help be the one to make it happenWHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO  Partner with People Programs, People Operations, Graduate Career, Performance Management and Total Rewards.  Partner with Tech leaders and develop Learning  Development strategy  Recruiting, Inclusion and Diversity and Education to develop programs that continually elevate the caliber of Circles.Life.  Analyse people data and trends to inform decisions on strategy and programs.  Be the catalyst for process improvements in ongoing operations and programs to scale smoothly through our next phase of growth.WHO YOU‚ÄôLL BE WORKING WITH  Chief People Officer  Head of People Partnering  Other Functional Heads within People  Culture  Additional key internal and external stakeholdersWHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR  Minimum 15 years of working experience, at least 3 of which in HR, with recent experience in a business partnering capacity  Someone passionate about Technology, Disruptive models, Organisational Culture, and Talent Management.  A business partner who deeply understands Circles.Life‚Äôs strategy and aligns it with the engineering organization‚Äôs structures, processes, initiatives and processes.  A strategist and scaler, who can connect the dots between where we‚Äôre going and how we need to nudge the organization to get there.BENEFITS  One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. In order to do that, we offer:  Exponential career growth  ownership - Completely own your own career and determine how fast and in which direction you grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands.  Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond.  Talent Mobility - Circles.Lifers are given the opportunity to change roles internally, across functions and/or offices, through multiple structured programs (i.e. internal transfers, job shadowing or job rotation). We've      witnessed many successful examples -e.g., from HR lead to Business Development Senior Manager.  Talent Development - We stand for a culture of continuous learning and growing.  Besides structured career development paths and quarterly performance reviews, we offer monthly learning brown bag sessions, manager training and LD budget to support development of professional interests and efforts.  Attractive Total Rewards (Salary + Equity) - We offer highly competitive salary and bonus inline with top tier technology companies, and equity for ALL employees (up to 6 months of annual salary worth for top performers). That means, unlimited upside based on company's performance.  Benefits - Mobile bill reimbursement for all Circles.Lifers and their dependents and medical insurance.   Bonus: Well-stocked pantry and monthly fun activities.

title: Client Onboard Analyst 2
description: The Client Onboard Analyst 2 is a developing professional role. Applies specialty area knowledge in monitoring, assessing, analyzing and/or evaluating processes and data. Identifies policy gaps and formulates policies. Interprets data and makes recommendations. Researches and interprets factual information. Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Integrates established disciplinary knowledge within own specialty area with basic understanding of related industry practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.Responsibilities:  Responsible for customer interaction, documentation issuance, review and system setups.  Demonstrates high level of diligence, motivation and organizational skills.  Focuses on timely and accurate delivery of all account opening functions, as well as delivering superior customer service and resolution of customer issues.  Performs day to day management of the account opening and maintenance processing, including daily management of in-process, pended, and service related activities, ensuring account opening requirements are clearly defined to support all scenarios of account opening and maintenance requirements, to include delivery of very high quality service to customers and internal partners.  Responsible for various types of project management in the account services space, and managing cross-functional relationships with all teams.  Determines new work procedures, analyzes complex and variable issues with significant departmental impact.  Consistent delivery of high quality service to customers through meeting or exceeding customer expectation guided by service level agreements and efficiency/accuracy standards.  Ensures awareness and full compliance of internal processes, regulations, policies, guidelines, procedures, and practices.  Establishes and maintains close working relationship with clients and within team to facilitate an open and direct communication of issues, needs, queries, etc., in such that these may be responded to in an efficient, prompt and professional manner.  Embarks on continuous on the job training for end to end product knowledge.  Understands client requirements and implement them correctly.  Understands new customer requirements and ensure adequate support to new customer requirements and initiatives. Monitors customer satisfaction and service level and drive process changes. Provides innovative solutions to clients.  Daily deliverable of routine and defined tasks, while developing knowledge of the broader context in which work is being performed.  Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.Qualifications:  0-2 years of experience in Documentation review, Account Maintenance and related Markets products preferred.  Demonstrated interpersonal skills, pro-active team player but also able to work independently, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills.  Highly motivated, persistent, and able to work in a structured, high volume, time sensitive, high-risk environment. Capable of multitasking and eager to learn multiple products in a challenging environment. Fast learner, strong attention to detail, and willingness to go extra mile.  Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications.  Proficient in handling urgent and escalation cases and manage client and internal team expectations. Proficient knowledge of English (written and spoken).Education:  Bachelor‚Äôs/University degree or equivalent experience

title: Manager, Bid & Commercial
description: The bid and commercial manager will be responsible for leading and coordinating the bid response.  To do this effectively you will need to work closely with sales and the solutions manager, liaise with other teams and stake holders to ensure submissions are made on time and to the required quality. You will assemble a bid team with sales and solution manager together with service/ product/ finance/ engineering/ operation/support team with relevant knowledge to prepare for the winning bid, whilst taking ownership of the end to end bid-process and the competitiveness of the bid both commercially and technically. You will need to identify the key gaps and risk and to present to the management team in bid meeting.In parallel, you will be required to introduce and constantly review the bid response process, governance, develop and maintain a knowledge base of ‚Äòstandard‚Äô answers and templates, as well as identifying ways to improve the quality, consistency and efficiency of the bid response process.In additional, beyond the bid, you will be the commercial manager supporting the partnership and commercial arrangement with strategic partnersApplicants must have excellent communication skills, combined with the ability to understand technical concepts and tender questions then provide clear concise responses whilst working to tight deadlines and challenging targets.Responsibilities:  To manage all aspects of tender/bid submission, define the time lines and key milestones, joint bid qualification (bid go/no go) for new opportunities with relevant stakeholders  Conduct the tender briefing to the key stakeholders in collaboration with the sales on the bid strategy and assign the required task to the respective owners  Lead and coordinate the preparation of the bid ensuring that other stakeholders provide information on time in response to customer‚Äôs requirements, specification and compliances  Compile, review and revise documents submitted by others and coordinate the preparation of those materials in a completed bid document  Prepare and review the commercial aspects of the tender, ensuring all services are included in the final price and submission  Drive the response to the tender/bid clarification with customers and the post tender evaluation with internal team  Constantly review the bid response process, governance, develop and maintain a knowledge base of ‚Äòstandard‚Äô answers and templates, as well as identifying ways to improve the quality, consistency and efficiency of the bid response process.  Develop a set of standard templates for less complex bids Management of all aspects of the bid process to ensure deadlines are met  To drive commercial arrangement with strategic partnersRequirements:  Degree in Engineering/Computer Science with at least 3 years related experience or Diploma with more than 5 years of related experience (in network based solution or service provider experience)  Must have technical awareness including an understanding of service provider/telecommunication services in connectivity/internet / network based solutions  Sound commercial understanding, PL and risk management skills  Have the ability to manage complex, multi-worksteam opportunities.  Able to work on tight timescales particularly when developing proposals and bid response  Team and action oriented; proactive in prioritising own work load and assigned areas of responsibility to others  Able to influence assertively to get results  Excellent interpersonal skills and familiar with contract management  Familiar with Gebiz tender process would be an advantage

title: Senior Account Manager/Associate Account Director
description: Responsibilities:  Act as the client's key liaison with the agency and balance the input of the various agency departments  Manage day to day client expectations from timelines and briefs, through to content and creative delivery  Be responsible for the quality of the creative output and thought leadership  Be responsible for an agile team of Account Executives/Managers and Content Specialists, ensuring positive team dynamics, workload balance and efficiency in working  Build and maintain relationships with clients at all levels of seniority, building trust and belief in the agency‚Äôs way of working and ethos  Understanding clients‚Äô commercial environment, direction and consumers  and provide strategic insights and innovative solutions for clients  Collaborate with internal teams  and ensure seamless execution and delivery of all projects  Responsible for overall financial health of the team and agency‚Äôs PL ‚Äì manage and grow set revenue targets.  Pursue new business opportunitiesJob RequirementsThe ideal candidate will have a solid 4 to 5 years of Account Servicing experience minimally and have had hands-on experience handling social, and/or content marketing, and digital campaigns on various communication channels for fast-moving consumer brands and/ or luxury brands locally in Singapore. Proven success in managing fast robust consumer brands with a high emphasis on social media is imperative.To be successful in this role you will need to be nimble, organized and efficient with the ability to juggle multiple projects concurrently. As you will be a key client contact for the account, confidence, constant quest to be ahead of the market and the ability to ‚Äòget it done‚Äô are all key attributes.Desired Skills and Experience:  Experience in a social media or content marketing agency with proven portfolio in managing social media accounts  Exceptional client management and leadership skills, with the ability to identify potential growth opportunities  Possesses the ability to create well thought out, data-backed plans of action for clients‚Äô campaigns and always-on content  Strong strategic and creative thinking skills, with a passion for delivering best-in-class work  Strong analytical skills and ability to mine large sets of data for actionable insights  Deep understanding and strong working knowledge of social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn and Twitter), with keenness to explore new and emerging platforms  Experience in running social advertising and content promotion campaigns on social platforms, as well as well-versed with social listening tools.  Extroverted with well-developed interpersonal, team building and relationship management skills  Excellent command of English, both verbal and written communication

description: Korn Ferry is a global organizational consulting firm. We work with our clients to design optimal organization structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people and advise them on how to reward and motivate their workforce while developing professionals as they navigate and advance their careers. Our 7,000 experts in more than 50 countries deliver on five core areas: Organization Strategy, Assessment and Succession, Talent Acquisition, Leadership Development and Total Rewards.We have creative and highly energetic environment ‚Äì one in which we look to each other to innovate new solutions not only for our clients but for ourselves too. Open and collaborative with a borderless mentality, this is a workplace where expertise is shared with colleagues around the globe. We are committed to delivering client service excellence and a high performance culture for our employees and teams.  Korn Ferry is an ambitious and inclusive company where everyone is empowered to contribute. Integrity is a fundamental part of our culture; we believe that how you deliver business outcomes is as important as driving results. We work in a fast-moving, dynamic industry where change is the only constant and flexibility is the key to success.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESWorking closely with engagement teams, the primary responsibilities of the Associate are to:  Provide engagement execution support to the client and the team. Assist in managing the stages of the search process so as to always ensure the highest quality execution of client engagement.  Identify and develop potential candidates utilizing Korn Ferry‚Äôs local and global internal technologies, research, networks, and relationships. Collaborate with colleagues elsewhere within Korn Ferry when appropriate and draw upon full relevant knowledge of resources.  Conduct initial candidate qualification and screening. Document all search activity as required by the firm‚Äôs current protocols.  Assist Senior/Managing Associates in creation of client facing documentation (candidate appraisals, reference reports, search progress reports) as well as other consulting projects.  Inform the engagement team of any potential business development opportunities identified through the execution of the search process and research and support the appropriate Senior/Managing Associate in its conversion.PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONSThe ideal candidate for an Associate position at Korn Ferry is a detailed oriented, self-motivated individual with the capability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial and multicultural environment, and the desire to provide a high-quality professional service solution.KNOWLEDGE  SKILLS:  4 to 6 years of consulting, related professional services, or relevant industry experience with an innate ability to influence and sell.  Strong preference given to those with recruitment or program management experience.  Demonstrated knowledge or experience in an Industrial segment preferred.  Rigorous analytical/problem solving skills.  Excellent conceptual skills.  Strong presence.  Capability to communicate and build rapport with senior business leaders from various backgrounds.  Aptitude to work with senior professionals in the firm who have varied styles of practice.  Proven ability to juggle multiple projects and tasks.  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.  Pro-active and intellectually curious.  Very strong people skills   Ability to communicate and connect with senior executives by phone and in person.If you are interested in this role, please send your resume to SG_recruit@kornferry.com.Please note that only shortlisted candidates would be notified.

title: Safety and Risk Engineer (Entry Level)
description: Vanguard Risk and Safety Asia Pte. Ltd. SingaporeAbout UsWe are a Process Safety and Risk Management consultancy, an affiliate of the Vanguard Solutions Group of Companies, covering various territories predominately South-East Asia, Australia, Middle East, North/South Americas and Europe. We specialise in the provision of high quality safety engineering and risk management services, including Process Safety Studies, Risk Assessments, Safety Case Development, Reliability Engineering and Environmental Risk Management, to industries including oil and gas, petrochemical, defence, mining and public transport infrastructure.We are also a partner and reseller of Sphera Solutions Software products specialising in Risk Assessment, Emission monitoring, Chemical Management, Hazardous Goods Management, Incident Management, Management of Change and Maintenance/Repair/Operations software.Job Details and Responsibilities:Reporting to the Principal Consultant or the Consultant, you are responsible for day-to-day activities involved with Risk Management and Safety Engineering work aspects of the safety studies, risk assessments, Safety Cases and other deliverables required for the work execution including  Contacting clients and collecting documentation.  Support by technical scribing during workshops and client meetings  Working on assignments in close cooperation with Senior Engineer and/or Consultant  Preparing reports and following up with clients  Organising and sorting project filesAlso the job scope covers Sphera Software partnership activities including marketing, sales and customer support generally related to:  Engaging and searching for new clients and achieve sales revenue/targets.  Prepare and execute marketing activities for software products  Coordinate pre-sales and post-sales follow up with clients.  Manage and maintain existing customer data base  Attend to customer enquiries and ensure customer satisfaction.  Maintaining technical knowledge by attending training/educational workshops/webinarsQualifications and Knowledge:‚Ä¢ Minimum Bachelor Degree. Preferably Chemical Engineering, Oil and Gas, or similar field.‚Ä¢ Min 1-2 years of engineering experience‚Ä¢ Performance driven with good communication, interpersonal and computer skills.‚Ä¢ Self-driven with ability to work partially independently under required level of supervision‚Ä¢ Understand an applied engineering environment and what it entails‚Ä¢ Possess the right attitude to succeed in end results deliveryCONTRACTURAL PERIOD:  1-2 years renewable contract - 3 month probation period, conversion to contract depending on assessment  Remuneration package: Basic + Performance based annual bonus. Allowances for telephone and other work related activities.  In-house training for all Process Safety, Risk Management, Safety Case, etc., as well as specific training with outside organisations subject to work requirements will be provided.Interested applicants, kindly email your detailed resume: admin@vanguardasia.com.sg

title: Senior Human Resource Business Partner, Tech
description: ABOUT THIS ROLE  We have an opening for a People and Culture Senior Business Partner who wants to gain valuable experience and exposure in a hyper-growth environment in Singapore.  Reporting to Head of People Partnering, the successful candidate will be supporting our managers through a mixture of strategy development and execution of people programs and initiatives, creating a high-performance environment for Circles.Life during our hyper growth, and ensuring alignment of our organisational strategy with our people strategy and using data to develop best practices derived from first principles  S/he will be expected to coach and advise managers on how to build high performing and engaged teams including talent review, team development/ career planning, succession planning, recognition, employee relations concerns, performance management, leaves of absence, local labor laws, global mobility, compensation and benefits.  This is a group-level role based in SingaporeABOUT CIRCLES LIFE  Circles.Life is Asia‚Äôs first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016, and have since expanded to Australia, Taiwan, Indonesia and Japan. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth.  Circles.Life was founded by Rameez Ansar (ex-Temasek, BCG), Abhishek Gupta (ex-McKinsey, Bain Capital, StanChart PE)  Adeel Najam (ex- Nokia, Huawei, Starhub), who are supported by an all-star leadership team including C-suite executives from Tata Docomo, Paypal, Vodafone, Bharti Airtel, Hooq/ Singtel, and Flipkart (to name a few)  It now employs 400+ people over 5 APAC offices. It is the portfolio company of Warburg Pincus and SequoiaNotable accolades from past years include: Top 5 most loved Singapore brands (2nd year running)- YouGov Customer's Choice; Top Telco for Customer Service- Seedly; and Top Employer- Influential Brands (2019)WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE  Unparalleled access - Not only will the successful candidate have broad content knowledge across departments, but they also understand how the Founder and leadership team think and know what‚Äôs top of mind. They should use this to connect dots across projects, people, and departments to improve decision-making and make the organization work better.  Working with passionate, smart and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment.  Create your own path - autonomy and freedom to define the vision and be the one responsible to make it happen  10X - Be part of a fast-growing organisation with ambitious plans to expand into multiple more markets and verticals, and help be the one to make it happenWHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO  Partner with People Programs, People Operations, Graduate Career, Performance Management and Total Rewards.  Partner with Tech leaders and develop Learning  Development strategy  Recruiting, Inclusion and Diversity and Education to develop programs that continually elevate the caliber of Circles.Life.  Analyse people data and trends to inform decisions on strategy and programs.  Be the catalyst for process improvements in ongoing operations and programs to scale smoothly through our next phase of growth. WHO YOU‚ÄôLL BE WORKING WITH  Chief People Officer  Head of People Partnering  Other Functional Heads within People  Culture  Additional key internal and external stakeholdersWHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR  Minimum 15 years of working experience, at least 3 of which in HR, with recent experience in a business partnering capacity  Someone passionate about Technology, Disruptive models, Organisational Culture, and Talent Management.  A business partner who deeply understands Circles.Life‚Äôs strategy and aligns it with the engineering organization‚Äôs structures, processes, initiatives and processes.  A strategist and scaler, who can connect the dots between where we‚Äôre going and how we need to nudge the organization to get there. BENEFITS  One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. In order to do that, we offer:  Exponential career growth  ownership - Completely own your own career and determine how fast and in which direction you grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands.  Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond.  Talent Mobility - Circles.Lifers are given the opportunity to change roles internally, across functions and/or offices, through multiple structured programs (i.e. internal transfers, job shadowing or job rotation). We've witnessed many successful examples -e.g., from HR lead to Business Development Senior Manager.  Talent Development - We stand for a culture of continuous learning and growing. Besides structured career development paths and quarterly performance reviews, we offer monthly learning brown bag sessions, manager training and LD budget to support development of professional interests and efforts.  Attractive Total Rewards (Salary + Equity) - We offer highly competitive salary and bonus inline with top tier technology companies, and equity for ALL employees (up to 6 months of annual salary worth for top performers). That means, unlimited upside based on company's performance.  Benefits - Mobile bill reimbursement for all Circles.Lifers and their dependents and medical insurance. Bonus: Well-stocked pantry and monthly fun activities.

title: Compliance AML Execution Analyst -  Officer
description: The Execution Intermediate Analyst is an intermediate position responsible for performing risk and compliance reviews in coordination with the broader Anti-Money Laundering (AML) team. The overall objective is to utilize in-depth AML knowledge to review, analyze and conduct effective due diligence and investigations on higher risk cases that may be a potential risk to Citi.Responsibilities:  Conduct investigations and research on potentially suspicious clients using various internal and external systems and databases  Conduct Cross Sector reviews among multiple Citi business lines.  Document and report the review/investigation findings and prepare case files with the required supporting documentation  Summarize, in writing, clear and concise findings of the investigation  Advise senior management on next steps and provide recommendations on the next course of action (relationship retention, termination, Suspicious Activity Report (SAR))  Manage risk by analyzing the root cause of issues and impact to business  Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.  Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.  Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.  Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.Qualifications:  2-5 years‚Äô relevant experience  Knowledge of AML regulations preferred  Proficient in MS Office  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Demonstrated analytical skillsEducation:  Bachelor‚Äôs/University degree or equivalent experienceThis job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

title: Application Support Analyst
description: The Apps Support Intmd Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Analyzes applications to identify risks, vulnerabilities and security issues.  Makes evaluative judgments based on analysis of factual information; resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions Cooperation with Development colleagues to prioritize bug fixes and support tooling requirements. Exchanges ideas and information  Active involvement in and ownership of Support Project items, covering Stability, Efficiency, and Effectiveness initiatives.  Performs other duties and functions as assigned in a concise and logical manner.  Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.  Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.  Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.  Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.Qualifications:  2-5 years experience  Basic knowledge or interest about apps support procedures, concepts and of other technical areas.  Participation in some process improvements.  Previous experience or interest in standardization of procedures and practices.  Basic Business knowledge/ understanding of financial markets and products.  Knowledge/ experience of problem Management Tools.  Understands of how own sub-function integrates within the function and commercial awareness  Evaluates (sometimes complex) situations using multiple sources of information Developed communication and diplomacy skills to persuade and influence  Good customer service, communication and interpersonal skills  Good knowledge of the business and its technology strategy  Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills  Knowledge of issue tracking and reporting using tools  Good all-round team member  Effectively share information with other support team members and with other technology teams  Ability to plan and organize workload  Ability to communicate appropriately to relevant stakeholderEducation:  Bachelor‚Äôs/University degree or equivalent experience

title: Client President
description: ROLE PURPOSEMedia Line of Business (LoB) will deliver to clients the right blend of services in order to build their brands and drive conversion, through bringing together media planning, buying and performance to create a world class end to end product in media.The purpose of the role is to deliver value to clients‚Äô business by evolving and shaping business growth strategies and plans for clients, engaging with and developing strong and collaborative relationships with top level clients. The Client President leads the team to drive business value across core and diversified services, cross and upselling across the Lines of Business across the group.This role plays an active role to identify, develop and profitably commercialise client opportunities by delivering to our client base, and work with the MD, leadership team and LOBs to pursue opportunities with existing and new clients. Delivery of a business plan will include galvanising a broad team across DAN and where appropriate across the network to meet the objectives of both clients and the business. Client President is an active and senior people development and leadership role in leading Client leads and teams to drive business value across core and diversified services either through a direct reporting line or indirectly to inspire and promote a high performance culture of open teaming without limits.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIESThe key accountabilities of the role includes:Strategic Client Leadership:¬∑ Help the relevant Client leads and Clients understand what innovation means for them, seeking out opportunities to evolve their view of the value add of all media and to maximize the use of our evolving operating model of one Dentsu that offers integrated solutions.¬∑ Take the conversation ‚Äòupstream‚Äô: Develop new mutually advantageous approaches that build our clients‚Äô brands, and lead the client to better decisions about how they use media and performance.¬∑ Contribute ideas which demonstrate that knowledge of how internal and external factors affect the client, stimulate them and ensure they are up to speed with latest tech  media developments.¬∑ Constantly keep up-to-date with DAN products and services, industry innovation and thinking, media owners‚Äô offers and apply this knowledge to support team and guide clients.¬∑ Develop relationships with the most senior clients through a deep understanding of their brand so that the Client President is considered a trusted advisor and strategist of their business.¬∑ Support and lead the client to understand what is going on in the marketplace and how to structure up for it.¬∑ Co-create effective solutions with the client.¬∑ Move the relationship from one where the client leads, to one where we take the lead.¬∑ Develop any client training agendas to upscale media knowledge within client organization.¬∑ Managing the Business by delivery of the service proposition to clients and full end-to-end management of the business on individual clients.¬∑ Proactive Client Development by delivering against specific client cross sell and upsell opportunities into the Dentsu PL.¬∑ Commercial and service ownership of client relationship by driving growth and profit and ensuring seamless delivery.¬∑ Business Development by leadership of relevant new business initiatives to proactively target, pitch and win new clients.Commercials:¬∑ Responsible for development and delivery of key strategic development plans and annual business plan for the client. This plan must identify opportunities for growth for the client‚Äôs business and our product offerings, through potential DAN solutions.¬∑ Ensures that the global service model and collaboration between op-cos/teams across the business is optimal for each global client.¬∑ Sets the direction for how multi-function/teams/markets relationships should be managed across the business, and ensures all DAN operating companies and local markets understand the role they need to play to ensure that relationship is optimal.¬∑ Be able to expertly navigate contracts that are negotiated at the global level.¬∑ Understand in/out of scope work.¬∑ Develop the clients business  income opportunities; delivering agreed financial targets.¬∑ Working with commercial and the leadership team, be responsible for development and delivery of annual business plan for the clients, taking into account the commercial structure defined for the business and how it is impacted by client spend.¬∑ Work with Finance Partners to ensure forecasting and revenue management process are delivered accurately and managed appropriately.¬∑ Own and ensure compliance, partnering with Finance and Operation leads, of all contractual obligations¬∑ Commercial finance that includes owning, managing and reporting commercial targets within the budget and other financial processes.¬∑ Operational finance that includes ensuring the team and processes are in place to deliver streamlined financial processes and minimising debt and maximizing working capital.¬∑ Drive Operational excellence.People Leadership:¬∑ In conjunction with the Media Leadership team, bring our Dentsu‚Äôs North Star vision and our 8 ways to life.¬∑ Role model our values by being responsible and demonstrating the highest standards of work and behaviour to build high performing culture.¬∑ Strive to unleash potential, enable maximum performance and create an engaging employee experience for the team throughout their career with the Company.¬∑ Lead, motivate and develop next generation of client leaders and talents within Media LOB, ensuring succession planning for critical roles is undertaken, and career development plans for each team member is in place and supported.¬∑ Actively work to attract and recruit the best talents from across the network and externally, to build and retain an integrated, effective and highly engaged client teams.¬∑ On an ongoing basis, review team capabilities against client expectations/priorities and support/intervene where necessary to ensure high performance and delivery.PERSON SPECIFICATIONSProfessional skills:¬∑ Strategic rigour and viewpoint¬∑ Strong marketing, media and communications concepts, models, skills, practices, tools, frameworks, etc.¬∑ Holistic view of BOE media¬∑ Strong understanding of holistic digital media concepts, propositions, Dentsu Aegis Media digital services¬∑ Digitally savvy and experienced, with a passion for data and new technology¬∑ Ability to analyse numerical data and pull out reasonable and rational conclusions to underpin innovative strategic plan.¬∑ Strong commercial and financial acumenKey Experiences  Competencies:¬∑ Extensive relevant industry experience¬∑ Recognised industry ‚Äòsenior hitter‚Äô with a track record of delivering regional/global client account management and substantial new business growth.¬∑ Strong proven experience of winning, delivering and retaining key clients¬∑ Highly tuned client leadership capabilities, able to develop and grow strong relationships with senior key clients and quickly gain traction, credibility, trust and demonstrate value. Seen as an extension of the clients‚Äô team.¬∑ Expert networking skills to generate new business leads¬∑ Ability to identify and deliver on commercial opportunities¬∑ Understanding of how to work with teams and clients concurrently and align them behind a clear purpose and vision of success. An ability to manage and connect with different types of people at different levels at scale.¬∑ Ability to build collaborative relationships with all stakeholders: sharing information at the right time and to the right audience¬∑ Resilient and handles conflict/adversity well and in a timely manner¬∑ Skilled communicator with ability to adapt method and approach depending on message and audience¬∑ Ability to flex different influencing and engaging styles to achieve right outcome¬∑ Inspirational leadership capabilities to create clear purpose, drive high performance culture and build capabilities at all levels. Strong coaching and people leadership skills.¬∑ Understands how to deliver through and with others in a way that motivates, instils the right behaviours and drives high performance¬∑ Culture builder who is aligned and role models Dentsu‚Äôs Vision and Values¬∑ Ability to understand cultural nuances and adapts own style to fit. Respects differences in culture, approach and skillset¬∑ Effective leadership of teams in a virtual / matrix organisationPersonal Attributes:¬∑ Sees and believes in the power of teams and collaboration to get to the best answers quickly¬∑ A desire to get a deep and hands on knowledge/ownership of the client‚Äôs business and the work going through the agency team. Requires an ability to get in and out of the weeds as required by the situation.¬∑ Thinks everything on the client‚Äôs business is their responsibility. Accepts everything is their responsibility.¬∑ Ability to deep-dive in the day to day while able to see the big picture¬∑ Strives for perfection (99% good is not good enough) and has a bias for beauty and craft on deliverables¬∑ Diplomatic, able to develop strong relationships with key stakeholders at all levels within the business across the markets.¬∑ Capable of picking up projects and running with them¬∑ Ambitious self-starter, able to spot ideas and inspiration¬∑ Entrepreneurial attitude towards and hunger for opportunities and places for growth.¬∑ Inspiring and inclusive influencer who is able to motivate others when not in the same room/geography¬∑ Curious nature ‚Äì always open to and looking for new ways to improve, new things to bring to the client and new ideas we could pilot and testWell-organised and thrives under pressure in meeting strict deadlines and clear ways of working

title: Fund Compliance Manager
description: You will assist in post-trade compliance, assist in the monitoring of the investment and transactional activities of fund managers to ensure compliance with regulatory and client-mandated investment guidelines.  You will also ensure that all client reporting are done accurately and on a timely basis. As our fund managers invest in a broad range of instruments, you should have some knowledge in various financial securities products.Responsibilities  Review and maintenance of accurate compliance rules across all fund types, in accordance with Investment guidelines or compliance parameters provided by client / fund manager.  Ensure accurate and correct interpretation of guidelines and the creation of relevant rules in the compliance monitoring system.  Ensure that alerts and / or breaches are monitored daily and follow-up action taken and documented.  Updating of Operating Procedures Manual and Operating Memorandums with clients.  By adhering to guidelines and checklists, ensure that standard procedures and controls, as set out in the Operating Procedures Manual, are being adhered to.  Responsible for ensuring that all the daily / non-daily reporting to clients are met as per requirements.  Attend to client queries.  Assist Funds Compliance Monitoring Manager in the smooth running of the compliance monitoring function of the department, including adherence to corporate and regulatory policies and requirements.  Assist in process improvement initiatives.  Assist in training and development of new or inexperienced staff.  Assist in user acceptance testing.  Working with internal/external parties (for example clients, fund managers, vendors, fund accountants, auditors etc)Qualifications/Requirements  Degree in Banking / Finance or Accountancy  4 - 6 years experience in the financial industry (fund management / insurance business will be preferred) with relevant experience in post-trade compliance platforms, creating and maintaining rules for purposes of portfolio compliance. Knowledge of the various component feeds to the system (fund accounting data base, third party vendor feeds) will be an added advantage.  Strong working knowledge of investment guidelines, securities ratings and industry classification, benchmark indexes, etc.  Demonstrating a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.  Ability to write macros and rule logic, knowledge of SQL and data mapping will be a plus.  Computer literate with good working knowledge of Excel  macros. Preferably with working knowledge of SQL and data mapping.  Able to interpret legal clauses and paraphrase into simple and clear requirements.  Service-oriented and client focused. A team player with strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills.  Willing to work on Singapore public holidays.

title: Business Continuity, COG/Life Lead
description: Chubb is the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. The company employs over 30,000 people operating from offices in 54 countries. From time to time, these employees encounter situations that require the involvement and support of company leaders within their individual country and/or region. These range from localized technical problems that threaten business processes to region-wide disasters that threaten life safety. Regardless of an incident‚Äôs nature, it is imperative that corporate executives remain informed, so they can support company employees and sustain business operations.Chubb‚Äôs Global Safety, Security and Business Continuity (GSSBCM) has critical areas that are driven by a Duty of Care to protect our people, property, reputation, and brand. GSSBCM acts as a shared service to support Chubb Business Units and Corporate functions ‚Äì as an integrator that can assist with reducing risk, and enhancing resilience, through deliberate planning, progressively challenging exercises, and transparent policies and processes.DescriptionThe Business Continuity, COG/Life Lead is a significant contributor to Chubb‚Äôs overall Readiness for, Response to, and Recovery from business interruptions. This position is primarily focused on COG/Life operations but will be expected to support aspects of Chubb North America, as needed. Domestic and international travel (20-30%) is required.This position requires an experienced professional who can provide subject matter expertise in business continuity. The Business Continuity, COG/Life Lead is expected to work with minimal supervision while providing business continuity planning, training, exercising, and assessment services to corporate locations and lines of business.Key Responsibilities  In collaboration with the Vice President of Business Continuity, develops business continuity policy and strategies aimed at mitigating all security and business continuity related risks.  Oversees and directs operational business continuity resources within LATAM, EMEA, APAC, and India.  Regional Liaison:  Manage and support the BCM Leads for the Regions.  Participate in and/or lead conference calls and web-based meetings with partners from the Regions.  Develop and share BCM products that can be adapted for use in Global Regions.  Travel to support key BCM events within the Regions.  Works with the COG Business Continuity Anaylist to ensure the regions receive support related to recurring annual requirements including incident management team exercises, business impact analysis and business continuity plans.  Identifies, prioritizes and addresses all internal and external business continuity issues, threats and vulnerabilities across the spectrum ranging from the terrorism threat to natural hazards.  Constantly evaluates processes while seeking improvement and implementation of positive organizational change.  Assist with implementation of Chubb‚Äôs global relational database and management system (Clearview) for business continuity.  Creating, archiving, and consolidating functions and plans within the Clearview database.  Assists the VP of Global Business Continuity in achieving financial goals by tracking operational budgets.  Assist in responding to incidents and outages.  Work closely with the VP of Global Business Continuity and Regional Leadership on BCM and related projects and activities.  Ensure compliance of the regional business continuity program and support compliance outside of North America.  Assist business units in determining acceptable recovery time objectives and resource requirements.  Track, manage, and close issues identified by reviews, audits, incidents, and exercises.  Support requests from stakeholders to support business continuity related initiatives, to include: site selection, strategy development, completing supplier and regulator inquiries and surveys, reviewing partner BC arrangements, and conducting meetings with brokers, customers, insurers, and other third parties.  Provide input into weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports.  Provide written and verbal feedback about program effectiveness, including ideas for program improvements.  Provide support, as assigned, to the Global Business Continuity Program.  Continue to develop as a Business Continuity professional.  Other duties as assigned.Qualifications  Knowledge and experience in business continuity planning, training, and exercising commensurate with a minimum of 3 years of experience.  Exposure to working across at least 2 of the regions, including: LATAM, EMEA, APAC, and India.  Strong analytical, organizational, and decision-making skills.  Strong leadership skills and a productive team player with a proven track record.  Strong verbal / written communications. Must be able to interface and coordinate efficiently and effectively with business partners and all levels of leadership across the global organization.  Strong administrative skills, with effectiveness in developing tasks and managing resources to achieve target dates.  Strong interpersonal skills and articulation skills required to communicate solutions to management.  Skilled at working with senior management in the development of strategic, as well as, tactical plans to mature the BCP culture within the corporation.  Strong proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, MS Teams); SharePoint; Microsoft Outlook; Web-based communications tools; and internet-based research.  Professional Designation - Certified Business Continuity Professional (or equivalent certifications or work experience preferred).  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree from an accredited college or university.

title: Citi Private Bank, Know Your Customer Quality Assurance Ops Specialists
description: Job DescriptionThe Citi Private Bank Client Know Your Customer Quality Assurance Ops Specialists is an operations subject matter expertise on Know Your Customer (KYC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Account Opening  Documentation Review, responsible to support the client onboarding of Citi Private Bank clients. Deals with problems independently and has latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.Responsibilities:Responsible to perform independent Client Onboarding KYC due diligence functions of new and existing clients across a variety of teams including private bankers, operations and compliance.To review clients' profiles and work with banker team to fulfill onboarding requirement, full compliance of Bank‚Äôs AML/KYC standards, local laws and regulations.Perform Client Name Screening disposition, Sanctions review and Enhanced Due Diligence.Identify and highlight suspicious money laundering activities, deficiencies and other non-compliance issues to management.To prepare client risk assessments and various MIS reports for management reporting to facilitate relevant reviews and strengthening the control process.To conduct ongoing gap analysis on policies and standards against existing processes, identify improvement initiatives for streamlining the KYC and Onboarding process and keep the guidelines/procedures up to date.To coach the junior team members, provide guidance in exception handling. Acts as SME to senior stakeholders.Focuses on timely and accurate delivery of all responsible functions, as well as delivering superior customer service and resolution of customer issues, guided by service level agreements and efficiency/accuracy standards.Performs day to day management of volume processing, including daily management of in-process, pending, and service related activities, ensuring requirements are clearly defined to support all scenarios of KYC account opening and maintenance requirements.Establishes and maintains close working relationship with client, stakeholder and within team to facilitate an open and direct communication of issues, needs, queries and system setups, in such that these may be responded to in an efficient, prompt and professional manner.Responsible for various types of project management, process and policy changes, new initiatives and managing cross-functional relationships with all teams. Analyzes complex and variable issues with significant departmental impact in the team.Establishes risk management practice, ensures a strong and robust processing environment with effective controls.Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.Embarks on continuous on the job training for end to end product knowledge.Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision. Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. Demonstrates high level of diligence, motivation and organizational skills.Qualifications:  5-10 years of experience in KYC/AML process, compliance, operations, risk  control functions  Demonstrated interpersonal skills, pro-active team player but also able to work independently, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders across levels, businesses, and geographies  Highly motivated, persistent, and able to work in a structured, high volume, time sensitive, high-risk environment  Capable of multitasking and eager to learn multiple products in a challenging environment. Fast learner, strong attention to detail, and willingness to go extra mile  Proficient in handling urgent and escalation cases and manage internal team expectations  Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications  Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills  Proficient knowledge of English (written and spoken)Education:Bachelor‚Äôs/University degree or equivalent experience

title: Construction Lead, Life Sciences
description: At Jacobs, we push the limits of what‚Äôs possible to make the world smarter, more connected and more sustainable. In our built environment work, that means designing spaces that foster innovation, cultivate collaboration and drive the next great discovery for humanity. Bring your creativity, collaborative spirit and extreme attention to detail, and we‚Äôll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you ‚Äì so we can deliver extraordinary solutions for a better tomorrow, together.Our Advanced Facilities is currently seeking a Construction Lead to be part of the Life Sciences team in Singapore. This position oversees the team of Resident Engineers /Technical officers and support professionals project design coordination and construction activities of Life Sciences Projects. This position contributes to the organization by supervision of project work for the firm‚Äôs external clients. The incumbent is responsible for supervision on medium construction projects. This role has a demonstrated understanding and application of the knowledge and skill (competencies) required of a project, related to construction supervision and is familiar with most of the technologies and delivery methods. This position provides motivation and direction to the field construction team(s), consisting of inspectors/site superintendents and trade supervisors.Acts as one of the CM‚Äôs prime contacts and is responsible for:  Establishing a Safety culture through all aspects of the project  Quality systems are well established, understood, and adhered to  Highlight the delays and work with the contractors on mitigation of delays, if any.  Building sequence is proper and timely for the project.  Good relationships are maintained with client and contractors and that project issues are resolved timely throughout construction tenure  Ensure all activities are being executed at site as per the valid regulatory compliance and also ensure that Contractor follows all the statutory compliance for all the workers deployed at site throughout the construction phase   Works closely with overall project and construction management leadership to ensure successful delivery of Project including TOP, CSC etc.  Works closely with construction and engineering management on coordination of inter / intra contract activities.  Direct and control the activities of the assigned staff  their functions to comply with the project requirement.  Comply with the Company's Construction Methods, Procedures and Practices in all respects, particularly those relating to Quality Assurance, Safety, Personnel and Industrial relations; where these are found to be inadequate immediately report the deficiencies and suggest solutions.  Meet client expectations and attend to client‚Äôs feedback and any complaints.  Ensure that the contractors comply with the site working conditions and the Client's regulations for Fire, Safety and Security.  Ensure that the Plant is constructed to the Drawings, Specifications, Applicable Standards, and Good Construction Practices  to Schedule and maintain records for final documentation  Be responsible for effective implementation of safety procedures by the contractors as per the established HSE plan.  Supervises the multi ‚Äì disciplinary construction project site team in accordance with requirements specified in the contract documents.  Ensure timely and speedy resolution of problems encountered at Sites and monitor Corrective actions.  Onsite activities may include construction supervision, field administration and field engineering.  Completes the scope of work to the satisfaction of the client, while simultaneously ensuring that JACOBS‚Äôs HSE, Quality, financial, risk management expectations are met.  Ensure the construction activities of Contractors are executed in accordance to contractual and quality assurance requirements.  Coordinate the works of different contractors and other contract packages in terms of working areas and timing, promoting frequent coordination meetings with ContractorsTo be a successful candidate, you shall possess:  Minimum 15 years of construction experience with at least 10 years shall be in construction supervision of pharmaceutical or chemical projects.  Experience in Biotech plant projects construction will be an added advantage.  Skilled in developing environmental health and safety culture and practice.  Able to manage multi-disciplinary construction teams.Jacobs. A world where you can.From our inclusive employee networks, to our positive mental health champions ‚Äì we‚Äôre committed to driving a culture of caring where you can be you. Joining Jacobs not only connects you locally but globally - and together, our diverse perspectives and unique backgrounds power our collective strength. We collaborate and share! By supporting one another, we all succeed.With safety and flexibility always top of mind, we‚Äôve gone beyond traditional ways of working so you have the support, means and space to maximise your potential. You‚Äôll uncover flexible working arrangements, benefits and opportunities to do good too ‚Äì from participating in our global giving and volunteering program, to exploring new and inventive ways to help our clients make the world a better place. No matter what drives you, you‚Äôll discover how you can cultivate, nurture and achieve your goals ‚Äì all at a single global company.Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered, to be considered you will need to apply directly to Jacobs.Jacobs complies with the Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices (TGFEP), including the prevailing guidelines on recruitment. All qualified applicants will be considered for the position regardless of age, race, religion, language, nationality, marital status, or family responsibilities.

title: Network Ops Engineer
description: As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients‚Äô best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations  Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do. We keep the bank safe and provide the technical tools our workers need to be successful. We design our digital architecture and ensure our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. Our operations teams manage risk, resources, and program management. We focus on enterprise resiliency and business continuity. We develop, coordinate, and execute strategic operational plans. Essentially, Enterprise Operations  Technology re-engineers client and partner processes to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and controlled services.Citi Technology Infrastructure provides the critical technical foundation for Citi‚Äôs operations and is responsible for delivering IT solutions, scalable infrastructure services, and secure capabilities while creating a trusted customer experience and enabling Citi‚Äôs workforce to be the best for our clients. Making the bank simpler, greener, and better connected while powering it with trusted, well-secured platforms and data, and automating policy enforcement through code are all at the heart of our refreshed global strategy. Data Quality, Simplification, Environmental Stability, Automation, and Service Excellence are the key pillars and priorities on our strategic journey.Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve globally from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We‚Äôll enable growth and progress together.The Infrastructure Intermediate Technology Analyst is an intermediate level role responsible for assisting with LAN / WAN and help desk administration activities, including network maintenance, technical guidance, and security in coordination with the Technology Infrastructure team. The overall objective is to use infrastructure technology knowledge and identified policies to process data, resolve issues and execute administrative tasks.Responsibilities:As a team member of NSS, your responsibilities includes:  Providing Technical Support for the firm‚Äôs global network with a focus on both network infrastructure projects and infrastructure break fixes.  To represent Network Services Support (NSS) professionally on conference calls with cross functional partners throughout the technology organization while conducting in depth technical investigations of ongoing incidents involving network connectivity and performance issues.  Ensuring infrastructure changes, authorization requests, communications to stakeholders for post change testing, arrangement of hardware replacements are completed complying with established process and execute due diligence in planning to prevent causing disruption of services, in compliance with defined IT processes and procedures.  Display competency and professionalism on conference calls for major incidents which may or may not be due to a failure in NSS managed technology infrastructure. Ability to drive major incident calls as the lead network representative with assertiveness, logical troubleshooting along with clear and concise communication towards both external and internal stakeholders.  Performs post mortem Root Cause Analysis for complex, high visibility issues or major incidents within tight timeline and the ability to drive vendors assertively to produce justifiable root causes in a professional manner.  Maintain focus and poise during the support cycle and work through all challenges with a results-oriented attitude and relentless focus on enhanced customer service through rapid incident resolution.  Collaborate and communicate accurately with people at different technical knowledge level ranging from Subject Matter Experts, Services Managers to Vendor Support Teams, etc, with the goal of aligning all parties towards achieving incident resolution as quickly as possible.  Good understanding  of Software defined networking (SDN) technologies concepts and the evolution and deployment approaches of SDN technology across traditional IP networks.  Perform pre-defined configuration assurance/standard checks to satisfy Risk  Control and Safety  Soundness initiatives as part of proactive configuration management of all NSS managed technology infrastructure.  Refine and improve existing processes to accomplish the desired results with better efficiencies and effectiveness.  Maintain written operational procedures for the organization including document reviews at predefined intervals, ad-hoc procedure updates in response to operational events, and consistently high quality document management.Skills and Experience Required  3-5 years of experience in providing network operations supporting a network with 1000+ nodes.NOC (Network Operations Center) experience or large financial institution network operation/implementation experience is highly preferred.Expert level working knowledge of enterprise TCP/IP communications (IPv4, QoS, IPSEC, VPN, etc)  Coding/SRE skills an added advantage  Experience in supporting Load Balancers, DNS, DHCP.  Strong knowledge of network protocol analysis using industry standard toolsets such as Wireshark capable of performing in-depth packet capture analysis.  Expert working knowledge following routing protocols:  BGP, OSPF, RIP, Multicast  Strong working knowledge of IPSLA probes, EEM Applets, application specific network performance analysis, and TCP/IP optimization mechanisms for maximizing application performance across enterprise networks  Strong working knowledge of common security threats facing enterprise networks including DDOS (Distributed Denial of Service) and various defensive mechanisms and threat mitigation strategies.  Industry certifications includes; CCNP, JNCIS, JNCIP, etc  Strong knowledge in SDWAN technology.  Intermediate to Expert software or programming knowledge in Python, JSON, Certified Scrum Master, NSO and in Terraform, AWS (Solutions Architect), Kubernetes, is a plus.*A commensurate knowledge base in absence of certification is acceptable.General Attributes, Characteristics, and Capabilities  Highly assertive communications skills, commanding personality while maintaining professionalism. Ability to engage a large audience and lead the discussion with clear, concise, and highly assertive communication.  Capable of understanding customers‚Äô requirements and setting the correct expectation to stakeholders to prevent re-work or incorrect project delivery.  Effective prioritization skills and high energy.  Ability to work in a fast-paced network operations  environment.   Ability to work under pressure with conflicting priorities and a fluctuating and potentially voluminous operational and project based workload.  Ability to articulate technical information to large audience with various levels of technical knowledge base, including a business management audience that may lack a deep technical understanding of internetworking technology solutions.  Ability to drive communication between business leaders and IT.  Must exhibit sound and comprehensive communication and diplomacy skills to exchange complex information with inherent confidence.  High sense of urgency and commitment to exceed customer expectations.  Strong personal work ethic, inspires excellence and enthusiasm amongst peer group  Resilient and highly responsive in overcoming adversity, ability to work through a multitude of challenges/obstacle in order to achieve the desired end result  Process oriented; self-disciplined and settles well into established systems and structures. Focuses on the journey as well as the destination.  Ability and flexibility to operate within tightly controlled operational procedures.   Proficiency in managing customer satisfaction requirements within the confines or operational procedures to achieve a suitable outcome for all stakeholders.  Demonstrated technical competencies and history of increased responsibilities during previous three years.   Strong dedication towards continual growth and self-improvement including year-over-year progression in industry certifications and overall technical proficiencies and knowledge base.  Strong analytical, organizational, written and interpersonal skillsEducation:  Bachelor‚Äôs/University degree or equivalent experienceThis job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

title: JOB-28159 Customer Care Specialist
description: Position Summary: The Customer Care Specialist performs a broad range of functions in support of the customer ordering process, from order entry, inventory and planning collaboration, logistics and shipping involvement, customs clearance and ultimately delivery. Position Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢	Validate technical aspects of orders to ensure order accuracy, completeness and technical feasibility along with company requirements for shipping and revenue recognition.‚Ä¢	Provide customers and sales with order verification, updates on delivery dates, product availability and pricing.‚Ä¢	Forward looking review of backlogs and manages ship schedule to ensure timely delivery.‚Ä¢	Identify and pass sales leads to sales team as appropriate.‚Ä¢	Provide phone and email support for order and delivery related enquiries.‚Ä¢	Drive cross-functional efforts to remove roadblocks that cause delays in order processing and deliveries. Independently troubleshoot complex order and delivery issues.‚Ä¢	Coordinate and assist Shipping to prepare appropriate shipping and trade compliance documentation, work closely with freight forwarders or shipping partners to ensure timely delivery.‚Ä¢	Keeps records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, complaints, and comments, as well as actions taken through Case Management.‚Ä¢	Analyzes problems, determines approach within guidelines, compiles and analyzes data and prepares reports for ad-hoc transactional use and ability to analyze data to drive decision making.‚Ä¢	Drives and Owns MyIllumina / B2B adoption through tailored interaction.‚Ä¢	Develop understanding of Illumina's account management requirements and identify opportunities to improve the customer experience.‚Ä¢	Initiate customer visits and identify areas of improvements on order-to-delivery process, and propose solutions to close process gaps.‚Ä¢	Establish end-to-end order fulfilment process workflow to support emerging geographies across South Asia.‚Ä¢	Partner with cross functional Illumina and sales channel partner to enable smooth order processing and delivery to customer.Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.Position Requirements: ‚Ä¢	Experience working with a freight forwarder or strong experience with international logistics preferred.‚Ä¢	Functional knowledge of ERP, CRM, eCommerce and MS Suite‚Ä¢	Strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment, in both leadership and member role‚Ä¢	Demonstrated ability to multi-task, work in team settings, and work independently when required.‚Ä¢	Must be very detail oriented.‚Ä¢	Understand and/or deploy key internal business processes.‚Ä¢	Strong organization and time management skills‚Ä¢	Good understanding of policies, practices and procedures‚Ä¢	Demonstrate skills, knowledge and ability to recognize matters needing attention and initiate action‚Ä¢	Self-motivated with a desire to provide excellent customer service‚Ä¢	Basic experience in creating, sorting and review reports All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.Preferred Experience/Education/Skills: ‚Ä¢	At least 3 years of customer support experience.‚Ä¢	B.S in related fields.

title: Product Manager
description: FinLync is a growing FinTech, focused on Corporate / Open Banking, based in Singapore, with hubs in New York, LA and Paris. We have built out an initial suite of SAP-and other ERP-native Apps that give treasurers and cash managers beautifully designed and instant (API-driven) cash management experiences, fully embedded in their existing ERP System.Given the high quality and product-market fit of our apps, we have multiple success stories with global banks and MNCs. We are starting on our next phase of growth and are both delivering on current commitments, innovating our existing apps, and building out new innovative app products that solve the needs of MNCs, allowing them to gain the end-user experience from Bank APIs.In this role, you will be a hands-on product manager, building innovative and category-defining applications for corporate banking. You will leverage your deep expertise but take a green-field and innovative approach to functional design. You will work with top talent developers to design and manage the build out of new maverick apps for bank‚Äôs new APIs.Your role  responsibilies  Manage the product backlog and application roadmap for FinLync‚Äôs Bank API aggregator  Work closely with the Head of Product and the CTO to maintain and evolve the product vision  Collaborate with other Product Managers to ensure alignment with other FinLync applications and projects  Work closely with the Engineering team to ensure alignment on product development and direction  Prioritize, plan and execute API integrations through market analysis, effort assessment and client requirements  Develop product documentation including specifications, wireframes, and process flows  Perform product acceptance testing activities and ensure requirements were understood and implemented as requestedTo succeed in this role, you must have:  Minimum 5 years‚Äô experience as a software Product Manager  Good understanding of product and software lifecycle management, especially in an Agile methodologies environment  Proven experience with one or more of the following: Payments APIs, API aggregators, Corporate Banking APIs, Cash Management, or Treasury Management systems  Experience managing requirements and issues in JIRA  Excellent written and spoken English communications skillsA dynamic and versatile individual who can be both functionally hands-on and take ownership  A product management and innovative mindset and not a legacy programming mindset  A self-starter, super smart and curious individual who wants to be part of a disruptive and fun ventureFinLync is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status. If you have a disability and need assistance with our employment application process, please email us to obtain assistance.
