title: Regional Market Access Senior Manager (Opthalmology)
description: Regional Market Access Senior Manager (Opthalmology)The Market Access Senior Manager for the Asia Pacific (AP) region, reporting to the Regional Market Access Director, AP, will deliver and implement the AP Market Access strategy for Ophthalmology products aligned to the priorities of the relevant Integrated Brand Value Team (IVT). The MA Senior Manager provides strategic market access leadership at the brand level, authoritatively representing the MA function within the IVT, building strong relationships and effective collaboration within the matrix. In doing so, the MA Senior Manager will shape the IVT agenda and decision-making to ensure that strategic plans fully meet the needs of market access in key countries. The MA Senior Manager will represent AP in brand level interactions with Global Market Access to shape the global market access strategies, including integrated evidence generation plans and payer tools that meet the needs of the region. The MA Senior Manager takes a lead in development of regional brand value propositions and collaborates through the functional network and the IVT model with AP operating company Market Access managers to deliver timely, optimal reimbursement in a highly challenging environment across a diverse region with complex and differing needs. The MA Senior Manager must understand the needs of countries across AP and develop appropriate solutions for countries.In this role, you will:Lead the market access strategy for the brand(s) within the responsibility of the IVT  The MA Senior Manager is a core member of the IVT and as such will take an accountable, proactive role in crafting AP brand strategy for Ophthalmology products both within and outside of the area of functional responsibility, demonstrating an ability to contribute broadly to strategic decisions  Take a leadership role in representing the needs of the MA function at the IVT, bringing a strategic mindset and collaborative approach to ensuring that strategic plans and investment decisions meet the needs of market access in AP  Fully engage in key IVT processes, shaping the thinking and bringing a payer perspective to creation of all business planning, forecasting and regional evidence generation planning  Represent IVT at senior level reviews with AP Strategy Organization and AP Leadership Team, bringing a clear, compelling position aligned to IVT strategy  Collaborate with the IVT leads and other colleagues in presenting an aligned voice to global so that evidence generation strategies are aligned to the needs of AP  Take the lead in developing and delivering a full range of tools that support optimal market access across AP  Maintain a deep understanding of diverse and complex market access and reimbursement processes across the region, and bring this knowledge and insight into the strategic thinking of the IVT  Take budgetary responsibility for defining and managing the MA component of IVT discretionary budgets, making sure that spending is managed effectively throughout the year and to planLead Market Access strategy development ensuring strategic alignment across countries and with Global  Lead the AP MA functional network, bringing the Operating Company view into IVT discussions and collaborating with countries on the creation of market access tools and deliverables  Partner with Global Market Access CMALs to co-create pricing and reimbursement strategies for the brand, effectively representing AP needs through the extended market access team (EMAT).  Partner with global colleagues on the execution of payer research and provide support to discussions on the need and timing for early scientific advice  Work with pricing colleagues to provide expert perspectives on the establishment of pricing policies  Represent AP as the AP market access representative of the PRIT, taking fact-based, equitable, Credo-based decisions for our business, and involving senior leaders as needed  Take accountability as part of the broader market access team (global, region, op co) to create and implement innovative access model frameworks that secure pricing and reimbursement across countries  Take accountability for launch readiness for the brand making sure that tools such as health economic models are delivered on time and to high quality  Keep up to date with scientific developments, bringing the latest techniques and analyses to build the strongest possible value proposition  Take the lead in commissioning and managing evidence generation projects that fall within the remit of MA, such as database analyses and patient surveys and partner effectively with medical affairs to develop compelling RWE and clinical studies that support market access  Understand the patient perspective of the disease and recommend patient reported outcome measure and studies than can support the patient voice in key payer negotiations  Develop deep expertise into the clinical area of responsibility, gaining a deep understanding of treatment pathways and the pathology of the disease  Take a lead role in co-creating the global value dossier to meet the needs of reimbursed and self-pay market archetypes. Ensure market access AP needs are considered in the creation of target product profiles and labelling discussions through partnership with Global  Use external interactions with relevant partners (e.g., physicians and payers) to validate product and evidence generation strategy through either consultations or Advisory Board meetings  Conduct regular country visits, where possible, engaging with local market access teams. Build a culture of trust that facilitates honest, open discussions about pricing and access  Champion collaboration and seamless working with functions in Market Access including Pricing, RWE and Policy, making sure that priorities are jointly agreed so that deliverables are agreed and expectations managedQualifications   The successful candidate preferably has a substantial Pharmaceutical background  with demonstrated Regional (APAC) mind-set with the ability to assimilate complex science and data quickly.  A minimum of a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a Biology, Pharmacy, Medicine, or Ophthalmology-related field is required.  An advanced degree in a Market Access-related field is highly desirable (Market Access-related fields include Health Services Research, Health Economics / Economics, Psychometrics, Health Policy, Outcomes Research, and Pharmacy Administration).  Progressive market access/pricing experience in Ophthalmology products is required with a proven and consistent track record of success in delivering market access.  Knowledge of healthcare systems in key AP markets is required.  Experience in an AP HTA market is preferred.  Diversity of experience encompassing market access roles, ideally at both operating company and regional/Global level. Experience of leading market access for launch products at regional or Operating Company level is preferred.  A strong technical knowledge of all aspects of market access and of payer processes across countries.A track record of effectively operating in complex results driven organisations  Experience with RD programs and the development of commercial and evidence generation strategy is preferred.  Must exhibit behaviours aligned to the JJ Global Leadership Profile including but not limited to: integrity-credo based actions, collaboration and teamwork, sense of urgency, results driven and people development.  This position requires up to 25% travel.

title: Visiting Research Fellow (Diagnostic Radiology)
description: The National University of Singapore invites applications for 8 Visiting Research Fellow positions in the Department of Diagnostic Radiology, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine.  Appointments will be made on a 2 years contract basis.The Department of Diagnostic Imaging (DDI) is the clinical service department in the National University Hospital (NUH). With the formation of the National University Health System (NUHS), both clinical and academic departments come under a common governing structure. NUHS was incorporated on 23 January 2008 to integrate education, research and clinical care.Purpose of the postThe PI lab aims to develop in vitro diagnostics, in vivo imaging and nanobiotechnology with emphasis on molecular imaging tools and drug and gene delivery techniques. The Visiting Research Fellows will be responsible to, and work closely with, the Principal Investigator and the team members to undertake independent and/or collaborative research and to lead on aspects of research strategy within the lab.Main duties and responsibilitiesThe Visiting Research Fellow will be able to:  Independently undertake advanced research in the relevant discipline area using, or developing, the appropriate methods and/or techniques;  Lead and promote activities designed to develop collaborative research with research colleagues and support staff internally and to actively develop appropriate external contacts and networks relevant future collaboration and funding opportunities; Maintain the highest standard of professional conduct and record keeping in accordance with policies and procedures;  Assist with any other duties of a similar nature that are delegated by the PI.  Qualifications  Applicants should possess a Ph.D. or M.D (preferably in biochemistry, pharmaceutical sciences, life sciences, radiology or biomedical engineering), with previous experience in designing research projects. A detailed knowledge of molecular imaging probes and/or nanomedicine is mandatory. Ability to design and perform scientific work independently and collaboratively is a must, as is the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment. Experience with chemistry and radiochemistry, cell culture, animal handling, small animal imaging, and translational research is highly preferred but not required. Motivation and drive to work hard and learn new skills are most important.Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate's qualifications and experience. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.‚Äã

title: Manager, Planning (Apparel)
description: Role  Responsibilities:Position Definition (Key Purpose of the Position) :  This leadership position is responsible to lead all planning activities from long-range (Multi-Horizon) planning to seasonal planning process. You will support the development of seasonal supply planning process and to resolve services issues due to demand shifts, capacity problems, fabric concerns, and forecast variances.  To succeed, you will utilize both relationship building and strong analytical skill sets to drive decision making that ensures processes are integrated and aligned across all regions.  Lead and develop your direct reports under the guidance of VF Guiding Principles. Embrace and foster One VF culture in every interaction with your direct reports, internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams.Key Result Areas:  Lead current planning processes and make process improvements for efficiency in line with team and company strategy  Lead SOP and Critical products/NPI processes and partner with the Regional Planning counterpart to develop and monitor the processes, templates and metrics including target setting, training and process maintenance. Provide a consolidated demand report in global view, prepare a prebuild plan by business team and mitigation plan if capacity is shortfall.  Provide risk and opportunity analysis, and present to senior management and business teams  Enable smooth seasonal/monthly buy through planning analysis/solution to balance demand  capacity  Be a change agent/ambassador throughout the Product Supply and Supply Chain organization by building trust with various levels in the organization, communicate clearly and consistently business objectives and management vision.  Recruit and maintain best in class team to meet or exceed business performance expectations. Foster an environment of empowerment and passion where trust, creativity, innovation and openness can thrive  Provide strategic leadership and mentoring to team members, maximize their development and drive clear succession plansCompetency Requirements :Behavioral Competencies -  Execute Business strategy and vision  Drive operational results  Embrace change and be aware of changes in market, business, customers and proactively takes action to prepare the team to respond to changes  Provide guidance to team, give timely feedback and advice on improvement actions  Understand and support talent development  Support continuous learning  Ensure effective internal and external communication  Build internal and external partnerships  Able to work under pressure with multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines  Experience with working in a team spread out in various geographical locations  Value diversity - working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.  Highest level of integrity, ethics, and honesty  High learning agility  Drive and passion ‚Äì presents a positive outlook at all times and demonstrates a growth mindsetFunctional and other Competencies ‚Äì  Excellent English (writing and speaking) skills. Cantonese and/or Mandarin a plus.  Excellent Excel, Power Point and Presentation skill.  Strong analytical skills and systems knowledge, experience in SAP or Cognos required  Possesses deep functional subject matter knowledge  Understanding of supply chain processes, with experience in forecasting and SOP  Proven management experience including leading, coaching, mentoring, and building effective team within a departmentExperience  Minimum Relevant Experience: At least 7 years‚Äô experience in planning, with ideally some exposure to manufacturing and/or consumer goods such as footwear, clothing, bags  Minimum Supervisory Experience: At least 3 years of strong team leadership experienceAcademic Qualifications  Minimum Degree Held: University/College degree/diploma or above

title: Head of Pursuits, APAC Capital Markets
description: Job Description SummaryJLL‚Äôs Asia Pacific (APAC) Capital Markets team is a high-performing group of real estate investment and business development strategists. We are looking for a Head of Pursuits, Asia Pacific Capital Markets to join our team to focus on driving revenue growth by equipping, enriching and enabling our teams to grow.A core component of our value is the ability to successfully differentiate JLL within a highly competitive marketplace. In this role, you will work closely with our APAC Capital Markets business to deliver the Pursuits team‚Äôs approach to winning business and driving revenue growth. The Head of Pursuits will lead a team of designers and content creators based in Singapore as well as have matrix reporting responsibility for dedicated Pursuits team members based across the major markets in the APAC region. He or she will drive efforts in ensuing JLL Capital Markets is presented in a high-quality manner and continues to differentiate itself as the market leader in Asia Pacific.Key Responsibilities:  Ensure the JLL pursuits team is at the cutting edge of global best practice in regard to content and presentation quality, while embedding the latest digital marketing technology.  Oversee all JLL Capital markets team capability statement and marketing material design, production and messaging.  Lead a team of professionals that maintain the latest pitch templates, track record (Asia  Global) and capability statements.  Ensure the JLL Capital Markets value proposition is embedded in all marketing and pursuits efforts.  Work with the Capital Markets business leaders to achieve the APAC Capital Markets growth strategy by:  Assist in the approach and marketing to the top 20 key clients of the Capital Markets business  Leading the most significant and strategic pursuits both solicited and unsolicited from these key clients.  Establish  a disciplined approach to qualifying pipelines and identifying opportunities to deliver growth and improve win rates.  Manage significant pitch opportunities end to end, including the pre-qualification stage, key issues analysis, strategy formulation, drafting and editing, internal and client debriefs.  Consult and provide advisory support on pitch templates for medium value opportunities.  Work closely with the Pursuits team‚Äôs dedicated graphic design team to achieve exceptional pitch and presentation creative outcomes.  Lead rehearsals and coach the presentation team on engagement, chemistry and flow.  Participate in the firm‚Äôs client intelligence, client experience and client development programmes as they evolve.  Engaging with members of the broader Pursuits team in regional HQ (Singapore) and in other large JLL markets to share best practice.  Lead the roll out of our online pitch management platform and central repository for best-in-class materials to the APAC Capital Markets business.  Produce other sales collateral as required (including copy-writing and graphic design guidance)  Manage dedicated capital markets pursuits resources in JLL APAC countries (currently Japan  Australia)Key Qualifications  A minimum of seven years‚Äô experience working in a professional services firm, ideally in a Business Development or strategic writing capacity.  Strong communicator with excellent writing, presentation and collaboration skills, able to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels.  Working knowledge of the APAC real estate markets is highly advantageous  Strong influencing skills with a high degree of assertiveness - managing stakeholder expectations in a high pressure and time sensitive environment.  Excellent project management skills and ability to multitask and prioritise to meet tight deadlines.  Proven ability in understanding, gathering, analysing and interpreting business data required for business development activities.  Strong, goal driven team player who demonstrates the commitment, creativity and initiative to ensure that the job gets done and done well.  Highly motivated, with a proactive work style and ability to work effectively independently and as part of a team.  Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, knowledge of simple analytics and up to speed with current digital BD techniques and best practices.  A keen desire to learn new technologies that enhance pitch experiences for clients.  Fluent in English; additional relevant languages encouraged.  Must be willing to travel in the region (as required).You should also possess strong analytical, communication and team-working skills and be comfortable in dealing with people of all cultures and at different levels across Asia. You should enjoy working in a positive, dynamic, multi-national environment and be comfortable contributing innovative ideas, insights and suggestions on how to improve the way we conduct, present and communicate our expertise. You should embrace the latest available technology tools as a leverage to source, prepare and deliver up-to-date, world-class data analytics to both internal and external stakeholders.What we can do for you:At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realize your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.

Administration or equivalent).‚Ä¢    Have at least 5 years‚Äô background in a technology or resourcing and/or researcher role‚Ä¢    In-house recruiting experience would be an added advantage.‚Ä¢ process.‚Ä¢    Manage recruitment administration and maintain accurate candidate records and data management in the relevant systems.‚Ä¢    Have a sense of ownership and be a self-starter with initiative, enthusiasm and drive.‚Ä¢    Thrive on change and enjoy the challenge and rewards of working in a fast paced, dynamic and growing environment.‚Ä¢    Have strong planning and time management skills.‚Ä¢    Be an effective communicator with good written and verbal skills.‚Ä¢    Possess strong stakeholder management skills, ensuring a strong cadence of communications and provide a high-level title: OTC Derivatives Trade Processor - Applications Development Senior Programmer Analyst
description: Organization Overview: Citi Market Operations and Operations Technology is currently at a pivotal point in its evolution and journey to implement a target operating model. We take pride and are passionate about our People and our culture. We are invested in people and their development. We are transforming and simplifying our operating model creating an exciting environment which encourages diversity of thought and inclusion. We are a dynamic, global and diverse Organization, with a presence in over 60 Countries; covering all front post execution Operations teams including product aligned Middle Office groups, Settlements, Margin, Asset Servicing, Listed Derivative  Commodities Operations. We support an extensive range of Capital Markets products and services including Fixed Income (FX, Rates, Credit, Muni, Cash and Derivatives) where Citi is consistently a dominant top 3 player in the market, Equity (Cash, Derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Futures, Listed Derivatives, FXPB) where Citi has a significant growth program to continue to build out its capabilities and services; and Syndicates where we support both FI and EQ new issues and IPOs. Our Operations groups are core to the success of the Markets business and has significant impact across the lifecycle of a Trade. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including Front Office Sales and Trading Desks, Compliance, Legal, Finance and HR; alongside having significant interaction with our external client base, playing a key role in the overall client experience. We have a Client relationship group dedicated to overseeing the group service performance and strategic partnership for our top tier client base, where we play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a first class experience when doing business with Citi. Our Digitization and Implementation group works alongside our Operations teams delivering automation solutions to solve for operational challenges. We partner with Citi‚Äôs innovation labs to drive optimization and overall play a pivotal role in enabling us to transform to achieve our target operating model. Our Technology groups develop and implement a wide range of applications that support the Operations, Change, Design and Implementation groups in providing innovative products and solutions. We have re-imagined how to provide technology and service in our domain through the alignment of our team vision, culture, and aggressive retirement plan for legacy applications and adoption of a micro-based containerized cloud environment. We encourage our people to create, explore and be adventurous whilst taking measured risk, adopting safe practices to protect the firm. Data lineage and optimization is core to how we develop our eco system. We are growing our capabilities using artificial intelligence, natural language processing and machine learning. Our roles entail ensuring we operate in a robust control environment, whilst in a fast-paced workplace. We comply with global regulations and internal policies and adopt a proactive approach to identifying opportunities to reduce risk through the continuous evaluation of our controls; to protect our clients, the firm and our reputation. We work closely with our external global peers, partners and regulators, and play an integral part in leading an agenda at the forefront to optimize and streamline processes, and drive strategy across our industry.Job DescriptionThe Applications Development Senior Programmer Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for participation in the establishment and implementation of new or revised application systems and programs in coordination with the Technology team. Manage Development teams in an effort to accomplish established goals as well as conduct personnel duties for team (e.g. performance evaluations, hiring and disciplinary actions). Engineering team developing the solutions is based in Canada and India, total team size of ~15.  Utilize in-depth knowledge and skills across multiple Applications Development areas to provide technical oversight across systems and applications  Review and analyze proposed technical solutions for projects  Contribute to formulation of strategies for applications development and other functional areas  Develop comprehensive knowledge of how areas of business integrate to accomplish business goals  Provide evaluative judgment based on analysis of factual data in complicated and unique situations  Impact the Applications Development area through monitoring delivery of end results, participate in budget management, and handling day-to-day staff management issues, including resource management and allocation of work within the team/project  Ensure essential procedures are followed and contribute to defining standards negotiating with external parties when necessary  Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standardsQualifications and Skills:  Master‚Äôs degree in computer science or equivalent work experience preferred  Extensive work experience (10+) in hands-on software development.  Hands on technological and analytical skills  Cloud native patterns ‚Äì DevOps, Continuous Delivery, Microservices, Containers.  Realtime streaming applications using high performance messaging platform  Transaction Processing Database tech - ORaaS, MS SQL, MaaS  Language: Python and Java  OS:  Linux  Excellent organizational and leadership abilities.  Highly analytical mind, with an ability to see both the big picture and the details.  Strong, influential communicator who is articulate and concise, demonstrated success interacting with senior management both in the business, corporate functions as well as the Operations, Business and Technology environments.  Strong risk management and control mindset.  Provides evaluative judgment based on analysis of factual information in complicated, unique and dynamic situations; draws on diverse range of internal and external sources  Self-reliant, good problem solver, results oriented  Ability to establish and build trust with professionals throughout the business as a leader, advisor and business partner to the organization with a clear client orientation. title: Client Services Project Manager
description: How Will You Make an Impact?Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $30 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 80,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com.What will you do? title: Motor Vehicle Spray Painter
description: 1. title: Senior QA Engineer
description: Job Summary:Biofourmis is looking for smart and capable Senior Quality Assurance Engineer on our Product team to join our ranks. The ideal candidate will be working closely with our product managers, developers and operation team to derive and execute feature tests and impacted feature testcases. This role will be leading a team and reporting to the VP of Product Management.Responsibilities:  Responsible for e2e test and release of new features/product with the best quality.  Understand the product/feature in-depth from the end user point of view and also the underlying implementation.  Working closely with Product manager, FrontEnd and Backend developers to understand the feature and the implementation to derive and execute feature tests and impacted feature testcases.  Debug failed testcases by analyzing logs and API responses and report bugs with details. Follow-up on bugs to closure.  Understand automation framework and add automation testcases for the new features and regression testcases  Contribute in improving engineering experience by evaluating/developing tools/frameworks/pipelines/reporting dashboards etc..  Continuously improve Product Development practices by introducing quality checkpoints/gates at every stage in SDLC.  Represent the Quality Engineering team in all the product and engineering discussions.  Responsible for test Strategy, Planning, Estimation, execution, retro, reporting.Experience / Training:  With a minimum of 5 years‚Äô experience and shipped at least 2 software products.  Hands on experience in testing Android, iOS Mobile apps and APIs.  Should be able to go through requirement docs and derive test cases for new features along with impacted features. Work closely with the Product team to assess Customer Experience.  Should have deeper understanding of the product at implementation level, should be able to analyze logs and API responses in Microservice integration level.  Should have exposure to Agile and sprint and short release cycles working models.  Should have coding experience and hands on with automation (Web, Mobile app and API automation)Education:  Masters/Bachelor degree from EngineeringSkills:  Knowledge on Tools : Charles, Postman, UI Automation Tools(Selenium, Appium etc..), Testing Frameworks (Mocha, TestNG etc.. ), Languages (Any OOPs language, TypeScript, Go, Java etc..)  Team player who endorses collaborative work style.  Excellent communication skills - very good at inter and intra-team communication. Communicate effectively with Stakeholders : Product, Developers, TPM and Platform teams

title: Sr. Partner Development Manager
description: Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a dynamic results oriented candidate to join as the Partner Development Manager, Singapore MarketAs the Partner Development Manager within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape and deliver on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS' services and solutions within the portfolio of partners and solution providers.Your broad responsibilities will include helping to define and execute against the partner program, establishing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these organizations in order to build long-term business and marketing opportunities. The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CXO/VP level, as well as a technical background that enables them to easily interact with software developers and architects. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions. The candidate for this role should also have experience working with large Telcos, ITO providers, etc. and be able to manage complex partnerships and be comfortable, working across various teams and earn trust. The candidate should be a self starter, self motivated, a driver who gets things done and has a bias for action and delivering results.Other responsibilities include:  Serve as a key member of the Singapore team in helping to drive the overall AWS partner strategy  Have a broad based understanding of cloud technologies  Develop a group of committed partners including a plan to recruit, on-board, educate and measure them in the region  Develop and execute the strategic business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. sales, marketing, legal, support, etc.).  Work with specific prospects/partners to develop the business value proposition for using our services and solutions for the specific prospects/partners; educate and enable them for using AWS solutions  Put in place plans and execute upon, partner originated pipeline  Prepare and drive Qrtrly business reviews with the senior management team regarding progress against budgeted plan and any potential roadblocks to execution  Manage complex contract negotiations and serve as a liaison to the legal group  Develop long-term strategic partnerships in support of the market strategyBasic qualificationsThe right person will have a balance of technical and analytical background; possess extensive sales and/or business development experience. Other requirements include:  Degree in relevant disciplines with at least 15 years of working knowledge of tech companies  Knowledge of working with Telcos, large ITO providers, MSPs, etc. is a plus.  Extensive channel and alliances management experience in Singapore and ASEAN, is an essential requirement to be successful in this role  Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizationsPreferred qualifications  Degree/MBA in relevant disciplines with at least ten years of working knowledge of software development tech companies .  Extensive channel and alliance experience in the ASEAN region  Experience working within the enterprise software industry is highly desired, especially in the virtualization, cloud or enterprise software spaces.  Strong verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.  Exposure to and experience is developing channel programs to deliver sustainable revenue.  Culturally aware and have good interpersonal skills; able to collaborate across different functional teams and internal stakeholders.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

title: Quality Assurance Engineer, Enterprise Data Products
description: Join the Fast-Growing Enterprise TeamAs part of the Enterprise Partnership and Solution (EPS) Platform Product Team, you help internal and enterprise customers build what's next for their business. Leveraging cutting-edge intelligent enterprise tools, powered capabilities in big data, AI, and other areas. Through years of development by the research team, we add value to our enterprise customers to focus on what truly matters. In-depth understanding of the business, communicate and collaborate with various roles across teams, to create value for the business in an all-round way, without setting boundaries for work.What you should have:  Bachelor's Degree or above, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, and other related majors, with at least 5 years of data testing experience. Proactive and strong in learning, analysing, and resolving problems.  Experience in testing big data and cloud-related products is a plus.

description: Area Vice President, Sales, AsiaSales and Business Development | SingaporeOur agreement with employeesDocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what‚Äôs right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you‚Äôll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.The teamOur Sales and Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process‚Äîfrom preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team‚Äôs partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.This PositionThe ideal candidate must possess the ability to drive sustainable revenue growth and motivate a sales team including Regional Vice President (RVP), Sales Managers and Account Executives (AE's) to achieve sales quota across Asia. Key markets within Asia include Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines across all customer segments - from SMB through to Enterprise accounts.This sales leader must be able to identify and test new growth opportunities and new investments that will drive sales efficiency and impact. They must also measure, monitor and hold teams accountable for their activities and results, as well as lead by example.The candidate is also required to assist in deal strategy sessions with AE's and first line leaders, assist in account health monitoring, and effectively maintain DocuSign's value within accounts. This leader should mentor direct reports individually while also building a strong cohesive, collaborative sales team. They are also responsible for monitoring forecasting efforts, customer satisfaction, and delivering on their team‚Äôs quota.This position is a People Manager and reports to the Group Vice President of Sales and General Manager, Asia Pacific  Japan (based in Sydney, Australia). This position is Flex.Responsibilities‚óè Grow DocuSign Gross New Monthly Recurring Revenue (GNMRR) and Pipeline for the Asia business across all customer segments (Small Medium Business, Mid Market, Major Accounts and Enterprise)‚óè Become a figurehead for the business to ensure the highest levels of quota performance and customer engagement‚óè Continually refine and implement changes to sales motions across both Install Base and New Logo customers‚óè Work with cross functional business partners, APJ Senior Leadership and Asia sales team members to identify, test and implement new sources of revenue growth for the region‚óè Assesses sales activities  forecasts to determine sales progress  required improvements.‚óè Drive a consistent sales approach across teams, including multi-product selling, vertical market management, forecasting, prospecting within account base, negotiations,  other necessary skills‚óè Maintain/protect DocuSign core values by hiring culturally aligned and diverse team members  leading by example‚óè Maintain executive level customer relationships, and develop and implement strategies for expanding our customer base‚óè Provide value in complex negotiations and closing new business, including appropriate use of senior sales and APJ executives to maximize results‚óè Work with each team manager to develop and implement business and sales territory plans to achieve sales quota‚óè Ensure the team effectively leverages sales tools and systems consistently and in alignment with DocuSign‚Äôs Rules of Engagement.‚óè Communicates and prioritizes product and business needs from the field to appropriate corporate functions eg: Product, Engineering.‚óè Identifies and supports opportunities for the training  professional development of department personnel.Basic Qualifications‚óè BA/BS in a business or a technical related field of study from an accredited college or university.‚óè 10-15+ years of leadership experience in technology and software sales‚óè Proven experience in successfully scaling and building out new geographies in a fast paced market‚óè Strategic sales experience and revenue achievement selling multiple enterprise software offerings, while building satisfied, loyal and reference-able customers‚óè Significant experience in managing on a day-to-day basis a sales business with a strong cadence of deal closure on a monthly and quarterly basis; track record of consistent overachievement of quota and revenue goals.‚óè Proven success working within a highly matrixed organization and establishing strong relationships across all functions.‚óè Operates well in a fast paced, dynamic environment without requiring significant supervision.Expected Competencies/Skills‚óè Understanding of Asia market including Singapore, Hong Kong, South Korea and the Philippines‚óè Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain effective business, sales and vertical market plans across all Customer Segments and Account types‚óè Proven ability to influence senior leadership‚óè SaaS based business application experience‚óè Demonstrated ability to successfully resolve situations that are broadly defined, complex, diverse, and occasionally, unprecedented.‚óè Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.‚óè Excellent operational/analytical skills - reporting, forecasting, data analysis skills; operations management experience‚óè Willingness to travel 25% or more as needed (post pandemic)About UsDocuSign¬Æ helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that‚Äôs a good thing.DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer. title: Junior Quantity Surveyor
description: DPR Construction is a forward-thinking international general contractor and construction manager, specialising in technically complex and sustainable projects for the advanced technology/mission critical, life sciences, healthcare, higher education and commercial markets. Founded in 1990, DPR is a privately held, employee-owned company that has grown to a multi-billion-dollar organisation with offices around the world, making it one of the largest general contractors in the USA and a great story of entrepreneurial success.Based in Singapore, DPR‚Äôs Asia Pacific operations bring global, technical and construction expertise to the Asia Pacific region. A BCA registered contractor, DPR specializes in the commercial, advanced technology and life sciences markets.The Junior Quantity Surveyor should have at least 1 to 5 years of commercial Fit-Out experience. He/She will be responsible and accountable for all financial aspects of the project and reports to the Project Manager.He/She will work closely with all members of the Project Team and will be responsible for the following:Proposal StageDuring the proposal stage the Junior Quantity Surveyor in conjunction with the Proposals Team contributes, if applicable, to:¬∑ Preparing the budget and prelims build up¬∑ Obtaining Contractor bids and compiling the pricing document¬∑ Assist the preparation of the final proposal document.Pre-Construction Stage¬∑ Production of Procurement Strategy document for approval by the professional team and Client (in Conjunction with the Project Manager)¬∑ Pre Qualification of Trade Contractors not on the approved database.¬∑ Production of Trade Package Procurement Document in conjunction with Team Leader/Nominated Manager and Construction Manager for issue to Design Team and for use in production of bid documentation¬∑ Budgeting and Costing - Comments on existing Cost Plan, prepares a detailed cost plan for monitoring costs of the Project¬∑ Procurement - Prepares Proposed List of Tenderers in conjunction with the Project Manager and the Construction Manager, if applicable; monitors the Tender Event Schedule; compiles the trade contract bid documents, carries out tender analysis and issues Purchase Orders; instructs Contractors; advises on product selection, specifications; assists with value engineering; advises on the selection of Trade Contractors¬∑ Information Control - assists with distribution of drawings and other relevant information.Construction Stage¬∑ Procurement - Continues the pre-construction tasks¬∑ Attends Design Team meetings and Contractor meetings as appropriate¬∑ Assist in control of all drawings and other information¬∑ Manages Change Orders in conjunction with the Project Manager: Analyses impact on overall costs and programme; Offers alternative solutions; Raises Change Orders, and maintains Change Order Log; Agrees fixed price with Client's team and Contractors¬∑ Prepares and issues Addendum Purchase Orders¬∑ Valuations - Prepares, submits and agrees periodic valuations for work completed to date with Contractors and the Client¬∑ Cost Control and Reporting: prepares Final Account Reconciliation; creates regular budget and price updates; updates computerised Cost Control System; prepares the Monthly Cost and Progress Report.Post-Construction StageThe Junior Quantity Surveyor will assist the close out of the project including:¬∑ Agreeing final accounts with Trade Contractors and the Clients representatives¬∑ Closing the project financially¬∑ Organising the archiving of project documentation¬∑ Preparing draft and final Cost Value Reconciliation and Cost Report Reconciliation.QualificationsWe are looking for a flexible, detail-oriented team player with the ability to manage multiple tasks, manage project teams, produce quality work, and consistently meet deadlines. The successful candidate will possess:¬∑ Excellent listening skills and strong communication skills¬∑ Ability to mentor others and lead by example¬∑ Ability to identify and resolve complex issues¬∑ Ability to create and support team morale¬∑ Able to manage the monthly reporting process including cost value reporting (CVR)¬∑ Experience in commercial management of sub-contractors including procurement, valuations and final accounts¬∑ Knowledge and experience of dispute resolution¬∑ Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Project and Accounting Cost Management software (Procore or similar).¬∑ 1 to 5 years of experience, preferably within DPR‚Äôs core markets¬∑ Diploma/ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Quantity Surveying or other commercially related discipline¬∑ A strong work ethic and a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude¬∑ Preferably have good knowledge of Corporate Fit-out .People who succeed at DPR are:¬∑ Honest and trustworthy¬∑ Self-aware and personable¬∑ Humble, patient and selfless¬∑ Open, imaginative and creative¬∑ Positive, energetic and with a sense of urgencyDPR has been internationally recognised for its strong company culture, based on a well-defined purpose ‚ÄúWe Exist to Build Great Things,‚Äù and four core values: integrity, enjoyment, uniqueness and ever forward. A flat, titleless organisation that empowers people at all levels to make decisions, DPR ranked on FORTUNE‚Äôs ‚Äú100 Best Companies to Work For‚Äù list for five consecutive years. For more information, visit www.dpr.com.

title: Sr. Partner Development Manager
description: Red Hat and AWS have long-standing relationships supporting customers running Red Hat mission critical applications on AWS.AWS is looking for a Partner Development Leader in APAC who will work closely with Red Hat Sales Leadership and senior executives of SI Partners in the AWS ecosystem to help our customers with Red Hat workloads such as OpenShift, RHEL, JBoss etc.As a Partner Development Manager you will be primarily responsible for accelerating joint sales with the Red Hat field and SI partners in APAC . Candidate will be knowledgeable on Red Hat software including RHEL, OpenShift, value proposition, their markets, business challenges and customer opportunities and have the ability to sell the benefits of the collaboration to customers, partners and internal audiences. You will lead in developing and executing annual strategic plans, building executive relationships, running monthly and quarterly pipeline reviews with Red Hat fields and key SI Partners and ensure that the IBM AWS partnership is proceeding to its respective goals in an effective timely fashion.Key Responsibilities:  Joint Sales: Set the overall strategy, drive sales execution, pipeline review, coordination of leads from marketing activities with the Red Hat field.  SI Ecosystem Development: Develop a key set of SI partners globally that can help our customers to use Red Hat technology especially OpenShift on AWS. Develop a joint sales and GTM plan with these key SIs around Red Hat products.  Progress monitoring: Tracking progress, including coordinating the definition and reporting of the KPIs, as well as leading periodic health checks.  Process management: Establishing and ensuring smooth operation of the collaboration ground rules, such as the protocol for formal governance meetings and procedures for decision-making, project team meetings, data exchange, and other kinds of interactionBasic qualifications¬∑ 7+ years of sales experience in the IT industry, with Enterprise software. ¬∑ Knowledge of Red Hat software including OpenShift ¬∑ Knowledge of Red Hat SI Ecosystem. ¬∑ Experience engaging and influencing senior executives and strong familiarity with decision making processes in enterprise customers ¬∑ Demonstrated experience working and communicating with multiple stakeholders and cross- functional teams including direct and channel marketing, solution architect teams, and product management and account management teams. ¬∑ Verbal and written communications skills are a must, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.Preferred qualifications¬∑ 7+ years of sales experience at a global technology company and experience working with large SIs. ¬∑ MBA. ¬∑ Direct experience in managing SI alliances ¬∑ Understanding of AWS, cloud architecture and infrastructure ¬∑ Presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to cross-functional audiences ¬∑ Organizational skills and attention-to-detail with the ability to set clear priorities in a fast paced, dynamic work environment ¬∑ Inquisitive; will always ask questions to see the ‚Äúbig picture‚Äù or get a handle on the details ¬∑ Entrepreneurial, self-starter Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Locations: Singapore

title: Presales Solutions Architect
description: We are looking for a passionate Cloud Solution Architect to be based in Singapore and support engagements across ASEAN as required. This is a pre-sales engineering role where you would need to build trust with customers, leading to successful deal closures. You will be responsible for all aspects of the solutions engagement, including architectural design sessions, driving proof of concept, project engagements as well as initial implementations. The successful candidate has a strong start-up mentality and experience, as well as proven track record within a cross-cultural multi-national corporation.The essential responsibilities of Cloud Solution Architect are to combine business acumen, industry experience and broad technology expertise to work with Customers to develop and execute a strategy resulting in optimum virtualized infrastructure or Cloud solutions.This position involves analysing IT requirements for customers projects and designing of appropriate architecture so that the solutions are implemented in accordance with the clients requirements and industry standards. Whilst, the position requires primarily architectural work (dealing with all components of an IT environment: server, network, security, storage, systems management, integration, backup and recovery), it is expected that the successful candidate also understands these technologies at a deeper level.The position will be required to work with other technology architects, IT specialists, application developers and operations staff to ensure an appropriate solution is designed. You will need to be able to understand and balance requirements from diverse sources in complex environments and translate these into robust solution and infrastructure designs.Role Responsibilities  Work with business sponsors to understand business strategies and objectives  Collaborate with partner account teams to identify prospective infrastructure and cloud opportunities  Develop technical objectives and requirements to achieve business goals, develop proper business cases respective to the industries and prospects  Translate business requirements into technical architectures  methodologies  Develop high-level and detailed-level technical architecture for solutions, leveraging leading frameworks, approaches, and languages  Develop high-level and detailed-level Proof-of-Concepts process  Lead solution design and oversee deployment efforts  Architect infrastructure and cloud solutions to meet the customer‚Äôs business challenges  Be responsible for delivering assessment services and consulting services to the customers  Assist and validate infrastructure and cloud compatibility and viability with original architecture and design  Work closely with different parties to architect end-to-end hybrid cloud solutions  Builds and influences relationships with vendors, partners and customers  Be an industry advocate for Hybrid Cloud Adoption ‚Äì participate in customer/vendors briefings and events speaking opportunitiesTo ensure success in the role, you will possess the following experience  skill sets:  At least 5 years of experience in designing solutions deployed in either Enterprise, Mid-market / Corporate, or SMB environments (Cloud, IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, Backup  DR, etc.)  Advanced knowledge in Digital Transformation, Cloud Migration, well-architected Cloud Framework, Day0-1-2-3 Cloud Ops in the market.  Excellent business acumen with strong ability to map business requirements to technical solutions  At least 5 years of experience of working knowledge of public clouds solution provider (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)  Strong ability to position Enterprise, Mid-market / Corporate, or SMB vs rest-of-world proposition versus other industries  Strong Experience with disaster recovery solutions, business continuity, and backup solutions.  Advanced knowledge on VMware, Microsoft, Linux/UNIX  Solaris/HPUX/Mainframe knowledge is an added plus  Advanced knowledge in storage technologies (SAN, NAS, block, object, JBOD, RAIDs)  Experienced in Networking concepts.  Knowledge in Big Data, Analytics, Application Modernization, and other edge computing technologies  Knowledge in distributed file systems (blockchain)  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Excellent interpersonal and presentation skillsSpecial Considerations for candidates who:  have at least 5 years of experience in designing / implementation / consulting of large-scale private / public / hybrid cloud infrastructure solutions  have attained professional certifications in the following areas with at least 5 years of industry experience in: AWS / Azure / Google Cloud / VMware / GCCI  have strong knowledge of Container  Modern technologies (Dockers, Kubernetes, AWS ECS, Google Cloud Anthos)  are experienced with enterprise database solutions (Cloud SQL, RDS, Oracle, MSSQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis Enterprise, DB2, MariaDB, SAP HANA)  possess the knowledge of DevOps techniques and Agile practices  are proficient in multi-tiered architecture, design and implementationSoft-skillsCommunication / NegotiationCommunicate and provide advice to CxO level discussion. other professionals, effectively utilize group dynamics. Negotiate to define approaches and goals. Lead or join the technical focus discussion for engagements daily to propose and design technical write-ups  SoW for clients business requirements, and ultimately build an effective business case.Problem SolvingDesign solutions in an integrated complex and heterogeneous environments. Define integration architecture, able to articulate architecture decisions. Communicate customer requirements. Validate SoW and service estimates. Develop high level design, detailed design, and SoW. Support presales process.TeamworkWork as a teamplayer and have no issues to be supervised remotely with the same expected quality of work.EducationWe believe your profile  experience is worth more than a long list of educational backgrounds.

title: MECHANICAL SUPERVISOR
description: Responsibilities:  Assist in identification of scope and budget for turnaround jobs on rotating equipment.  Responsible for ensuring availability of spares and manpower required for overhauling of rotating equipment during turnarounds, emergency shutdowns and plant breakdown.  Take lead in coordinating the site activities on rotating equipment during turnaround.  Participate in scope challenge workshops and provide advice on technical issues related to rotating equipment.  Coordinate preparation and execution of overhauling of rotating equipment during turnarounds, emergency shutdowns and equipment breakdowns.  Support Condition Monitoring program (viz. vibration monitoring, oil analysis etc.)  Provide technical support during project execution for rotating equipment e.g. pumps, compressor, steam turbine and etc.  Carry out / Support Root cause Failure Analysis of rotating equipment  Work closely with Mechanical supervisor on daily and shutdown maintenance activities.  Take lead in trouble shooting of problems in rotating equipment.  Take ownership of the current Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) programs optimize the Preventive and Predictive maintenance activities.  Improve the overall mean time between Failure (MTBF) of plant machinery  Responsible for ensuring the preventive maintenance program for rotating equipment is complied with.  Coordinate with contractor and ensure the quality of the job on rotating equipment.  Coordinate overhaul of equipment with local workshops.  Ensure history of all work on rotating equipment is recorded in SAP and other designated places.  Conduct technical evaluation of rotating equipment vendors for minor and major projects.  Carry out inspection during construction  commissioning of rotating equipment for minor and major projects.Requirements  Diplomo or Bachelor Degree in Mechanical Engineering or 2-5 years experience in process industry.  Must have led the overhaul of steam turbines, compressors and pumps.  Should be good in coordination with vendors and contractors.  Exposure to Reliability centered maintenance.  Must possess thorough knowledge of rotating equipment internals.  Must be able to work under pressure and for longer durations in emergencies.  Must have used SAP or other softwares for Planning of resources for maintenance work on rotating equipment.  Must have worked as rotating equipment engineer for at least 3 years.  Working knowledge of industrial codes and standards is desirable  Knowledge of static equipment maintenance and troubleshooting is desirable.  Excellent communication skills  Knowledge of vibration monitoring systems such as Bently Nevada System 1 and steam turbine/compressor application will be an advantage.

title: Data Engineer, Video Infrastructure
description: ByteDance Video Infrastructure is a world-leading video platform that provides multi-media storage, delivery, transcoding, and streaming services. We are building the next generation video processing platform and the largest live streaming network, which provides excellent experiences for billions of users around the world.  Popular video products of ByteDance are all empowered by our cutting-edge cloud technologies. Working in this team, you will have the opportunity to tackle challenges of large-scale networks all over the world, while leveraging your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis, and large-scale system design.  Responsibilities 1. Craft optimal data processing architecture and systems for new data and ETL pipelines. 2. Design, build, and maintain efficient and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data (both large and small amounts). 3. Drive internal process improvements and automate manual processes for data quality and SLA management. 4. Work with different cross-functional partners including CDN, Video Understanding, Video Transcoding, Live Streaming, and Real-Time Communication.Qualifications1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical background involving software/system engineering, or equivalent working experience. 2. Good programming experience with at least one of the following languages: C, C++, Java, Python, or Go. 3. Experience in custom ETL/data pipeline design, implementation, and maintenance. 4. Experience with data processing software (Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive) and algorithms (MapReduce, Flume).

title: Retail Supervisor
description: About usWe pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated, omni-channel women‚Äôs fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010, we‚Äôve grown to 150 people strong, proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia, we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong, China, Philippines and Australia, New Zealand, US, Canada, Macau, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia  Brunei).We are taking our definition of new female retail global, with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman.The teamThe Love, Bonito team is a passionate, dynamic, innovative and fun-loving family. From fashion-lovers, savvy marketers to tech whizzes, we have a diverse team of talented individuals with one unified focus - our customer, the Love, Bonito woman. She is at the heart of everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences, products and content for her. With big dreams and a grand mission, we‚Äôre looking for great like-minded people to join us - people who are as passionate, fearless and entrepreneurial.If you‚Äôre looking for a dynamic, no corporate-BS environment to learn, grow, and really make an impact, we could be the perfect fit for you!The roleYou will play an important role in the building of our retail business unit and representing our brand to the masses. Reporting into the Retail Store Manager, you will be integral to the success of Love, Bonito especially as we go into hyper growth over the next few years!Your main role is to train and coach your co-workers in educating our guests, and maintaining the best customer experience on the sales floor. Through our guest interactions, we aim to empower women to gain confidence through styling and clothing. At Love, Bonito, we put the LB woman at the heart of everything we do.You should have / be  A Love, Bonito brand enthusiast with a contagious passion to deliver the LB guest experience  Able to relate to our mission of empowering women through style, and have a strong personal sense of style and fashion  A strong people-person! You are not afraid of approaching strangers and striking a genuine conversation, and guests aren't afraid to approach you either!  A leader with a proven record of training, coaching, and developing a team of co-workers  A performance-driven professional that drives sales and achieves results for the business through training initiatives  A dependable leader who is open to giving and receiving feedback, and is always hands on deck together with the rest of the team  An insightful problem solver who proactively innovates to improve systems and operationsMain responsibilities  Under the supervision of the Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager, support in day-to-day leadership and key areas of store operations  Work with Store Manager to lead store sales performance by thoroughly understanding sales performance of individual products in order to execute good layout fundamentals  Work with Store Manager to drive customer service excellence - drives KPIs such as CX and NPS scores, Rateit feedback, Lead Gen and the number of compliments every week  Coach staff members in providing the best guest experience, and plays a hands-on role on the sales floor - delegates work, encourages and provides feedback to the team on areas of CS during daily operations  Acts as the outstanding "go to" person who actively builds team cohesion and works with the Store Manager to weed out toxicity in the team‚Äôs dynamics  Provide a seamless shopping experience and ensure that all merchandize are available in all colours, sizes, and quantities on the floor on a daily check basis  Oversee daily and weekly deliverables such as the store checklist and bag-checklists  Receive and process new stock, replenishments, returns, damages and transfers, as well as support all stock-take exercises in accordance to the rules  Cashiering duties using the POS system to process payments and close accounts for the closing shift - be fully equipped with the knowledge and experience to investigate and eliminate daily discrepancies  Work with Store Manager in churning out daily, weekly and monthly rostering in a timely manner  Act as the first interviewer for all walk-in applicants, hiring the correct personnel for team and cultural fit  Using team talks, shares knowledge regarding company general information, fashion news, new product information, customer feedback and staff communicationQualifications  Experience  Minimum 2 years‚Äô experience in a retail leadership role, or equivalent  Completion of tertiary education and a good working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel) will be a plus.Hours  Full-time: 44 hours per week, 5 day work week. Open to both opening and closing shifts. Commission based  All retail staff must work at least one weekend day and on public holidays

title: Data Engineer (TikTok eCommerce)-2022 Start
description: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.We are now looking for talented individuals to join us in 2022 - people who want to inspire creativity and co-create the future with TikTok.Application deadline: November 30th, 2021Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order they apply. The application limit is firm and includes all TikTok/ByteDance jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.About the TikTok eCommerce teamThe mission of the Data Platform Singapore Business Partnering (DPSG BP) team is to empower the TikTok e-commerce business with data. Our goal is to build a Data Warehouse that can cater to batch and streaming data, Data Products that provide useful information to build efficient data metrics  dashboards which will be used to make smarter business decisions to support business growth. If you're looking for a challenging ground to push your limits, this is the team for you!Responsibilities  Translate business requirements  end-to-end designs into technical implementations and responsible for building batch and real-time data warehouse;  Manage data modeling design, writing, and optimizing ETL jobs;  Collaborate with business teams to build data metrics based on data warehouse;  Responsible for building and maintaining data products;  Involvement in rollouts, upgrades, implementation, and release of data system changes as required for streamlining of internal practices.Qualifications  Final year or recent graduate with a background in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related technical discipline;  Solid computer basic knowledge (e.g. data structure  algorithms, SQL and networks);  Strong coding capabilities and mastering at least one programming language (e.g. C/C++/Java/Python/Golang);  Passionate about data warehouse, ETL development, data analysis, and eCommerce;  Good communication skills and a fast learner of new business and technology knowledge.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.If you have any questions, please reach out to us at sg.campus.recruitment@tiktok.com.

title: Site Reliability Engineer, Live Streaming Infrastructure
description: ByteDance Video Infrastructure is a world-leading video platform that provides multi-media storage, delivery, transcoding, and streaming services. We are building the next generation video processing platform and the largest live streaming network, which provides excellent experiences for billions of users around the world.Popular video products of ByteDance are all empowered by our cutting-edge cloud technologies. Working in this team, you will have the opportunity to tackle challenges of large-scale networks all over the world, while leveraging your expertise in coding, algorithms, complexity analysis, and large-scale system design.Responsibilities1. Build global infrastructure for multi-media process, storage and transport, to serve the billions of users all over the world.2. Build live streaming CDN and Video Chat system, deploy nodes globally.3. Build tools, automations, visualizations and monitors to facilitate the operation and optimization of the global infrastructure.4. Engage in and improve the whole service lifecycle, from inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.5. Scale up systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and initiate changes that improve system reliability and processing speed.Qualifications1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical background involving software/system engineering, or equivalent working experience.2. Good programming experience with at least one of the following languages: C, C++, Java, Python, or Go.3. Expertise in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.4. Experience in building solutions with AWS, Google, Azures and other cloud services.5. Experience with CDN, Multimedia, Live Streaming, and WebRTC.6. Familiar with Unix/Linux operating systems.

title: Sr. Partner Development Manager
description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a world-class leader to join our team and accelerate the adoption of AWS cloud computing services worldwide via partner solutions. As a Sr Partner Manager for Strategic Technology Alliances, you will lead the partnership GTM engagement. This role will be a Subject Matter Expert for the assigned partner and their solutions running on AWS. The individual will be familiar with and help in the creation of GTM programs, will effectively leverage other AWS resources to help in the co-selling process, and will engage directly with the AWS and Partner sales teams to drive field enablement, field alignment and incremental joint opportunities. You will also own the overall GTM co-selling goal including AWS-sourced opportunities, will be measured on incremental revenue through their assigned partner, and will be responsible for managing the opportunity pipeline health and reporting metrics.We are always looking to improve and we also recognize there are many ways to lead and partner. We‚Äôre looking for a Think Big leader with diversity in thought who can add to our company skillset by bringing their unique industry knowledge and creativity to our organization. At Amazon, we live our professional lives by the Leadership Principles. When we hire, we look for those who are Amazonian rather than for someone who fits an exact resume mold. To us, Diversity in thought and experience is a good thing. We are hiring for attitude and training for skill because we recognize success takes many paths. We are looking for someone who can help us create the next version of what it means to be a great partner to our ISVs and is passionate about customers. We will coach the right fit.You are an accomplished leader with a strong background in selling technology, experienced at influencing innovation with technology partners and with the presence to engage executive decision makers. You will have strong business development, product management, strategic alliances, and entrepreneurial skills. You can demonstrate an ability to think strategically about new business models, solution selling, and show prior solution and program successes.AWS customers are developing some of the most exciting and innovative new businesses, and partners are using cloud technologies from AWS such as AI and Machine Learning, IoT, security services, compute and storage to dramatically accelerate innovation.Key job responsibilities¬∑ Together with the overall alliance team, define and execute a plan to help our most strategic technology partners transform and grow their businesses for SaaS and Cloud.¬∑ Orchestrate different resources within the AWS organization to support co-selling and GTM activities and create/ maintain a long-term, scalable joint GTM model that drives partner and customer success.¬∑ Collaborate with sales and partner teams to qualify, develop, and execute campaigns to generate new business opportunities across Asia Pacific.¬∑ Be the "Go To" resource to ensure key high-profile joint sales opportunities are sourced, developed and closed.¬∑ Drive sales execution across activities, including coordination of lead generation-related and joint sales enablement activities between your ISV partners and the AWS field organizations.¬∑ Lead regular pipeline reviews to ensure pipeline information is thorough and accurate according to AWS‚Äô sales cycle stages. Hold business reviews with both ISV and AWS sales teams to identify best practices and lessons to be learned.¬∑ Broker internal resources, tools, references and/or investments needed to execute on the business plans in order to help meet the set goals.Basic qualifications¬∑ 10+ years of experience in the technology sales, partner management, business development, product management ¬∑ Experience in business-to-business (B2B) software, including Software as a Service or other cloud-based technologies ¬∑ Experience working for a SaaS company and/or building a partner ecosystem with solutions or innovation programs ¬∑ Experience managing joint GTM initiatives with technology partners, including development and tracking of joint sell-with and sell-through business activities ¬∑ Verbal and written communication skills with experience articulating concepts to cross-functional audiencesPreferred qualifications¬∑ Bachelor engineering or business, or above degree. MBA is a plus ¬∑ Motivated self-starter who thrives on working in complex and challenging environments of a rapidly evolving business ¬∑ Directly sold, supported, or marketed to clients and partners across different market segments ¬∑ Analytical tendencies with a natural curiosity to measure, test, learn and iterate in order to develop scalable programs ¬∑ Project management skills with experience gaining consensus and driving timely deliverables with individuals inside and outside the organization ¬∑ Willing to travel to meet with partners, customers and internal stakeholders, attend events and support field teams on site ¬∑ Familiarity with Salesforce.com and other sales and marketing toolsAmazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
