title: Regulatory Transaction Reporting- Team leader
description: Your role :Do you thrive when navigating complex environments? Are you always up for the next challenge? Do you enjoy managing and developing people?We're looking for someone like that to join our management team in the Regulatory Transaction Reporting (RTR) function. The RTR function supports the core regulatory reporting obligations in the region, namely ASIC, MAS, HKMA and JFSA along with governance of RTR across the whole APAC region. The role will provide varied challenges due to the nature and complexity of the reporting obligations, involves managing two small sized teams and engagement with a large array of other functions  stakeholders within the region and globally.The main activities and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:‚Ä¢ Effectively leading two small teams- One team is responsible for the overall governance and supervision of RTR across the whole APAC region. The other is responsible for the Quality Assurance processes conducted on core regulatory reporting obligations in the region, namely ASIC, MAS, HKMA and JFSA ‚Ä¢ Work with report owners and other stakeholders to ensure all APAC RTR is compliant with an established control framework which includes, for example, tasks such as overseeing all identified issues in Completeness, Accuracy, Timeliness (CAT) of reporting; coordinating periodic review of mandatory documentation across all in scope reports ensuring aligns to prescribed standards.‚Ä¢ Work with the central Quality Assurance team, based in Poland, to ensure that all appropriate Quality Assurance controls are performed to detect issues in reporting and associated controls. Ensure all identified issues are investigated and effectively managed. ‚Ä¢ Prepare and present material for the various Transaction Reporting Governance forums, including two monthly Operating Committees‚Ä¢ Understand the risks associated with transaction reporting. Be vigilant to those risks, manage them and challenge/escalate effectively‚Ä¢ Review existing processes for improvements, control enhancements and automation opportunities‚Ä¢ Represent the APAC RTR function, where required, to support the APAC RTR functional head.Your team :You will be joining the Regulatory Transaction Reporting (RTR) team within the APAC Investment Banking Operations division based in Singapore. The team supports the APAC region in ensuring TR regulation within the region is understood and adhered to. The Singapore RTR function‚Äôs remit is to ensure that we meet all APAC transaction reporting obligations, implement proper governance, supervision and change management across all APAC locations where there are transactional reporting obligations and ensuring quality assurance on post reporting and procedural controlsYour expertise :‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Transaction Reporting regulations in the APAC region preferred‚Ä¢ Strong risk management skillset along with attention to detail. ‚Ä¢ Experience managing successful teams‚Ä¢ Responsible and confident working as a team or under own initiative‚Ä¢ Good relationship management, comfortable challenging those around you and influencing skills across a wide spectrum of partner teams‚Ä¢ Ability to pick up information quickly and turn around deliverables under pressure‚Ä¢ Strong presentation skills, with an ability to summarize technical information concisely for consumption by a varied audience

title: Superintendent (Eunos)
description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION    Since October 2011,Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC)was incorporated as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large.THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 60 programmes and services for theelderly and the sick,families,persons with disabilities, andchildren. We help anyone in need with full respect to their race, colour, creed, language, culture and religion. We have more than 90 programmes and services, reaching out to more than 55,000 people in the community.Together, as ONE THKMC  Empowering the Community.    RESPONSIBILITIES    A Superintendent oversees the operations of residential care facility under the Adults Disability Division. The areas in which the Superintendent is involved include the supervision of:Budget management and development;Residents and clients management, including admission, intake and discharge, assessment and evaluation, programme review and incident reporting;People management;Facility and environmental management.Duties and responsibilitiesThe position of the Superintendent is a managerial and leadership role. The core role and responsibilities of the Superintendent include the following :1.People ManagementOversee and ensure continuity and sustainability of services through recruiting, selecting, orienting, training, assigning, scheduling, coaching, counselling, and disciplining employees;Communicate job expectations and redesign to meet changing needs of clients and residents;Oversee development and management of professional and administrative staff;Select and use advanced analytics, problem solving and communication skills to work with the different levels of staff member;Employ management skills that facilitate collaborative relationships within the operations and other disciplines within the division;Negotiate and resolve conflict;Plan, monitor, appraise, and review workload and staff performance; andEnforce policies and procedures in accordance to SOP and/ or HR policies2.Management ObjectivesContribute knowledge and information, and make recommendations to strategic plans and timely reviewing of milestones;Liaise with MSF, MOH, BOV and other agencies to enhance THKMCs professionalism and reputation;Prepare and complete action plans based on feedback from stakeholders;Implement production, productivity, quality and service standards;Complete audits and licensing requirements;Resolve day to day problems;Review and recommend to implement policies, processes and procedures for Homes in a residential setting and community based programmes to ensure operational continuity and sustainability; andEstablish strong relationships with volunteers and community partners3.Financial ObjectivesMake sound decisions that value effectiveness and prudent use of resources, ensuring efficiency and enhance productivity by forecasting requirements;Oversee and prepare annual budget;Schedule timely expenditures;Review and analyse variances; andInitiate corrective actions to reduce variance and improve cashflow.4.Well-being of residents, clients and caregivers:a.Effective Facility Management:Direct and oversee the running, maintenance and upgrading of physical facilities and amenities;Oversee the development and recommend improvements to Management Committee (MC) and to work closely with THKMC HQ on upgrading of facilities and programmes;Direct and oversee the running of kitchen in compliance with NEAs guidelines on food safety and hygiene, meal delivery and hospital escort services to meet the needs of the clients andDirect and oversee the cleanliness and hygiene standards within all facilities in accordance with NEAs guidelines.b.Effective Clients Management:Meet the needs of the residents / clients and caregivers, regularly participate in the multidisciplinary discussions and Individual Care / Training Plans, at least 30% of residents / clients;Oversee and direct engagement with residents / clients and caregivers to ensure satisfactions of our services;Review, enhance, develop and implement policies for the resolution of residents / clients, and caregivers issues and problems; andEnsure compliance in managing stakeholders requirements and licensing requirements to meet acceptable standards and achieve set objectives.RequirementsGood understanding of the vision and daily operations are essential skills for this position;Strong interpersonal skills, to develop positive relationships with the employees, residents and caregivers;Experienced people manager, skilled in coaching and leading a diverse team;Demonstrate creativity in problem definitions, trends and solution.Proven ability to develop and review relevant policies and procedures.Degree or equivalentAt least 8 years experience in a VWO settingPassion to support and serve the adults with disabilitiesComfortable to be on shift workWork location: EunosQUALIFICATIONS    Degree or equivalent    OTHER INFORMATION    Key competenciesManagement and supervisory skillsAttention to detail and accuracyPlanning and organisingStrong communication skillsInformation and task monitoringProblem analysisJudgment and problem-solving    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities

title: Chef De Cuisine (Restaurant)
description: Job Description : A chef de cuisine is the hands-on leader in a restaurant kitchen. From hiring and training staff to supervising food preparation and final plating, the chef de cuisine is directly responsible for every dish that comes out of the kitchen. These highly skilled chefs create and revise recipes, seek out new ingredients, delegate kitchen tasks, stay up-to-date on current food trends and techniques, and ensure their kitchens adhere to all relevant local health department codes. A professional kitchen is an intense environment, so chefs de cuisine must be able to endure long hours of standing and walking around, along with working nights and weekends.Responsibilities  Cultivating relationships with vendors, farmers, and other wholesale food suppliers to ensure the highest quality ingredients.  Monitoring physical inventory, including kitchen equipment, food items, and other supplies, and generating purchase orders as needed. title: Consultant / Senior Consultant
description: Portas Consulting is the leading management consultancy dedicated to sport and physical activity. We are currently seeking a driven Consultant/Senior Consultant, based in Singapore, to help drive our business in Asia Pacific. Following consecutive years of consistent growth, Portas is positioned for further expansion and we are now looking for exceptional senior consultants who share our passion to impact society through sport and physical activity. Candidates should be self-directed, entrepreneurial and excited by the opportunity to shape and grow the Portas business worldwide. Working with governments, sports bodies and corporates, Portas provides independent advice to senior executives on their most critical, urgent and complex challenges in most regions of the world. We combine unrivalled expertise in sport and physical activity with blue chip management consulting credentials.Our projects are wide and varied, spanning strategy, organisation, governance, project management and implementation. Recent examples include: creating the National Sport and Physical Activity Policy for Mauritius; developing the Mass Participation strategy for Saudi Arabia; devising a market entry strategy for a global ticketing company; designing strategies and operating models for a number of major UK governing bodies; developing an insight-led organisation for a global sports retailer.As a Consultant/Senior Consultant out of our Singapore office, you will have the opportunity to work across numerous projects with senior clients in a way that may not be possible at a larger firm.You will have an accelerated, global career in a rapidly growing business, involving the following responsibilities:  Manage single or multiple project teams to deliver exceptional impact  Lead team problem-solving and client communications  Lead client interactions and manage the client relationship on the ground  Coach and develop team members to become excellent consultants  Help drive Portas business development on a global basis  Build and disseminate the firm‚Äôs knowledge base  Lead internal firm-building activities.We are looking for outstanding experienced strategy consultants with a minimum of 3 to 5 years‚Äô experience at a top tier management consulting firm. Proven interest or involvement in sport and physical activity is a prerequisite, and you should be excited to work on a global basis. Applicants with the right to work in Singapore are preferred.If you are excited by this unique opportunity, please apply by copying and pasting the following link into your browser: https://bit.ly/PortasApplyConsultant

title: Chef De Cuisine (Restaurant)
description: Job Description : A chef de cuisine is the hands-on leader in a restaurant kitchen. From hiring and training staff to supervising food preparation and final plating, the chef de cuisine is directly responsible for every dish that comes out of the kitchen. These highly skilled chefs create and revise recipes, seek out new ingredients, delegate kitchen tasks, stay up-to-date on current food trends and techniques, and ensure their kitchens adhere to all relevant local health department codes. A professional kitchen is an intense environment, so chefs de cuisine must be able to endure long hours of standing and walking around, along with working nights and weekends.Responsibilities  Cultivating relationships with vendors, farmers, and other wholesale food suppliers to ensure the highest quality ingredients.  Monitoring physical inventory, including kitchen equipment, food items, and other supplies, and generating purchase orders as needed. Morgan and Chase brands. title: Business Analyst
description: Portas Consulting is the leading management consultancy dedicated to sport and physical activity. Following 5 years of growth at a rate of 80% p.a., Portas is positioned for further expansion and we are looking for exceptional Business Analysts who share our passion to impact society through sport and physical activity.Working with governments, sports bodies and corporates, Portas provides independent advice to senior executives on their most critical, urgent and complex challenges in most regions of the world. We combine unrivalled expertise in sport and physical activity with blue chip management consulting credentials.Our projects are wide and varied, spanning strategy, organisation, governance, project management and implementation. Recent examples include: creating the National Sports and Physical Activity Policy for Mauritius; developing the Mass Participation strategy for Saudi Arabia; devising a market entry strategy for a global ticketing company; designing strategies and operating models for major UK governing bodies; developing an insight-led organisation for a global sports retailer; leading the global, city-based initiative, Active Citizens Worldwide.We have exciting opportunities for outstanding graduates to join our Singapore office. Applicants must be citizens of Singapore to apply for this role.Being a Global Business Analyst means that you will get to work on international projects, seconded out to where the projects and clients are based. As a Business Analyst at Portas, you will quickly develop the full range of core consulting skills, as well as a deep understanding of the sports and physical activity sector worldwide. You will be able to make a tangible difference from day one in a rapidly growing business.The main Business Analyst responsibilities are to:  Undertake research, conduct analysis, draw out insights and synthesise findings  Develop independent sections of client documents and presentations  Contribute to team problem-solving and help develop recommendations  Help prepare and conduct interviews, workshops and meetings  Build productive day-to-day relationships with client team members  Support team planning and process management  Support Portas business development and internal firm-building activities.We are looking for exceptional candidates from top universities or business schools who fulfil the following requirements:  Excellent academic record  Highly numerate, with strong quantitative and conceptual problem-solving ability  Demonstrated passion for sports and entertainment  Self-directed, proactive and entrepreneurial  Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to thrive in a team environment.  Willing and able to work on international projects in different parts of the world, sometimes at short notice.If you are interested in joining us, please apply through our website by copying and pasting the following link: https://bit.ly/ApplyBusinessAnalyst

title: Safety Assistant
description: ICON is currently looking to hire a Safety Assistant to join our business.ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations.With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life.Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.Primary ResponsibilitiesThe Safety Assistant performs a variety of administrative duties within the business unit, including but not limited to distribution of incoming serious adverse event (SAE) / adverse reaction (AR) information, scanning and photocopying of safety related documents, tracking of safety related information, organizing and maintaining files, preparation of documents and reports, compiling records, and posting information. The Safety Assistant may serve as the primary staff assistant to a department and/or project teams.‚Ä¢ Receives incoming reports for the department (including but not limited to documents received via fax server and safety email inboxes) and distributes the reports to the appropriate project teams.‚Ä¢ Scans received documents for unrequested personal identifiers and initiates appropriate actions to protect data privacy.‚Ä¢ Prepares courier shipments (including printing of address labels and copying of attachments).‚Ä¢ Maintains project specific address data for courier applications.‚Ä¢ Sends reports/submissions/queries via fax or email.‚Ä¢ Scans documents into the electronic Trial Master File (eTMF).‚Ä¢ Processes safety related documents in eTMF workflows.‚Ä¢ Tracks status in safety systems (Safety Letter Tracker System, Safety Case Tracker, Safety Database, etc.).‚Ä¢ Assists in the quality control of paper and electronic files.‚Ä¢ Runs reports from internal systems (e.g. InfoView) and distributes them to the project team or departmental managers.‚Ä¢ Reviews query aging reports and initiates reminders or escalations of queries.‚Ä¢ Participates in the translation management process as assigned.‚Ä¢ Responds to staff requests for administrative support as needed.‚Ä¢ Answers phones and forwards calls to the appropriate project team member.‚Ä¢ Adheres to company policies and procedures including corporate guidelines and best practices.‚Ä¢ Follows-up on cases as appropriate.Benefits of Working in ICON:Our success depends on the knowledge, capabilities and quality of our people. That‚Äôs why we are committed to developing our employees in a continuous learning culture ‚Äì one where we challenge you with engaging work and where every experience adds to your professional development.At ICON, our focus is to provide you with a comprehensive and competitive total reward package that comprises, not only an excellent level of base pay, but also a wide range of variable pay and recognition programs. In addition, our best in class employee benefits, supportive policies and wellbeing initiatives are tailored to support you and your family at all stages of your career - both now, and into the future.ICON, including subsidiaries, is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know.

title: Assistant Restaurant Manager
description: Job Description : The Assistant Restaurant Manager is someone who is passionate about food and customer service. They are a problem solver with strong work ethic and leadership skills. The Assistant Restaurant Manager understands that customer satisfaction always takes priority but efficient restaurant operations make it possible. They are an experienced leader with a goal to move up in the management field.Responsibilities¬∑ Identify and delegate responsibilities to shift leaders and staff to ensure objectives are met and excellent service is consistently achieved.¬∑ Effectively manage the restaurant in the absence of the Restaurant Manager.¬∑ Manage operations with passion, integrity, and knowledge while promoting the culture and values of the company.¬∑ Implement new company policies and procedures by developing plans and instructing staff.¬∑ Provide direction to shift leaders, and staff to achieve restaurant goals.¬∑ Consistently review operations and staff to identify any problems, concerns, and opportunities for improvement.¬∑ Provide coaching and feedback to managers and staff and assess performance on and ongoing basis.¬∑ Create a positive guest experience by delivering a high level of service and ensuring all staff engage guests to understand their needs and exceed expectations¬∑ Manage the restaurant to meet or exceed standards in food quality, safety, and cleanliness.¬∑ Consistently monitor product and labor costs to remain within goals.¬∑ Solicit guest feedback to understand the needs and wants of customers.¬∑ Train and coach staff on guest services principles and practices.¬∑ Follow the restaurant policies and procedures, including those for cash handing and safety/security.¬∑ Monitor and maintain the Micros POS System.¬∑ Assist in new menu implementation.¬∑ Develop and implement creative solutions to areas of improvement.¬∑ Assist in conducting staff and daily pre-shift meetings.¬∑ Assist in any areas of the restaurant when staffing constraints require.¬∑ Identify employee weaknesses and retrain as necessary.¬∑ Complete the season to the specifications outlined in your Employment Contract.Minimum Qualifications¬∑ Previous Experience: Prior Restaurant and Management Experience.¬∑ Able to use touch-sensitive POS System.¬∑ Able to lift minimum of 10 lbs.¬∑ Able to work in a high-temperature kitchen for an extended period of time.¬∑ Completed training in all areas of restaurant.¬∑ Must be able to take direction and delegate responsibilities.¬∑ Able to work in a fast paced environment.¬∑ Able to work nights, weekends, and holidays.

title: Programme Manager
description: SGUnited MidCareer Programme - Programme Manager (Elective Modules Career Programmes)General Job DescriptionElective Modules cater to the upper secondary school students to expose them to various professions in the job market. Mastereign‚Äôs programmes bridges the gap between secondary schools and the industries to give participants an understanding of what to expect when they join the workforce through industry partnerships and experiential training in the classroom and through learning journeys.Programmes cover a wide area of professionals such as nursing, floristry, hospitality, culinary arts etc.The Programme Manager supports the Enterprise Team with the conceptualization and pitching of programmes, curriculum development support and trainers deployment for confirmed training projects in their specific area of specialization.He/She reports to the Head of Innovation and works closely with the Enterprise and Productivity teams to manage training projects that will include the development of training content, briefing of trainers, production of training materials, preparation of logistics and deployment of trainers.Training quality of associate trainers will be a key focus of the Programme Manager and he/she will be expected to undertake training assignments.Oversees the Following Team Members¬∑ Assistant Programme Managers¬∑ Administration Executive (Innovation)¬∑ Associate TrainersResponsibilities¬∑ Project Management√º To plan, strategise and implement programme management effectively for the Company. trainers training rates and schedules monthly¬∑ Reporting and Recommendations√º Meet with the Head of Innovation at least once per month for updates and reportingMandatory RequirementsQualifications¬∑ A minimum Bachelor‚Äôs in area of specialisationExperience¬∑ A minimum of 3 years‚Äô experience in a training positionRenumeration PackageSalary Range: SGD$3000 ‚Äì SGD$4000Incentives: All mandatory benefits and performance bonus

title: COOK
description: Prepares ingredients by following recipes; slicing, cutting, chopping, mincing, stirring, whipping, and mixing ingredients; adding seasonings; verifying taste; and plating meals.  Completes hot meal preparation by grilling, saut√©ing, roasting, frying, and broiling ingredients and assembling and refrigerating cold ingredients.  Adheres to proper food handling, sanitation, and safety procedures; maintains temperature and Hazard Analysis Critical Control Point (HACCP) logs as required; and maintains  appropriate dating, labeling, and rotation of all food items.  Contributes to daily, holiday, and theme menus in collaboration with supervisor.  Maintains cleanliness and sanitation of equipment, food storage, and work areas.  Completes cleaning according to daily and weekly schedules and dishwashing/pot washing.  Listens to customer complaints and suggestions and resolves complaints.  Implements suggestions within parameter of position and refers more complex concerns to supervisor. Develop new menu items while improvising the existing ones.  Maintain and manage kitchen expenses, food cost, inventory and staffing within the budgetary limits.  Able to cook north Indian food.  Able to do shift work.

title: Head of Product - E-commerce
description: Join a hypergrowth e-commerce start-up with a regional presence  Own end-to-end product strategy with full ownership on the productAbout Our ClientOur client is an e-commerce start-up with a regional presence. They are looking for a Head of Product - E-commerce to join the product leadership team and overlook the overall development and vision of their core product. This is a brand new role looking after their new business vertical.Reporting to the CPO, you will be expected to manage a team of about 5 Product Managers in the team. They are also looking to expand the team across the region.Job DescriptionThe Head of Product - E-commerce will be working alongside the management team to develop compelling product strategies and vision to build new products or features across the region. You will inculcate a product culture that shares best practices across the entire product journey. You must be able to align the product to business requirements and lead the team to work alongside the development team to deliver end-product on time.They are looking for someone who has managed multiple projects at once and also have had experience in the region across several SEA markets.In addition to the above, the ideal candidate will:  Be an experienced leader: You have launched new products from end-to-end and brought it to launch, preferably in a greenfield space  Be able to make data-driven decisions: You will need to utilise the information collected to understand the customers' needs and behaviours and create a product that is value adding  Leadership skills: You will be the link between the technical and business team and ensure that the product is delivered seamlessly. You will get the opportunity to build the product team from 0  Be hands-on: Our client is a start-up in its early stages and is looking for someone who is excited by being a part of a team which will be able to drive the future of the product. You can, and love, to roll up your sleeves to get the job done.The Successful ApplicantThe ideal candidate must have the following:  Bachelors' and above degree in any relevant discipline  8 or more years' of experience in the product management in a top-tier technology company  Experience in managing a team of product managers will be preferred  Ability to manage internal stakeholders across seniorities and functions  Experienced in working on products across the SEA regionWhat's on OfferOur client offers an amazing opportunity to join a fast-growing e-commerce start-up. Our client is looking for someone who is flexible and can work on multiple exciting projects at the same time. There is autonomy and ownership in your work. The ideal candidate should be an individual with high energy, passionate about product and is highly flexible to do what needs to be done to drive continuous growth.

title: Software Design Engineer
description: Job Description:As a Software Design Engineer in NEC Laboratories Singapore (NLS), you will work in a collaborative Agile Scrum team to create solutions using cutting edge core technologies from our international research labs (Japan, Europe, North America, etc)We experiment on new solutions, fail fast and move on with accumulated knowledge; the end results are successful products  Work in an Agile, DevOps cultured software development organization  Translate core technologies into useful solutions and evolve them into production ready state  Hands-on installation of technologies, setting up development environment, coding from scratch, automating build and deployment  Any other ad-hoc duties as required or assignedJob Requirements:  Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent work experience  Experience building highly scalable, distributed systems  Experience in API design and implementation (REST, GraphQL, etc)  Good database schema design experiences (SQL/NoSQL)  Good to have message queue development experience (zeroMQ etc)  Good to have experience in DevOps culture and practices  Ability to work on cross-functional projects  Ability to collaborate effective with remote teams  Can work independently with minimum guidance  Excellent written and oral communication skills

title: Chef De Cuisine (Restaurant)
description: Job Description : A chef de cuisine is the hands-on leader in a restaurant kitchen. From hiring and training staff to supervising food preparation and final plating, the chef de cuisine is directly responsible for every dish that comes out of the kitchen. These highly skilled chefs create and revise recipes, seek out new ingredients, delegate kitchen tasks, stay up-to-date on current food trends and techniques, and ensure their kitchens adhere to all relevant local health department codes. A professional kitchen is an intense environment, so chefs de cuisine must be able to endure long hours of standing and walking around, along with working nights and weekends.Responsibilities  Cultivating relationships with vendors, farmers, and other wholesale food suppliers to ensure the highest quality ingredients.  Monitoring physical inventory, including kitchen equipment, food items, and other supplies, and generating purchase orders as needed.  Demonstrated understanding of proper food storage and product rotation procedures to ensure freshness and quality.  Scheduling staff and assigning daily responsibilities to maximize kitchen efficiency  Inspecting every dish to confirm correct portion size, visual appeal, and quality compliance.Minimum Qualifications  Proven work experience As Chef de Cuisine  Hands-on experience with various kitchen equipment (e.g. grillers and pasta makers)  Advanced knowledge of culinary, baking and pastry techniques  Leadership skills  Ability to remain calm and undertake various tasks  Excellent time management abilities  Up-to-date knowledge of cooking techniques and recipes  Familiarity with sanitation regulations

title: Project Manager #SGUnitedTraineeships #SGUP
description: 1. Role Description: As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for planning and overseeing projects to ensure they are completed in a timely fashion and within budget. This is all done within the confines of a company's goals and vision.2. title: Maintenance & EHS Junior Engineer
description: ABOUT YOUR ROLEYou will provide on-site field technical support, plan routine maintenance and commissioning of plant, equipment and machinery. You will also be the onsite EHS Executive. Experience working in an OHSAS 18001 certified Organization.  Individuals those are able to showcase scalability and capability to cope and perform under increased or expanding responsibilities

title: DevOps - Oracle Database Administrator, Vice President, Singapore
description: We are seeking an experienced Oracle database administrator ("DBA")  with the desire to drive the modernization of our  Operations team to true DevOps. Working within a global team of DBAs and Infrastructure Developers, you will have particular responsibility for the engineered systems components that runs Oracle databases within our internal private cloud.  The DevOps team is responsible for the availability, performance and monitoring of our Oracle Product offerings.  And as a leader in this team, you will place particular emphasis on the automation of operational tasks and delivery of self-service functions that empower our customers and streamline their processing.  At the same time your traditional operations experience will help ensure that the underlying platform is stable and secure and supporting change at the speed of business.Primary Responsibilities:  Troubleshoot incidents, conduct blameless post-incident evaluations and ensure permanent closure of incidents  Design, develop, test and deliver the software to automate manual operational work and ensure application performance and resiliency  Engage with development teams to help create software for reliability and scale, ensuring minimal refactoring or changes  Contribute to strategy of a best in class monitoring frameworks to accomplish end to end flow monitoring and noiseless alerting  Be part of the 24x7 support coverage  Coach or manage teams as applicableRequirements:  Bachelor's Degree  Minimum 8 years of Oracle DBA Experience with strong understanding of databases and oracle engineered systems like Exadata, ZFS and ZDLRA  Expertise in oracle database administration of versions through 19c on LinuxSQL and system performance  tuningBackup and restoreDataguard and replication technologiesInstallation, patching and upgrades  Knowledge of Oracle engineered systems: Oracle Database Appliance (ODA), Exadata, or Zero Data Loss Recovery Appliance (ZDLRA)Including operating system and storage admin tasks ("Database Machine Admin")Host level patching and upgrades  Automation of administrative tasks via scripting: shell, ansible, perl, or pythonDatabase build and patchingMonitoring setup and reporting toolsBackup and restore management  Experienced in troubleshooting production issuesAble to drive to root causeDesign and implement automation for problem remediation or prevention  Familiarity with cloud offerings a bonus: AWS, Azure  Adaptable team player with a passion for learning and problem-solvingAbout UsJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world‚Äôs most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.About the TeamOur Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you‚Äôll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You‚Äôll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you‚Äîand the products you deliver‚Äîwill thrive.High Risk Roles (HRR) are sensitive roles within the technology organization that require high assurance of the integrity of staff by virtue of 1) sensitive cybersecurity and technology functions they perform within systems or 2) information they receive regarding sensitive cybersecurity or technology matters. Users in these roles are subject to enhanced pre-hire screening which includes both criminal and credit background checks (as allowed by law). The enhanced screening will need to be successfully completed prior to commencing employment or assignment.

title: Software Engineer
description: The Software Engineer is a permanent position in Pierian Singapore Pte Ltd and the selected candidate will be assigned to our client VTEX and the candidate will be working on VTEX E-commerce platform.ABOUT THE CLIENTVTEX is the only multitenant commerce platform capable of unifying experiences in all sales channels. With a robust solution, scalable cloud infrastructure, and powerful tooling, our platform accelerates the transformation of complex operations.2500+ online stores of varying sizes and segments, with operations in 32 countries and global expansion, have at VTEX the solution for the online sale of their products, among them major names such as Sony, Motorola, Walmart, Whirlpool, Coca-Cola, Stanley Black  Decker, and Nestl√©.According to IDC, VTEX is one of five vendors who "shaped the year 2020" and the fastest-growing digital commerce applications vendor in the top 20 market shares.ABOUT THE TEAMThe First Party Apps team is responsible for the creation of products and solutions for all the customers that have VTEX accounts. Today we work alongside the Customer Experience team, focusing on the customer‚Äôs needs and the right experience on our platform. We are looking for an engineer that can create solutions ranging from ecommerce to physical store solutions, but also extend to financial services and even tools that empower partners and clients. Our stack consists mostly of .NET for CPU-bound applications, Node.js + Typescript for IO-bound services, and a pinch of Golang here and there. On the front-end, we leverage React stuffed with Typescript and served with GraphQL on the side.ABOUT THE ROLEWe are looking for someone who will be responsible for providing technical guidance to our different partners, guaranteeing the correct usage of VTEX APIs and VTEX IO, considering the best architecture in terms of business impact. The objective is to co-create with the partner the right experience, focusing on their success and helping identify product issues and opportunities, gathering partner feedback as insights into the product evolution.WHO YOU AREYou have min. 5 years of experience in working with engineering;- Digital commerce experience;- You have a tech  math mindset, providing simple solutions to complex problems;- You have advanced English knowledge (preferred).As an engineer who builds our front-end first-party apps:- You have experience defining and implementing standards and frameworks;- You have the ability to profile and optimize components performance focusing on improving UX;- You have experience working with a mobile-first approach;As an engineer who builds our back-end first-party apps, you'll need to:- Have experience evolving in large-scale and resilient microservices with 24/7 uptime;- Have experience with design and building low-latency and highly available APIs;Even though we value familiarity with our technology stack, we don't require that you have any previous knowledge of it. We‚Äôve found that people who have a solid grasp of fundamental software engineering skills combined with a growth mindset fit in well with us - and all the people we've found matching this profile are proficient in at least one programming stack.

title: Data Scientist
description: Organon is a global Women‚Äôs Health Company that believes in a better and healthier every day for every woman! We are a passionate, global community of thousands dedicated to redefining the future of women‚Äôs health. Our mission is to deliver impactful medicines and solutions for a healthier every day. But what really makes it work at Organon is our people.We‚Äôre looking for real, passionate team players, curious innovators, forward thinkers, empowered by the idea of shaping their career, and ready to bring their fire to embrace change and the opportunities it brings for progress.At Organon, you‚Äôll get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the open, agile, collaborative culture of a start-up, and operating at the scale of a fortune 500 company with an international footprint that serves people in more than 140 markets.It‚Äôs going to be an exciting future‚Äîcome be a part of it!The opportunity  A  unique opportunity to build a new leading biopharmaceutical company and  define a new culture that creates a compelling customer experience.  Work in close collaboration with colleagues in the SEA Cluster Team and markets  to ensure and develop a visionary approach to use of data  analytics.  As a Data Scientist, you will work closely with country stakeholders to understand the business problems and desired business outcomes. ‚ÄãOur Marketing team are passionate about bringing our medicines and vaccines to our customers around the world. Through digital listening and patient analytics, we are able to understand our customers‚Äô needs and strive to provide solutions to meet themWhat you will do:  Work closely with the Analytics Lead on the vision and roadmap for Analytics, focusing on making the SEA cluster a data driven organization.  Extract actionable business insights from the data and build deliverables that clearly communicate the findings and recommendations. ‚Äã  Ensure a steady fundament of analytics  insights for all markets in the cluster  Actively  seek out opportunities to innovate by using non-traditional data and new  modeling techniques.  Enhancing existing analytic techniques by promoting new methodology and best  practices in analytics field.  The capacity to effectively collaborate and drive change across borders  A passion for data and analytics with ability to point out key insights to  drive more data-informed decision makingWhat you must have:  Relevant Bachelor‚Äôs Degree required, Master‚Äôs Degree preferred.  Experience  in pharmaceutical industry  Wide ranging knowledge and understanding of analytics and affinity for working with data.  Strong track record on innovative data solutions  Good business acumen with strong ability to solve business problems through data driven quantitative methodologies.  Comfortable working both independently and in a cross-functional team.  Take responsibility and ownership of problems, ensuring escalation as  appropriate.  Ability to work effectively cross borders displaying great collaboration and communication skills.WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT  Highly  dynamic career in Sales and career development opportunities  Be part of a high performing team in a collaborative environmentWHO WE AREOrganon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women‚Äôs Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions.Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.At launch, we will be more than 10,000 Founders strong, ready to rise together as we make a difference in a new way. As Founders, employees will create their future and will help shape the direction of Organon and its impact on the world. Our culture reflects our passion for those we champion.At Organon, we all belong. We embrace diversity and give it a voice. Our commitment to supporting women is reflected in the make-up of our leadership team, which is majority female and our diversity of experience is core to who we are and what we are designed to do.We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

description: The KYC Specialist will partner with the client-facing teams to ensure all client records are compliant with Anti- Money Laundering (AML) and Know Your Client (KYC) regulatory standards in a timely fashion. In addition, The KYC Specialist will own the end to end operational KYC activities (such as periodic renewals) of all clients and validate to ensure that all documentation provided are of the highest quality. The KYC Specialist will review the collection and verification of data performed to ensure all KYC records are accurate and complete prior to a final review by the client-facing team. Diligence requirements (PDD)  Communicating/escalating issues to management in a timely manner as appropriate  Build strong engagement with Middle office and be part of KYC/AML interactions to required  Strong understanding of KYC, AML and regulatory requirements (i.e. HKMA and MAS)  Strong sense of ownership and responsibility  Must be able to work and contribute effectively in stressful situation  Outstanding client management, partnership building, leadership and direct experience of dealing with multiple stakeholders at one time  Strong research, analytical and comprehension skills, with ability to analyze large amounts of data  Client focused with strong customer service skills  Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines against a high-volume work schedule  Experience adhering to controls and compliance standards  Ability to grasp/learn concepts, procedures and accept feedback, and use it to build deeper knowledge of processes and client relationships through additional documentation needed to complete due diligence reviews.  Possess strong computer skills:  Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Word and PowerPoint  Must be detail-oriented and analytical  Ability to work both independently and as a team in a fast-paced production environment  Drives results through leadership, people, communication and influence  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree and/or Graduate DegreeAbout UsJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world‚Äôs most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants‚Äô and employees‚Äô religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.About the TeamJ.P. Morgan Asset  Wealth Management delivers industry-leading investment management and private banking solutions with client assets of $4 trillion. Asset Management provides individuals, advisors and institutions with strategies and expertise that span the full spectrum of asset classes through our global network of investment professionals. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

title: Assistant Manager / Manager, Business Development, E-Commerce
description: We are hiring! If you have a strong passion in eCommerce and omni-channel retail, a strong desire to be part of a dynamic and expanding team driving business transformation, possess an inquisitive mind for continual discovery and strong understanding of tech, join us now!Overview:You will be a key member of the Business Development Team and will take on the role of a Category Lead to oversee the expansion of Electronics Category and other assigned categories such as Food and Home  Living. You will be responsible for the categories‚Äô performance and building partnership with your merchants to improve business performance.You will need to have strong salesmanship and business acumen. You should be fluent in managing multi-stakeholders and be comfortable in analytics and senior management engagement. You will also interface closely with the technical team, marketing and business operations team for operational implementation.Roles  Responsibilities:As the Category Lead, you will devise strategy and conduct competitive analysis of the business landscape to identify competition and growth opportunities. You will lead the translation of plans into execution, including leads cultivation, driving negotiation and contracting of partnerships. Specifically, this includes:1. PL Responsibility  Responsible for PL of Electronics Category and such other assigned categories  Devise and implement the merchandising mix and onboarding strategy to achieve the sales, revenue and category leadership performance in the trade  Responsible for Category Performance Analysis  Reporting2. Merchant Acquisition:  To lead the merchant acquisition efforts including prospecting, negotiating and development of necessary marketing tools  To be responsible for the merchant onboarding up to point of contracting and / or renewals, before handing over to the Operations Team for on-boarding ops and day-to-day support3. Account Management  In charge of the accounts and sales targets of merchants under your care  Continually review the performance of your merchants, work with them to strategically conceive new business ideas to grow performance which may include range expansion, marketing or partnerships etc.  You shall continually maintain good relationship and provide value add to your partners to improve performance on the platform4. Business Development  To work closely with the Business Head to develop new business ideas to improve performance  Drive the entire business pitch and implementation for new ideas such as business case analysis, seeking management buy-in, operationalisation and budget / ROI managementKey Performance Measurements include:  Category PL Performance  Merchant Acquisition  Product Range Expansion  First-to-Launch or Exclusive Brands / Products / Concepts introduced  Sales  Merchant Satisfaction  New Business Development Ideas  ImplementationsRequirements:  Degree Holder with at least 4 years (for the Assistant Manager role) or 7 years (for the Manager role) of relevant experience  eCommerce and / or marketplace experience is necessary  Strong industry networks and contacts in Electronics industry will be preferred  Possess strong business acumenApplicants who are medically eligible for vaccination has to be fully vaccinated or have made plans to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by 1 January 2022 as this position requires the employee to return to the workplace.

title: Business Risk Management Associate
description: Company ProfileMorgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm‚Äôs employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals.Department ProfileBusiness Unit Risk Management (BURM) is the Firm‚Äôs first line of defense and responsible for structuring and implementing the risk management framework for Sales and Trading globally.BURM is currently seeking an Associate/Vice President in the current Singapore Fixed Income Division (FID) BURM team.Key Responsibilities:This role will cover activities of the Sales and Trading teams based in Singapore, Tokyo and India with key responsibilities including:  Engaging with Sales and Trading teams and other stakeholders to build awareness of Non-Market Risk (NMR) and Risk and Control Group‚Äôs (RCG) continued focus on proactive and effective surveillance and supervision.  Provision of advice and support to FID across all aspects of Non-Market Risk (NMR) and Risk and Control Group (RCG) including Operational Risk, Conduct Risk, Reputational Risk, and Franchise Risk.  Prompt escalation of material NMR and RCG issues to global and local senior BURM and FID.  Application of standardized and consistent risk management policies and procedures applicable to FID Sales and Trading personnel.  Risk Assessment of all new business initiatives and implementation of approved initiatives post assessment.  Partnership with functional groups, including Legal, Compliance, Operations, Credit, Tax, FCG and IT to execute business initiatives as well as to identify, assess and mitigate business risks.  Support for regulatory inquiries, internal audits, and compliance testing as required.  Establishment and promotion of the Firm‚Äôs risk management culture to all Sales and Trading personnel.  First responder for day-to-day queries and issues from Sales and Trading personnel. Critically assess all existing workflows, policies, procedures, supervisory structures, and governance of Sales and Trading business including escalation of recommendations post assessment.  Manage the division‚Äôs BCP planning and execution, including preparation and responses to BCP events (e.g. Earthquake scenario, COVID19, etc.)Qualifications:  University educated, with 5+ years of professional experience preferably in the financial industry in roles such as Risk Management, Business Unit Management, Compliance or Legal.  Well-developed knowledge of financial markets, currencies, and derivatives markets.  Working knowledge of associated local and global regulations/industry change (ie. LIBOR reform, Uncleared Margin Rules, etc,)  English and Japanese language oral and written communication skills as well as impactful presentation skills.  Ability to develop and leverage effective working relationships across business and functional groups.  The ability to work autonomously, think critically and be able to both lead and work within a team will be critical to being successful in this role.Salary offered will commensurate with experience.

title: Business Analyst
description: Do you aspire a rewarding career that lets you do more and achieve more? Unleash your full potential at work with TDCX, an award-winning and fast-growing BPO company.Work with the world‚Äôs most loved brands and be with awesome, diverse people. Be home, belong, and start your journey to #BeMore!Top reasons to work here:  Attractive remuneration, great perks, and performance incentives  Comprehensive medical, insurance, or social security coverage  Premium workspaces  Engaging activities and recognition programs  Strong learning and development plans for your career growth  Positive culture for you to #BeMore at work  Easy to locate area with direct access to public transport  Flexible working arrangements  Be coached and mentored by experts in your field  Join a global company with 25 years of experience and more than 270 industry awardsWhat is your mission?What gets measured, gets managed.‚Äù The Business Analyst is responsible for gathering and understanding business requirements, collating and preparing data, performing analyses, extracting insights, and making recommendations to assist the company in developing meaningful business solutions and operational improvements. The position is also expected to monitor progress to agreed measurables and within set organizational procedures.The ideal candidate can work on multiple initiatives simultaneously and translate data into digestible and actionable insights that improve our businesses.You are also required to perform these job functions:  Responsible for studying analytics requirements and delivering solutions  Study business requirements, collate data, analyse/research, and translate results into effective presentations and recommendations to aid decision making in timely manner  Conduct root cause analysis or correlation studies as and when required  Support projects/departments by developing regular (e.g. daily, weekly, monthly) and effective reports, dashboards and presentations on KPIs and other metrics related to contact center operations (inbound/outbound)  Educate internal/external users appropriate use of analytics and business intelligence  Any other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management from time to time, within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance and continual improvement of the Quality Management System of TDCX.Who are we looking for?  Possesses an analytics-related diploma or at least a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree  Experience in extracting, transforming and porting data from source systems to data analytics platform(s) and reports  Experience in conceptualising, designing, developing, testing, implementing and supporting agile data analytics platforms to support analytical initiatives of internal or external stakeholders  Experience in analysing different types of data to support business needs and present the results in concise visualisation formats  Has an inquisitive mind and proactivity to challenge the norms constructively  Team player with good communication and presentation skills  Detail oriented, independent and able to work under pressure to meet deadlines  Experience in Salesforce, advanced Excel and PowerPoint would be preferred  Ability to use analytical tools such as Tableau, Klipfolio, Qlik, R, SPSS would be added advantage  Adaptable to various stakeholders, business models and projectsWho is TDCX?We serve some of the world‚Äôs best brands from our centers of excellence in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, the Philippines, Hong Kong, China, Japan, Spain, Colombia, Romania, and India. We specialize in perfecting our clients‚Äô customer experience and elevating their sales.We are guided by a talent philosophy - selecting and employing the best professionals to make the outsource industry better for our people and our clients.Our company has won over 270 industry awards for delivering value driven by technology and continuously innovating our customer-facing brand solutions. Thanks to our premium workspaces, above industry average compensation packages, career opportunities, and long list of perks, we were recently awarded as one of the best companies to work for in Asia.

title: Partner Business Manager- Channel Lead
description: The Partner Business Manager (PBM) is a people manager  a field-based employee that covers channel business for multiple solutions (HXM, ISM, DSC, CX etc) or for a specific engagement type (Solex, 3rd Party, MCaaS, OEM, ISV, gVAR, Distribution, etc), in order to grow SAP's software license revenue across the SAP solution portfolio.  The PBM is responsible for proactively developing the partner's SAP business by driving sales (to net new customers and to the partner's current customer base), demand generation and partner capabilities with a strong focus on mid-term perspective. The PBM coaches  guides other PBMs and is the main point of contact for building the partner relationship with SAP. The PBM is the central advisor to the partner, owning the partner relationship end to end, and responsible for coordinating all SAP interactions (with executives, PSA, solutions teams, peers, etc.) in order to drive partner investments and growth in SAP's solutions portfolio. The job incumbent is responsible for appropriately managing/balancing the use of SAP assets (i.e. Pre-Sales, Training, PSA, etc.) without under- or over-utilizing those assets. He or she develops partners for long term development, health-of-business and transformation to new solutions, technologies and models. The Partner Business PBM supports partner enablement to drive partners to self-sufficiency from demand generation to closing deals. The PBM provides support to partners in sales cycles via coaching, mentoring and shadowing in customer facing sales activities. Position is measured on revenue, year-over-year growth, market share growth, adoption of strategic solutions (i.e. Hana, Cloud) and GB impact.Key Responsibilities - Partner Business Manager:Strategic Value and Business Development Responsible for the holistic management and representation of the Partner to SAP, and for proactively managing and developing the assigned territory following a disciplined business planning process to expand their partner's business with SAP.  Understands and classifies the partner's basic financial structure and key drivers which influence their business and decisionsSupervises PBMs to develop active and long-term partner relationships across all roles in the partner (executives, sales, marketing, technical, ÔøΩ), and keeps up to date with all major changes to the partners' organization as well as with the changing environment at SAP. Proposes changes to partner's organization to strengthen their business execution. Articulates the relevant SAP portfolio in terms of the customer value proposition and the partner value proposition (including partner economics, partner ROI, advise the partner on investments into various solutions as is seen fit, using available SAP experts); Translates SAP opportunities (i.e. new product, new solutions area) in financial terms including potential revenue, required partner investment, break-even, and return on investment to gain partner adoption; mainly focusing on extending the partner's sweet spot (vs. entering completely new business areas)Ensures partner-assistance in building transformational plans to differentiate themselves and add value to customers. Identifies economic trends and use industry knowledge to guide PBMs where they channel their partners' investment in developing their SAP business and to gain trusted advisor statusDevelops and drives effective joint annual business planning with partners to ensure proper planning and execution of Sales, Marketing, and Enablement. Works on investment and expansion plans, Documents partner's commitments and investments, Holds partners accountable and measure (and report) results and ROI on documented marketing and demand generation plans regularly (i.e., quarterly updates and reviews). Utilizes existing experts within SAP to prepare, deliver and follow up on the business planningEnsures professional preparation and leadership of partner/SAP meetingsOverall: Revenue Generation and LeadershipResponsible for sales of SAP software licenses with and through partners across SAP's portfolio and establishing an advisory relationship with the partner and SAP teams.  Enable PBMs to drive partner execution to revenue commitments to SAP and measures and reports progressEnsures that partners receive training to develop high level of sales skills on successful sales strategies and on individual opportunities; Guides partner on the sales landscape and how SAP solutions complement other software and technologies that the partner sells to increase size of opportunities and the partner's marginOversees collaboration of PBMs with SAP teams (Account Executive, Inside Sales Executive, General Business Sales Executives, etc.) acting as a strategic liaison between the partner and SAP to ensure effective communications, aligned strategies, and sales successes; ensure partner uses full SAP resources effectively (executives, solution experts, sales, support, field services, etc.) Takes on responsibility for clean, correct and updated data from partners in relevant SAP systems and in communication with SAP teams (e.g. PRM, ISEs, Account Executives).Anticipate and prevent conflicts between PAM and partners. Support PAMs to take action and resolve conflicts as they occur and escalate as needed.Partner Demand Generation and Pipeline CreationResponsible for partner's pipeline development; driving to SAP's expectation of pipeline multipliers, and leveraging SAP marketing and business development resources and tools. Provides leadership in knowledge management, by developing and sharing best practices  for demand generation and pipeline creation with partnersEncourages PBMs to facilitate expansion of their SAP footprint to the innovation solution portfolio where relevant, and incorporates the new solutions in pipeline building and demand generation plans; Ensures that partners' overall demand generation plans to align with SAP's current go-to-market messaging; Creates a partner environment in which partners collaborate to build and execute joint demand generation activities with SAP regional, industry and national Sales, Business Development and Marketing Teams to grow a mutual pipelineEnsures forecast accuracy and sales linearity (quarter after quarter, month after month) across partners.General Partner ManagementResponsible for the overall success of a partner with SAP, and for partner compliance with SAP PartnerEdge program requirements and SAP's Chanel Operating Policies. Support for complex deals in accounts under 700mÔøΩ.Ensures partners' engagement and investment in the SAP portfolio. Provides PBMs with new and innovative solutions in managing partners. Envisions new strategies to better leverage and extend SAP's ecosystem. Feels responsible to consistently improve and innovate SAP's partner management approach Monitors if PartnerEdge requirements are met and take corrective action as necessary, if required with GPO mgmt.Singles out underperforming partners and prescribe corrective action in a timely mannerEngages in HR oriented topics concerning performance assessment, compensation and development of PAMs. Ensure that partners, PAMs and SAP teams operate in a professional and ethical manner; take action or escalate if professionalism and ethics standards are not being met.Experience  Language Requirements10+ years working experience in the software industry7+ years in a partner facing role (ex. Customer Service, Sales, Consulting); experience working at a SAP partner is a ‚Äòplus'Demonstrated partnering and sales leadership skills  Relevant experience in cloud / HANA topicsBusiness development planning and execution experience in driving sales pipeline, demand gen, and enablement with partnersStrong analytical competencies An ability identify and champion win-win scenariosHigh energy - brings innovative ideas to the team and champions best practicesProven capability to work in a team and collaborate; with independent accountabilityExpertise and acumen in forging initiatives and go-to-market sales pipeline development plans with business partners Local market knowledge and understanding (software industry, trends, vertical market industries, etc.)EducationBachelor equivalent

title: Visiting Associate Professor
description: The School of Biological Sciences (SBS) at Nanyang Technological University was established in 2002 with the mission to make strong contributions to biological and biomedical sciences. Since then, many talented individuals from around the world and Singapore have joint SBS as scientific leaders, and researchers. Research areas at SBS include biological data science, cancer and cell biology, gene function, genetics and genomics, microbiology and immunology, neuroscience, plant biology, proteomics and protein function and structural biology.RequirementsThe candidate should be a tenured full Professor/Associate Professor and be in a senior leadership position in a top ranked institute or University in the world. We are looking for an outstanding academic from a reputable university with a strong track record in teaching and research related to proteomics, protein structure and function, biomarker identification and application.ResponsibilitiesThe successful applicant will collaborate with faculty members and industry partners in research leading to publications with NTU affiliations in international peer-reviewed journals. Appointee may be involved in undergraduate and graduate teaching.The College of Science seeks a diverse and inclusive workforce and is committed to equality of opportunity. We welcome applications from all and recruit on the basis of merit, regardless of age, race, gender, religion, marital status and family responsibilities, or disability.

In addition, you will support the Business Head to drive new business development initiatives, including leading cross-disciplinary taskforces to enable cross-border eCommerce by 2022.You will required to fulfil the following duties and responsibilities:Category Management (70%)  As the Head of the Business Development Team, you will manage a team of 6 staff.  You will develop the Sales Plan for the Respective Categories to optimise Sales  Revenue Performance. This shall include the Merchant  Product Mix, Pricing Strategy, Promotion / Partnership Strategy and to work with the Marketing Lead to devise the respective Marketing  Communications Plans to support the Categories‚Äô Growth.  You will be closely supported by the Business Analytics Team to conduct regular competitive benchmarking and category performance analysis, to identify key sales drivers and detractors. You will take lead in merging the data insights with industry intelligence into action plans to improve business performance for the categories under your purview.  You and your team will lead all prospecting of merchants and the resultant account management and partnerships. You will be supported by the Operations Team for onboarding and Marketing Team during sustenance.  Your KPIs will be Sales, Revenue and the Quality of Range/Merchants.New Business Development / Cross Border eCommerce (20%)  You will lead a cross-disciplinary taskforce to enable the opening up of Cross-Border eCommerce by 2022. The role embodies market sizing to shortlist the key market / category with highest business potential, developing an operationalisation plan and coordinating the subsequent implementation.  In addition, you will be required to actively identify new business development opportunities to test efficacy through quick MVPs.Management (10%)  You will be accountable for the PL for the Categories under purview, including ownership of various performance metrics including EBITDA, CM1/2/3/4.  You will support the Business Head in developing the 5-Year / Annual Budgeting and Workplan, including detailed Category Sales  Revenue Forecast. In addition, you will be required to fluent in preparing Monthly Management Performance Updates.  This is a both a leadership and execution role as you will be required to be hands-on in the projects and operations. You will have exciting opportunities to grow in a digital business which is in midst of active expansion and to interface closely with a wide repertoire of stakeholders such as sales and marketing, operations team and tech teams etc.  As such, you will also need to have strong understanding of the eCommerce space, sharp acumen in business development, strong understanding of and relationships with the trade partners in the various business categories, and to possess fluent salesmanship and effective project management skills. You must be comfortable in managing multi-stakeholders, fluent in analytics, power point presentation and senior management engagement.Requirements:  Degree Holder with at least 7 ‚Äì 15 years of relevant experience.  eCommerce and / or marketplace experience.  Previous experience in Beauty / Electronics / Services / Luxury Sector.  Management experience in an Ecommerce company, Internet start-up, International Brand, FMCG, retailer or consulting.  Very strong commercial and relationship management abilities.  Good command of English is essential for both written  spoken.  Excellent communication and negotiation skills.  Proactive, hands-on and problem-solving attitude.Applicants who are medically eligible for vaccination has to be fully vaccinated or have made plans to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by 1 January 2022 as this position requires the employee to return to the workplace.

Whether it is growing Singapore‚Äôs air connectivity to the world, enhancing experience at the various touchpoints, or curating personalized retail offerings, we are continually striving to better serve our customers at Changi Airport. The talent and commitment of our people makes the dreams that we are chasing a reality.Enterprise Data Science  Management (EDSM) comprises of a team of data analytics and data management professionals tasked with the mandate to help solve business problems and build up data capabilities across the enterprise. EDSM leverages data and adopts a ‚Äúdata first‚Äù approach in distilling actionable insights to key stakeholders including senior management and business teams. EDSM seeks to create positive impact and business value through data-driven decision-making.We are looking for a savvy Data Steward, a person who is experienced and passionate in optimising data ecosystems, to join our vibrant team in EDSM. You will be working in a team with like-minded enthusiasts and primarily undertake works to improve data quality, access, and security. Your responsibilities include:  Develop data policies, processes, and procedures.  Develop data taxonomy and ontology  Coordinate with users, data engineers and tech developers to implement taxonomy and ontology.  Conduct investigation and fault finding on data issues, including but not limited to, data inconsistencies across databases, data policy/process compliance issues, data accuracy issues.Requirements:  Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems or other quantitative / computational discipline, or General degree supported with relevant certificates and experience.  Minimum 6 years working experience with at least 3 years in a data related role.  Experience in developing data policies and processes.  Knowledge in database and data management.  Good communication, negotiation, and inter-personal skills to work with multiple stakeholders across multiple systems and departments.Applicants who are medically eligible for vaccination has to be fully vaccinated or have made plans to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by 1 January 2022 as this position requires the employee to return to the workplace.
