title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer ‚Äì Data  Analytics Team, YouTrip, SingaporeWhat is it about in one line?To design, develop, maintain and optimize our data platform, which is being the foundation of our business reporting, analytics, and data products.Sounds interesting? Here‚Äôs more about usYouTrip is Southeast Asia‚Äôs 1st and leading multi-currency wallet. As a regional financial technology startup, YouTrip is dedicated to creating the best mobile financial services by simplifying foreign currency payments and offering the best exchange rates. Launched in 2018, YouTrip has been voted the #1 multi-currency account in Singapore with the largest user base in the region following its successful launch in Thailand in partnership with Karsikornbank in 2019.YouTrip is a Major Payment Institution licensed under the Monetary Authority of Singapore and awarded the Top FinTech Leaders 2020 by Singapore FinTech Association, and ASEAN‚Äôs Best Fintech Startup 2019 by the Rice Bowl Startup Awards.As a member of the Data  Analytics team in Singapore, you will build processes to support data transformation and manage data structure, metadata, dependency, and workflow. This is a full-time position.You will:‚óè    Design, develop and maintain data ETL processes, ensure the processes are fulfilling business needs and SLAs‚óè    Facilitate technical planning and optimize data infrastructure, model and pipeline to improve data platform stability continuously‚óè    Design and develop Data Products to drive business outcomes‚óè    Collaborate with Product Manager, Developers, UX Designers and Data Analyst to build data-driven products / internal tools‚óè    Develop processes to answer recurring business questions and identify opportunities for improvement‚óè    Ensure Data Quality through continuous improvement and monitoringYou are:‚óè    Data Expert ‚Äì you‚Äôve racked up at least 3-5 years of experience in Data Engineering (e.g. data pipeline, data architecture, API). Extensive experience in SQL, Python, or other scripting languages. Comfortable in deploying scripts and familiar with data management / ETL tools. Experience in FinTech/machine learning will be a plus.‚óè    Quality Goalkeeper ‚Äì you are highly efficient and able to work independently with good time management. Enjoy improving the database's integrity, availability, and accuracy.‚óè    Resourceful Adventurist ‚Äì you are comfortable in exploring the unknown or new technologies. Love talking with different business stakeholders to identify their needs and support their analytics requirements.‚óè    Curious Detective ‚Äì you are experienced in performing root cause analysis on pipeline issues. Love to challenge the status quo and identify ways to make things better.What can you expect from us?‚óè    A free hand to innovate and continuously develop new content‚óè    The most innovative travel payment product to use and to create content around‚óè    Direct report to Data  Analytics Lead and be part of the growth team of the Singapore business‚óè    Access to a deep bench of technical and business experts to work together‚óè    Multi-cultural co-working space environment in CBD area‚óè    Working with an entrepreneurial team of people in Singapore, Thailand, and Hong KongTo applyIf you are interested in this position, please send your resume along with your salary expectation to hr@you.co OR apply here.

title: NTI Senior Equipment Engineer/Equipment Engineer
description: As a Senior Equipment Engineer/Equipment Engineer in the NTI, you will be expected to support RD activities associated with rapid deployment of First-of-Kind equipment, the CIP hardware evaluations and managing on the timeline needed to deploy in current technode/next advance technode on time. Good team spirit and good collaborations working is needed with various stakeholders including (not limited to) facilities/fab support/Gas  Chemical/EHS/F4/F10/Central team etc with various equipment setup and improvement work necessitated thereof as well as to ensure extended engagement with F4 on the upcoming First-of-Kind equipment in upcoming technode. Expected to work independently with minimal direction and complete projects in a timely manner and achieve set objectives.Responsibilities  Install First-of-Kind equipment and/or CIP hardware for evaluation by the process development team to enable early introduction, maturity, and adoption for current and next node of 3D NAND technology.  Work with the Fab layout and facility team to ensure smooth and on time installation and operation of the equipment.  Work with process development team to quantify benefits of equipment/CIP hardware.  Develop and optimize existing equipment hardware to meet the productivity requirements of advanced 3D NAND parts.  Participate with Boise TD equipment development peers on technology choices for the upcoming nodes and able to translate future technology needs into clear equipment requirements.  Identify disruptive equipment early, work with manufacturing and Boise TD to identify viable evaluation path forward in manufacturing.  Design and implement advanced equipment monitoring and control methodologies.  Lead team or sites or suppliers on complex projects in focused meetings with end goal of maturity an equipment technology in record times for technical advantage, cost and productivity.  Serve as a technical expert within Micron, provide advice and recommendations to senior management on improvements from equipment development. Lead and initiate innovation projects through patents/technical papers.  Identify and resolve safety hazards; follow safety procedures including lockout, chemical safety, lifting techniques and ergonomically correct methods.  Communications and collaboration with partners both locally and globally.  Strict adherence to Micron Intellectual Property protection policy is a must.  Self-motivated and adaptable to Micron‚Äôs fast paced, demanding and dynamic work environment; flexibility to work for extended hours, as required.  Excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to convey the message clearly and sharply both locally and globally.  Excellent ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously; efficiently utilize available resources or seek peers‚Äô and/or management help to get over the roadblocks to drive to solutions.  Encourage and enforce safe, compliant behavior through periodic communications and the performance management process.

title: Technical Recruiter
description: Serving tens of millions of customers each year, Changi Airport Group (CAG) aims to create memorable experiences for our all customers. Whether it is growing Singapore‚Äôs air connectivity to the world, enhancing experience at the various touchpoints, or curating personalised retail offerings, we are continually striving to better serve everyone at Changi Airport. The talent and commitment of our people make the dreams that we are chasing a reality.We are looking for an experienced Tech Recruiter to help build the internal capabilities of our digital, tech and data teams by hiring the best talents in these fields.Key Responsibilities  Develop and implement talent acquisition strategies, processes and programmes to drive effective recruitment of digital, tech and data talents; embrace and explore new and creative ways to attract and hire top talents in this space; not afraid to experiment and challenge the status-quo.  Manage the full cycle of recruitment activities including sourcing of candidates through various channels, evaluating candidates‚Äô suitability though phone screening and interviews, crafting attractive offer proposals and managing the offers.  Adopt a consultative approach in partnering hiring managers to understand their requirements and to ensure we meet their hiring needs and goals.  Manage pipeline activity and prioritise the job openings based on urgency and business impacts, and proactively share updates on hiring status and market-driven insights on talent landscape with hiring managers.  Build and nurture relationships with candidates, staying connected right through to the point of hiring.  Maintain regular contact with passive candidates for talent pipelining.Requirements  Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in any discipline.  Minimum 4 years of full-cycle recruiting experience, including at least 3 years as a full-time Tech Recruiter in-house or with an agency.  Work experience as a tech professional is an advantage.  Experienced in using Applicant Tracking Systems and LinkedIn Recruiter.  Excellent research, sourcing, candidate engagement and stakeholder management skills.  Strong interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to influence hiring decisions and stakeholders through the provision of solid market insights.  Possess a strong partnering mindset and enjoy building relationships with stakeholders and candidates.  Independent, resourceful and meticulous with a positive attitude and drive.  Excellent verbal and written communications skills.This is a 3-years contract position.Applicants who are medically eligible for vaccination has to be fully vaccinated or have made plans to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by 1 January 2022 as this position requires the employee to return to the workplace.

title: Product Designer (UI/UX)
description: A bit about usAntler, globally, in three years of operating, has grown to have a presence in 16 cities around the world, including offices in most major startup ecosystems, such as New York, Berlin, London, Singapore and Australia.We are on a mission to fundamentally improve the world by enabling and investing in the world's most exceptional people. We help to build complementary co-founder teams, supported by deep business model validation and we provide a global platform for quicker scaling, due diligence and problem-solving. To date, Antler globally has invested in and helped build over 300 companies, 40% of which have at least one female co-founder.We support founders from the building phase through to series C, providing an unparalleled capital pathway with more than 75% of our companies raising third party capital within six months of Demo Day. Our portfolio companies are also supported by a global network of 500 experts in technology, entrepreneurship, business and academia, and the world‚Äôs fastest growing community of founders, with 500+ new members every year.A bit about the roleAntler‚Äôs global product and engineering team is growing and we are now on the hunt for a Product Designer. This high-impact role will work closely with the COO  Expansion Director, Vegard Medbo and the wider product and engineering team. This role can be based in Australia, India, Vietnam or Singapore.About Antler Product and EngineeringAntler Product and Engineering is a small but dynamic team inside Antler.Firstly, we aim to build the world's best platform and community supporting early-stage entrepreneurs. A platform that will massively increase a founder‚Äôs chance to successfully build their business by giving an unfair advantage and bringing together a global community of hundreds of founders.Secondly, with such a large number of founders and companies comes the unique opportunity to generate insights to structurally improve investment decisions and what support can make founders successful.Thirdly, we will build the backbone and infrastructure that will allow Antler to function at scale and manage a portfolio of hundreds of companies effectively.Who we‚Äôre looking forWe‚Äôre looking for someone passionate about building experiences which engage our users. You‚Äôll be analytical and detail-oriented, but also able to take a more strategic view and provide feedback around the overall direction.You'll be able to:  Take ambiguous descriptions or feedback and turn them into designs which wow  Present product ideas to relevant team members for brainstorming  Suggest improvements to design and performance to product engineers  Employ design concepts into functional prototypes  Perform research on product technologies and structures to implement into design concepts  Stay up to date on current industry trends and market conditionsA keen interest or experience in working with startups is highly beneficial.A bit about youFounder firstYou love and believe in people. You know that the founding team is the heart of a startup and is ultimately responsible for an early-stage company's success. You thrive in creating beautiful designs and new product features and are excited that they will be used internally and externally for Antlerites and Founders across the globe.Relationship builderYour love of people radiates. You will possess exceptional leadership and relationship skills and will thrive in connecting with and supporting Antlerites with technical support across the globe.Problem solver and detail orientedYou have a curious mind. You can problem solve in seconds. You know the devil is in the details and know your way around a tech stack. You take pride in your work and the projects you‚Äôve worked on.Grit, drive and executionYou have the ambition and inner motivation to reach for extremely big outcomes and the perseverance to address, problem solve, and find solutions to complex operational challenges. You are not shy of being independent with a laser focus on execution and results.CommunicationYou believe in being open and honest. You are a clean and concise communicator able to deliver complex. You are able to motivate and lead with a team and a larger community.Team playerWe have a one team approach. We win together and take risks, acknowledging this means backing and recognising each other‚Äôs efforts and offering support when needed.Why you should work with usWe are all here to make a difference in the lives of founders and building companies that are solving real world problems. Joining Antler should be the best work of your life, and you should love what you do every day.We are here to help people build the defining companies of tomorrow.Antler is a values-led team and by joining us, each day, you will live by these principles:  Put founders first - We obsess about making our founders successful  Build our people - By developing each other we build leaders that define the future  100% ownership - No excuses - own up and get it done  Best idea wins - We are a meritocracy - the idea matters, not who had it  Don't tread water - Move fast and deliver high-quality results  Disagree and commit - We can debate fiercely - but when the decision is made we commit and execute  Uncomfortably ambitious -We set improbable goals and meet them  Do more with less - Any cent spent is spent on the right thing  Give back - It‚Äôs not a zero-sum game - when all give back, all receive moreWhat We OfferFlexible, in-person or remote working arrangementsThe opportunity to get in at the ground level of a growing team with opportunities for progression, according to your skills and interests.Learn from the global Antler team about VCs, investment, and startup ecosystem on other topics with regular booster sessions and through the broader Antler networkCompetitive salary and the opportunity to receive carry in the fund.

title: Data Scientist
description: Serving tens of millions of customers each year, Changi Airport aims to create memorable experiences by connecting lives. Whether it is growing Singapore‚Äôs air connectivity to the world, enhancing experience at the various touchpoints, or curating personalised retail offerings, we are continually striving to better serve our customers at Changi Airport. The talent and commitment of our people makes the dreams that we are chasing a reality.Enterprise Data Science  ManagementEnterprise Data Science  Management (EDSM) comprises of a team of analytics professionals tasked with the mandate to help solve business problems and build up data capabilities across the enterprise. EDSM leverages on data science methodologies and adopts a ‚Äúdata first‚Äù approach in distilling actionable insights to key stakeholders including senior management and business teams. EDSM seeks to create positive impact and business value through data-driven decision-making.We are looking for a savvy Data Scientist to join our vibrant team in EDSM. Working in a team with like-minded enthusiasts, you will be involved in enterprise analytics efforts to generate novel insights as well as spearhead the development of data products and machine learning/AI capabilities to support internal stakeholders. You will also help to foster a culture of data-driven decision-making throughout the company.Responsibilities  Apply your expertise in data science, quantitative analysis, data mining and the presentation of data to derive insights that value-add to business decision making (e.g. hypothesis testing, development of MVPs etc).  Support enterprise data analytics and major data, machine learning, AI projects.  Develop predictive models and customer segmentation models.  Partner with users in various internal teams to solve data use cases.  Develop metrics and dashboards to support decision-making.  Support internal training needs for data science.Requirements  At least 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis and data science (machine learning / predictive modelling) with high proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.  Ability to grasp business concerns and formulate them as technical problems that can be solved using data and the appropriate toolkit.  Broad expertise in a range of ML concepts, frameworks and techniques such as logistic regression, clustering, dimensionality reduction, recommendation systems, neural nets etc.  Familiarity with data engineering methodologies, including SQL, ETL and experience in manipulating data sets with structured and unstructured data using Hadoop, AWS or other big data platforms.  Highly proficient in data visualization and the use of dashboarding tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Matplotlib, plot.ly etc).  Strong project management and organizational skills supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.  Motivated and driven, able to work independently and a good team player.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Education  Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or other quantitative discipline.Applicants who are medically eligible for vaccination has to be fully vaccinated or have made plans to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by 1 January 2022 as this position requires the employee to return to the workplace.

title: Engineer/Senior Engineer, NVEG PE (FDV)
description: As a Engineer/Senior Engineer the Non-Volatile Engineering (NVE) Product Engineering organization at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be part of a brilliant team of engineers that solves complex problems. You will be responsible for enabling Micron‚Äôs NAND products with seamless and issue free release to both internal and external non-volatile system customers.In this role (FDV ‚Äì Functional and Design Validation), you will formulate and execute validation flows on the latest RG NAND designs, using silicon and simulation. Validation on the NAND datasheet commands and features can come from deterministic usage cases, as well as randomly generated sequences. When device issues are uncovered, you will perform detailed failure analysis and work closely with the various Engineering and Development groups to resolve the observed issues. If you want a career that is meaningful, challenging, and want to work with a phenomenal team, NVE Product Engineering (FDV) may be a good fit for you.Responsibilities include, but not limited to:  Design novel test algorithms and develop test programs for validating NAND features and commands  Study the latest RG NAND designs, with focus on customer mode operations  Use high-speed tester hardware to perform functional and design validation of new NAND devices  Perform Electrical Failure Analysis during the evaluations, and investigate root causes of reported device issues  Make use of Verilog/Synopsis VCS for simulation study and analysis  Collaborate with NAND Design, Application Engineering, Product and System teams to drive closure of device issues  Develop and optimize deterministic usage case flow and Random Sequence Generator for validation purpose  Automation of program development and work processes using scripting

title: Innovation Director, Asia Hub
description: Position Summary:The Innovation Director will be responsible to understand the JAPAC business needs and translate them into product/packaging innovation opportunities in line with Brand, Business strategy, timelines and budget.In this role, the Innovation Director will be accountable for shaping and developing the JAPAC regional innovation pipeline across brands sufficiently which includes product, packaging and claims innovations. attends scientific meetings and symposiums to ensure product development for the Cx Business stays at the leading edge of trends, developments and technologies¬∑ Participates in cross-brands sharing of scientific or consumer opportunities, ensuring innovation drives across the other product development teams (other brands) and Businesses (Rx, AC, Consumer).¬∑ Develops strong, collaborative relationships with other departments/groups and fosters an environment of knowledge sharing¬∑ Understand the impact of project decisions on financial KPIs (COGS, Margin Contribution and Profit), and provide assessments of where these could be improved.¬∑ Other duties as assigned.Job Requirements:¬∑ Master degree in Life Science, formulation, chemistry or related science required¬∑ Minimum of 10/15 years of relevant experience in Skin care/cosmetic industry¬∑ Expert level oral and written English¬∑ Proven track record of launching innovative Cosmetics or OTC products in a FMCG/FMCH international company¬∑ Be able to work in a matrix organization and manage teams.¬∑ Excellent oral and written communication skills at all levels within the organization and strong technical writing capability.¬∑ Proven track record of working with cross-functional teams to build strong working collaboration in a high performance environment in a culture that values scientific rigor, agility and empowerment.¬∑ Must possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills as well as a strong drive for results.¬∑ ability to work independently and to take responsibility for own projects/tasks¬∑ Results orientated with a hands-on, can-do attitude¬∑ Positivity, flexibility and adaptability with agile thinking¬∑ Ability to manage stress and dynamic environmental changes¬∑ Ability to manage ambiguity and ‚Äúconditional‚Äù problem solving¬∑ Entrepreneurial mindset (creative thinking and innovation)¬∑ Must display a strong work ethic

title: Head of Executive & Leadership Hiring, APAC
description: Company DescriptionLinkedIn is the world's largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and expereiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our producrts to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.Job DescriptionAt LinkedIn, we trust each other to do our best work where it works best for us and our teams. This role offers a hybrid work option, meaning you can both work from home and commute to a LinkedIn office, depending on what‚Äôs best for you and when it is important for your team to be together.Why‚ÄØis working in recruiting at LinkedIn so unique?‚ÄØ We like to say ‚ÄòTalent Acquisition is the most meta job at LinkedIn‚Äô - we‚ÄØsource,‚ÄØassess, and hire the people who envision the products that power and change the profession of recruiting and talent.‚ÄØ Our TA team vision is ‚ÄúTo Design, Build and Share Best on Planet Recruiting.‚Äù‚ÄØIn addition to recruiting the world‚Äôs top talent to help LinkedIn, our Talent Acquisition team is ‚Äòcustomer zero,‚Äô which is manifested in a close relationship with our customers and, more importantly, our product team ‚Äì we have an opportunity to influence product roadmap whether‚ÄØit‚Äôs‚ÄØimproving our current product set, testing new tools or ideating and building brand new proof of concept products.The Head of Executive  Leadership Hiring APAC will create the vision and build a best-in-class, internal executive and leadership hiring function for APAC.  As our company and business grow and scale, so has our need for bringing in exceptional leadership to help drive success in our next phase of growth.  The role reports to our Senior‚ÄØDirector of‚ÄØTalent Acquisition, APAC. The successful leader will be strategic, process-oriented, and data-driven -‚ÄØthey‚ÄØwill partner with our regional leadership to develop and execute the annual leadership hiring plan, grow LinkedIn‚Äôs visibility and reputation across the regional tech industry, and lead and inspire an awesome team of leadership recruiters.The team is‚ÄØdedicated‚ÄØand innovative, consistently delivering in a tough market, acting as strategic partners to the business, and‚ÄØchampioning the voice of the candidates. The Head of Executive  Leadership Hiring should inspire the team to do their best work ‚Äì developing them to be best on planet leadership recruiters, and enabling them to hire world-class leadership into LinkedIn.Responsibilities Include:  Create and maintain diverse networks of leadership talent internally and externally through proactive events, roundtables, media, and networking.  Provide leadership, direction, and programming expertise to enhance diversity, inclusion, and belonging.  Grow and develop a best-in-class, internal executive and leadership hiring function.  Leads proactive leadership pipelining and nurture strategy, and importantly brings stakeholders along the journey.  Build and foster relationships with senior leaders, acts as a trusted advisor to drive leadership talent strategy, and deliver measurable business impact.  Invest in our talent and effectively lead a team of high-performing leadership recruiters through compassionate management, collaboration, coaching  development.  Fulfills recruitment needs and talent requirements for senior manager mandates.  Develop methodologies and processes for leadership assessment in collaboration with global and regional stakeholders.  Champion the data-driven recruiting mindset, using data and analytics to tell stories and drive talent  business outcomes.  Be educated and knowledgeable in leadership recruiting trends of the future workplace to ensure we are keeping pace with technology and evolving our tools and processes.  Champion the LinkedIn culture  values and foster a culture of belonging to help the team dream big while having fun!  Lead with an agile mindset focused on problem-solving through creative solutions, and thrive in an environment where growth and change are the only constants.  Sponsor and drive projects across the TA Roadmap to support our continued focus on innovation.  Embrace the concept of being customer zero for our Talent Solution product.  Champion LinkedIn products with our customers ‚Äì articulate the vision for LinkedIn within the TA industry, influence customer opinions, and speak on topics of expertise at industry and LinkedIn-sponsored events.  Bring a strong voice, functional expertise, and a fun personality to the TA leadership team.QualificationsBasic Qualifications  10+ years of experience with full‚ÄØlife-cycle‚ÄØexecutive or leadership recruiting.Preferred Qualifications  Proven track record in building and managing an executive or leadership recruiting function and a high-performing team in a fast-paced environment (ideally technology).  Proven track record in inclusive recruiting strategy and outcomes.  Demonstrated ability to lead through inspiring others; encouraging teams to take on new challenges and exceed expectations.  Experience in working with senior leaders to determine organizational needs.  Experience with project management and senior-level facilitation.  Experience with APAC employment laws and practices.  Proven track record of compassionate management or strong coaching skills.  A thought leader within executive and leadership hiring with experience successfully speaking at events or with customers.  Knowledgeable about current market trends and competitive data.  Ability to coach the business on the latest thinking and best practices.  Experience driving enterprise-wide strategies within a recruiting organization.  Experience with the oversight of data integrity, reporting requirements, and critical accountability metrics.  Demonstrates creativity and drives for innovation while effectively problem-solving.

Oversee the delivery of Sales plan in line with overall company strategy and direction, Presents business solutions at the executive level.Key Requirements  Bachelor's degree in Business or IT  10+ years of experience in sales position in IT industry, 5+ years of experience in senior sales management  Track record of building high performing sales teams  Strategic thinking and visionary leadership  High degree of diplomacy and professionalism in all facets of communication as company representative, strong work ethic  Ability to create, plan  execute sales strategy and action plans  Proven track record of consistently exceeding corporate objectives and quotas  Exceptional stakeholder, consulting and financial skills  Technical knowledge and understanding of Cloud Service Providers offerings, Hyper Converged Infrastructure, Data Centres, DR, and Backup solutions is a plus.Desired SkillsAmazon Cloud, AWS, Cloud, Cloud Computing, Cloud Computing IaaS, Cloud Storage, Google, GCP, Hybrid Cloud, Information Technology, Rackspace Cloud, Sales, Salesforce.com, Solution Selling, Windows Azure.

title: Full Stack Engineer / Internal Consultant
description: Your role :Do you enjoy consulting on digital transformation projects? Are you looking for a unique opportunity to drive UBS's accelerating digital transformation? Do you have a knack for analyzing IT business processes? Are you keen on turning business and IT requirements into working IT prototypes and solutions?We‚Äôre looking for someone like this to:‚Ä¢ conduct requirements-gathering activities, evaluating services, analyzing and using a variety of internal and external data and conducting end user interviews‚Ä¢ collaborate with our business partners in the creation of business requirements and functional specifications, assist in quality control and project management and identify people and systems impacted by functional and non-functional requirements‚Ä¢ prototype solutions on our in-house and be involved in implementing final IT solutions‚Ä¢ work within a global team and partner with senior management to build awareness, assess opportunities for new technologies and maximize value/impact of the function‚Ä¢ build trust and strong working relationships with Business and Technology stakeholders‚Ä¢ push forward the capabilities and performance of the team to strengthen and expand the service offering of the unit which align with the business needs for today and the futureYour team :Group Internal Consulting is the UBS Transformation Powerhouse, providing professional internal consulting, project management and execution services to all business divisions and functions on a global level. In the ongoing transformation of the financial industry, we aim to be a differentiating factor for UBS by ensuring targeted, impactful and efficient processes and change.With over 700 people across the globe, we contribute to relevant and impactful projects, apply a firm-wide perspective and shape our own environmentYou will be working in the Digital Development  unit of Group Internal Consulting in Singapore, a driven and diverse team of professionals. Our team helps UBS business divisions and functions to shape and implement their digital strategy in the areas of emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), Advanced Analytics, Cognitive Automation and Blockchain as well Risk Modelling and UX/UI Design.  Operating at the intersection of business, technology and innovative thinking, we are uniquely placed to combine the power of emerging technologies with a profound understanding of UBS business and change management practices to deliver sustainable digital transformation.Your expertise :‚Ä¢ 3-5+ years‚Äô experience in financial services and/or IT consulting with a university degree in IT or related field, any Treasury function experience a plus e.g. liquidity models‚Ä¢ proven track record of successfully engaging on technology projects using Agile and Waterfall methodologies with an ability to adapt quickly to changing technology requirements and environments‚Ä¢ ability to understand business needs and transform these into functional and technical requirements and specifications‚Ä¢ sophisticated SQL knowledge and the ability to write complex and performant queries on large data sets‚Ä¢ able to switch between business requirements development and technical delivery, acting as the liaison between technology and the business aligned divisions‚Ä¢ excellent communication skills at a technical and functional level‚Ä¢ strong knowledge of SDLC and understanding of DevOps practices.‚Ä¢ project management certificationexperience in the following:‚Ä¢ Springboot, Java‚Ä¢ Experience in Front end Development (Using HTML, Javascript, Node.js/React JS, Java/Python, Spring)‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Java 8, Spring Framework with Spring Boot, Gradle/Maven‚Ä¢ Experience with RESTful services‚Ä¢ Experience on Microservice Architecture and relational databases‚Ä¢ Able to develop Java/J2EE based applications using well known Java frameworks ie: Hibernate, Spring and software integration techniques like REST/API services‚Ä¢ Knowledge in Azure Cloud desirable‚Ä¢ Knowledge in NO-SQL databases (Azure CosmosDB is a plus)

title: IT System Engineer
description: The Systems Engineer is responsible for supporting the equipment in Microsoft Windows environment, from design through implementation and support. The incumbent performs a wide variety of installation, configuration and upgrading of workstations, servers and related hardware and software in a LAN, WAN and stand-alone environment. The incumbent also provides investigation, diagnostic testing and repair/resolution of system, hardware, software and infrastructure.  Responsible for the complete configuration, installation and support of equipment in Microsoft Windows environment to the specifications of client‚Äôs proposals  Provide on-site and remote support to troubleshoot and resolve computer and telephony related issues when contacted by clients  Perform regular maintenance to maintain software applications and operating systems  Manage the assigned projects and program components to deliver services in accordance with established objectives  Respond to inquiries from staff, administrators, service providers, site personnel and external vendors to provide technical assistance and support  Supervise the administration of systems and servers related network to ensure availability of services to authorized users  Any other ad-hoc duties as required or assigned  Experienced and technically strong in government applications support knowledge / workflow / processes from government infrastructure aspect  Able to travel overseas as and when required to provide overseas office support for users located in different countries  Knowledgeable or strong sense of security DOs and DON'Ts within government agency  Able to work on saturday / sunday / long hours / overtime / public holidays and PH eve, when required.  Able to work during monthly weekends and/or after office hours of maintenance downtime  Positive and strong positive mentality under extreme stress and pressurized environment  Able to provide technical support via phone or conference for overseas users  Able to manage and understand high security and stringent policy, expect to have numerous challenges from customer for NEC proposed solution  Able to work long hours under extreme intense, stress and pressurized environment  Strong in process to implement new or improvement and changes to existing support structure and workflow  Capable of solving difficult situation despite the possibilities that customer will provide constraint from security and policy aspect  Take full control and ownership of all escalations and complaints  Experienced in producing, driving and managing service improvement plans with measurable internally and externally  Minimally perform the following system administration tasks and automate them to the extent possible: User administration including administration of user accounts, FTP/ SFTP accounts and granting access to files and directories; Manage and maintain system utilities and scripts; System configuration management including modifying system settings, drive mappings; Administer network print servers and queues; Manage batch jobs; Server patch management; Troubleshoot performance issues; System security administration such as, Monitor and perform TLS certificate renewal for the systems; Manage the encryption / decryption keys for the server; Escalate hardware fault and software error to Customer-appointed Supplier; Management of system logs; and document and maintain server administration guides and SOPs.  Good to have at least three (3) years of experience in Microsoft Server administration; and Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA).

Very attractive commission schemeInterested applicants are invited to send your updated resume in PDF format. We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

title: Administration Executive
description: TotalEnergies is a major energy player, which produces and supplies fuels, natural gas and electricity.Active in more than 130 countries, our 100,000 employees are committed to better energy that is safer, more affordable, cleaner and accessible to as many people as possible.Operating within the Gas, Renewables  Power segment, TotalEnergies Gas  Power Asia (TEGPA) is one of the three trading entities within TotalEnergies focusing on Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG), Drybulk and Power trading in Asia Pacific.This position is based on the trading floor in Singapore, with regular contacts with Geneva and Houston based teams as well as Paris headquarters.Responsibilities:To provide secretarial, paralegal and administrative support to the managing director, the support functions (such as finance, legal) as well as to business team.General Office Duties:  Coordinate the arrival of new hires depending on the cost centre assigned (workstations, passes, business cards, sending of the floor plan, access to the office after working hours, schedule for entry into the office, add them to the chat group (Whatsapp or Signal as the case may be).  Work on, update and maintain the TEGPA DWP page (TEGPA intranet) on a regular basis in collaboration with the other administrative assistant.  Liaise with the Company or Singapore Affiliate to order Christmas cards, diaries and calendars and organise and send Christmas cards, diaries and calendars to the employees  Assist to purchase gifts/ vouchers for special occasions for all regardless of Cost centres.  Manage and distribute local courier and airborne packages including local and overseas postage mail and faxes.  In case on restrictions regarding the entry to the office, send to all employees the monthly schedule for working in the office.  Receptionist‚Äôs duties when needed answer telephone calls and redirecting calls to appropriate employees, coordinates building + total passes, deal with all enquiries and taking down messages in a professional and courteous manner.  Update employees‚Äô personnel information and discuss/arrange seating plan with the secretary general.Committee/Global Meetings organization and coordination:  Organize TEGPA meetings with the general secretary in collaboration with the other administrative assistant.  Organize and coordinate the TEGPA Steerco and any other TEGPA Corporate committee.  In charge of organising seminar (if any), compiling delegate list + mailing list + negotiate with hotels for group rates and organising its materials, stationeries, refreshments, lunch or dinner locations.  Assist in meeting organisation and to ensure meeting rooms are reserved.Para-legal Tasks:  Participate to the organisation and follow-up of the board resolution, collect the directors‚Äô signature for TEGPA/TGPAu/ATLS, save them in the respective folders and send them to our corporate secretary.  Register all the agreements in their executed form in the Book, ensure the data accuracy when they are registered in the System and participate to the registration of the Agreement in the archiving systems under a lawyer's supervisionTravel Arrangements/Meetings:  Assist to book rooms for conferences and trainings (if any) and hotels.  Assist and ensure that visitors are assigned with workstation during their visit in TEGPA and ensure the update the Visitors Tracker List.  Arrange and book hotels or service apartments, flights and airport pickup (price comparison when required) for local employees, expatriates and visitors.  Assist with visa applications and obtain travel authorisation approvals.Invoicing and Expenses:  Handle expense claims and coordinate supporting documents for approvalHealth, Safety  Environment (HSE):  Ensure that the fire warden or assistant fire warden are present on the day of the fire drill  Coordinate with the wardens on any information they have received from T3S.  Update the fire wardens on any personnel who will be unable to attend the meeting. To raise feedback (if any) to T3S.  Notify and ensure that employees are aware of the date that the fire drill and IPP drills will be conducted  Covid-19: Act as a backup of the other administrative assistant for compiling and preparing declarations from all staff of TEGPA and ATLS related to Covid-19Others:  Other ad-hoc tasks as and when assigned.Qualifications/Experience Requirements:  Strong interpersonal skills: face to face, over the telephone and in written communication  Good secretarial  organisation skills.  To have a flexible, adaptable and organised approach.  Competent in Microsoft 365 (Word/ Excel/Powerpoint/SharePoint).  Attention to detail and accuracy.  Able to work under pressure and preferably experience of working in a similar environment.  Self-motivated and take responsibility for own areas of work.  English skills are a pre-requisite. Chinese and French are a plus.

title: GO12058888 - Data Management Analyst
description: The CompanyWe are looking for a Data Management Analyst to support our client in the consulting sector. Our client is a global consulting firm, and we are looking for candidates to support them on a 12 months rolling.The Data Management Analyst is a pivotal role in a new divisional analytics organization supporting all APAC functions and markets in the areas of Business Intelligence, Data Management, Data Analytics, and Data Science.This is a challenging role that supports APAC business functions and processes with the management and maintenance of databases, master-and metadata solutions and data management processes, for the purpose of self-service data exploration, reporting and analysis.The RoleData Management and Governance:  Understand business requirements for data and analysis.  With the Data Architect Advisor, design and develop conceptual and logical database schemata, data models, and data integration processes.  Maintain information architectures; manage data design, content, and definitions.  Perform day to day MDM implementation and maintenance activities for core transactional and analytics systems.  Support data stewardship and data quality management processes across APAC business functions.  Support the adoption and embedding of data stewardship in regular business processes.  Conduct or support training sessions and provide coaching to key user groups in APAC.  Provide functional and technical expertise and advice on design and deployment of analytics solutions needed to support main business strategies and initiatives.  Work with peers in Business Analytics, and Data Science to develop and provide solutions.  Build plans; ensure work progress; identify and report success measures.  Prepare and present progress reports and outcomes to stakeholders.Your Profile  A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Computer Science, MIS, or similar discipline.  Experience: 2-7 years of practical data management experience in any industry (4-7 years for Senior).  Expert knowledge of designing, developing and implementing database solutions in one or more leading platforms.  Proven experience in master- and metadata management  Up to date knowledge of developments in the business intelligence  analytics space, including emerging big data technologies.  Willingness to learn to work with new tools and technologies.  A good understanding of fundamental business principles and problems.Apply TodayPlease send your resume, in WORD format only and quote reference number Ref No GO12058888, by clicking the apply button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.Robert Half International Pte Ltd.  Co. title: Engineer, NVE PE - NAND Validation and Characterization
description: Micron Technology‚Äôs vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life and our commitment to people, innovation, tenacity, collaboration, and customer focus allows us to fulfill our mission to be a global leader in memory and storage solutions. This means conducting business with integrity, accountability, and professionalism while supporting our global community.As a Product Engineer specialized in NAND Validation and Characterization, you will be part of a team which interfaces professionals from various departments such as Technology Development, Applications Engineering, Global Quality and Silicon Design as well as different Product Engineering teams within Non-Volatile Engineering group. You will be responsible in the validation, characterization and qualification of non-volatile memory products which involves development of test program, execution of characterization run, and electrical and data analysis with compliance to datasheet and customer specification.Responsibilities:  Develop and maintain characterization and qualification test program based on datasheet and customer specification  Execute characterization runs to validate product and collaborate with various engineering teams to resolve issue encountered.  Explore continual improvement in product characterization and validation methodology aligned with the growth in customer requirement and higher data rate supported.  Automate program development and work processes whenever possible.

title: Commissioning, Qualification, and Validation (CQV) Manager
description: The OpportunityEsco Lifesciences Group provides enabling technologies, products and services to the life sciences and healthcare industries, supporting academic research and scientific discoveries, clinical practice, as wellas biopharmaceutical RD and manufacturing. Headquartered in Singapore, Esco has an extensive sales network in over 100 countries, direct sales and service offices in 24 countries, 8 manufacturing and RD hubs in the US, Europe, the UK, China, Singapore, Indonesia, and over 1500 employees worldwide.Esco is poised to benefit from the sustained growth of the healthcare and biopharma industries in Asia and globally. Esco has achieved market leadership in China, and globally, in multiple categories withinsome of the fastest-growing segments ‚Äî with China being its largest and fastest growing market. As a Singapore-headquartered company, Esco is a nexus of East and West, bridging technologies, productsand talent across the world, with global operations spanning the US, Europe and Asia.The ScopeThe CQV Manager will report to the CEO/ Plant Manager.Job Responsibilitiesa.Overall accountability for company validation program including: commissioning  qualification, computerized system validation, thermal validation, decontamination  sterilization validation,process validation, cleaning validation, transport qualification, aseptic process simulation and validation maintenance activities.b.Performs strategic planning and development of activities for company CQV function, including compliance, capacity, timelines and directions. Collaborates closely with senior leadership teamin meeting corporate and organizational goals through establishing and reporting of department or organizational metrics.c.Performs and ensures validation of GMP facilities through management of validation projects of various sizes while providing technical assistance. Acts as subject matter expert and resource topeers and colleagues.d.Establish, generate, and maintain CQV department procedures in compliance with company and industry standards.e.Owns and maintain the validation program quality systems.f.Develops Validation Plans for validation projects and oversee contract staff, when necessary, through development of statement of work and vendor selection.g.Write, review and approve associated commissioning, qualification and validation protocols and reports including executed protocols. Ensures appropriate resolution of protocol exceptions.h.Generate, review and approve CQV associated deviations, CAPAs. Perform/ lead investigations and RCAs as required.i.Perform CQV associated change control assessments.j.Primary point of contact for CQV associated audit requests. Present and defend validation studies during regulatory, partner and internal inspections.k.Authors or reviews validation section of annual periodic product reviews.l.Lead or participate in risk assessments and gap analysis.m.Lead continuous improvement initiatives.n.Develop work plans, assign tasks, and lead team(s).Authoritya.Authority for the CQV program and associated cGMP implementation and improvements.b.Authority to approve changes made to the CQV program.Requirements‚Ä¢Degree in Biotechnology/ Chemical Engineering/ Bioengineering/ Life Sciences or related studies.‚Ä¢Minimum of 8 years in an engineering or quality role in a cGMP related role with at least 2 years in a people management role.‚Ä¢Highly adaptable and capable of performing in a dynamic working environment.‚Ä¢Knowledgeable on cGMP manufacturing of investigational products and their associated requirements. Able to ensure validation activities for the manufacturing of products in preclinical and clinical trials (Phase 1, 2, 3) are performed in a manner appropriate to the currentstage of the product lifecycle.‚Ä¢Good grasp of aseptic processing knowledge pertaining to cGMP manufacturing of Cell  Gene Therapy associated products.‚Ä¢Strong understanding of regulations related to manufacturing of Cell  Gene Therapy products.-Good ability to define validation deliverables suited for each product to fulfil regulatory requirements.‚Ä¢Knowledge of Validation Lifecycle Approach.‚Ä¢Familiarity and Understanding of Validation using risk-based approaches.‚Ä¢Experience in facility design, qualification and start up.‚Ä¢Ability to read/interpret engineering drawings and design documents.‚Ä¢Good understanding of computerized system validation and data integrity principles.‚Ä¢Strong technical writing abilities in being able to write from ground up SOPs and able to review as relevant to relevant ISPE/PDA, cGMP Guidelines and technical working documents.‚Ä¢Self-starter, self-motivated and task oriented. Able to motivate team to ensure deliverables are completed in a timely fashion.‚Ä¢Builds relationship and connects with colleagues in a way that creates a sense of team purpose and achievement.Preferred Experience(s)‚Ä¢Strong interpersonal, organization and technical skills. Capability to work both independently and in a team environment with ability to provide guidance.‚Ä¢User experience with software tools on CMMS, QMS, EMS, LIMS.‚Ä¢Proficient in MS Office Suite (Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Project, Visio).‚Ä¢Excellent written and verbal communications skills.Strong understanding of global regulations (US, EU, MHRA, JP, Canada, Australia).‚Ä¢Experience with cleanroom, facility and validation of advanced processing equipment includingbioreactors, fermenters, isolators, filling lines, freeze dryers, autoclaves, AHU and utilities.‚Ä¢Familiar with sterilization, bio-decontamination and material compatibility.‚Ä¢Superior communication, strategic, interpersonal, and negotiating skills. Able to provide adviceas overall validation subject matter expert and openly communicate any relevant issues.‚Ä¢Prior experience working in a startup environment is ideal.Interested candidates, please submit a Cover Letter and CV to jobs@escoaster.com.For other job openings in Esco Lifesciences Group within the respective geographies, kindly refer to corporate website.

title: Amazon Connect Senior Sales Specialist
description: AWS is one of Amazon‚Äôs fastest growing businesses, servicing millions of customers in more than 190 countries, reshaping the way global enterprises consume information technology and powering the developers who are building the next generation of global industry leaders. AWS customers include some of the most innovative startups like Netflix, Pinterest, Airbnb, and Instagram as well as some of the largest global enterprises like Shell International, Unilever, Hitachi, Sharp, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and Samsung. AWS is seeking a seasoned Enterprise Sales Representative to help us establish AWS as the market leader for Amazon Connect - Amazon‚Äôs Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS). This effort is in direct response to feedback from customers and seeks to address the daily pain points of meeting the high bar of delivering outstanding customer service. This new service will offer a compelling alternative for our customers when faced with multiple components, channels and vendors, managing long term commitments and very complex pricing models, and scaling based upon the specific needs of their businesses. This exciting new service is part of the growing SaaS offerings from AWS such as Amazon WorkSpaces, Amazon WorkDocs, and Alexa for Business. The ideal candidate will have enterprise sales experience in areas such as telecommunications, VoIP, CRM/ERP applications, call/contact center and/or the integration of these complex solutions, be a self-starter, and be willing to operate both tactically and strategically. As key team member in this fast growing, exciting space you will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of a service category that will have a significant impact on our customers‚Äô business. Your responsibilities will include building and managing a healthy sales pipeline focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration. The ideal candidate will possess a proven track record and background that enables them to lead a sales effort that will include teaming with AWS Senior Enterprise Sales Representatives, Solutions Architects, Partners and engagements at the CxO level within the largest AWS accounts. The successful candidate will also possess a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CxO/VP level, as well as a technical understanding that enables them to easily interact with developers and technical architects. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus. Key job responsibilities¬∑ Drive revenue and market share for AWS.¬∑ Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue targets.¬∑ Develop and execute against a sales plan.¬∑ Maintain a robust sales pipeline.¬∑ Work with partners and OEM‚Äôs to extend reach  drive adoption of AWS solutions.¬∑ Manage contract negotiations along with the core sales organization.¬∑ Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts.¬∑ Ensure customer satisfaction.¬∑ Expect moderate travel.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS¬∑ 10 years of technology related sales or business development experience.¬∑ BA/BS degree required.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS¬∑ 5 years in GTM/Specialist Sales role for Contact Center and/or Workforce Management solutions¬∑ Direct field experience working with enterprise accounts.¬∑ Strong verbal and written communications skills.¬∑ Extensive customer network.¬∑ Proven track record of success driving adoption of disruptive technologies within enterprise accounts. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: DevOps Engineer
description: Role Summary:To cope with our increasing business needs, we are looking for a dynamic candidate to join our fast-expanding team. You will be tasked to develop automated processes to support infrastructure operations in the cloud that has integration to various on-premise or SaaS solutions. Knowing a wide range of technologies in terms of vertical and horizontal breadths, you will help enhance and support our applications in the design and deployment of scalable and highly available solutions. You will also be responsible for the overall technical design, pertaining to the infrastructure elements, integration, connectivity, and hosting.What to expect:  Design model and detailed security control framework for all aspects of cloud topology (Azure  AWS).  Continuously improve and adapt cloud security control framework.  Design logging and monitoring control framework encompassing all levels in the cloud stack.  Continuously improve and adapt cloud security logging and monitoring control framework  Leads in the administration and configuration of Jenkins and Bamboo CI/CD tools  Design and enable interfaces for Jenkins and Bamboo Builds and Release management and enable CI / CD pipeline for applications.  Integrate infrastructure security within CI/CD toolchains in order to increase automation and velocity.  Assist with threat and risk reporting.  Work with existing global cloud security organizations to ensure knowledge sharing and collaboration.  Specific Competencies/ Attributes  Must have Jenkins / Bamboo, and good to have Azure DevSecOps cloud-native DevSecOps experiences  Solid experience in Cloud Infrastructure security design and management.  Experience in configuring and maintaining VNET peering; subnet; Cloud Regions and availability zones.  Strong hands-on experience in container technologies (Specifically Azure Kubernetes Services).  Experience in building and deploying containers on a cloud platform using an automated CI / CD pipeline.  Managed Infrastructure automation through DevSecOps scripting (E.g. Shell; Powershell; Ansible; Terraform etc)  Hand on experience in continuous integration/continuous delivery tools such as Azure DevSecOps; Jenkins; Gitlab; Artifactory; and Nexus and SonarQube  Must have hands-on UNIX and shell scripting experience.  Must have hands-on experience establishing cloud infrastructure logging and monitoring.  Industry certifications in DevSecOps such as AZ-400 Microsoft Azure DevSecOps Expert Certification is a plus

experience with unit level testing, writing test plans, scripts and generating testable code  Extensive experience using common SCM/RCS tools like SVN, GIT, Mercurial, etc.  Extensive experience working with common bug tracking tools like JIRA, Bugzilla, Trac, Mantis, etc.  Experience managing testing via continuous integration software like Jenkins, Xcode Server, and VS Build Server title: Senior Assistant, Accounts Receivable
description: Are you looking for an exciting new opportunity? Would you like to build your career brick by brick in the LEGO Group?We are looking for a collaborative and enthusiastic professional to support the Accounts Receivable processes in our established Business Service Operations (BSO) department!Core ResponsibilitiesIn order to deliver a customer and service oriented culture, you will be responsible for ensuring all the daily transactional tasks are completed on time and support the Team Lead in handling other ad-hoc tasks.Primary Tasks includes:  Daily Payment Posting  Daily report on unallocated funds  Proper documentation of Payment Advice from Collection Team  Raise query on unclear allocation or deviation from remittance advice  Clearing/Maintaining/Offset Credit Note against Debit amount in Account  Refund ‚Äì Check on approvals and compliance to Refund Policy  Cheque Processing/ Payment/Credit Transfer ‚Äì moving payments/documents between accounts  Booking of Doubtful Debts/ Write Offs  Reconciliation and Month end Closing Activities  Auditing ConfirmationYour Accountabilities and Responsibilities include:  Pro-actively anticipates the needs of internal/external Customer/Stakeholder  Strong sense of urgency to prioritize important requests  Understand the value of the service provided and keeping to Partner Promises  Respect and collaborate well with other team membersPlay your part in our team succeedingTo support the LEGO Group with consistent, high quality and customer-oriented execution of AR processes, and thereby enable the BSO to succeed in delivering great value to the LEGO organization.The role plays an important role in establishing a sustainable AR department in the BSO. We need employees to engage actively in building collaboration, process excellence, quality and fun in the everyday life.Department focus:  To engage in establishing the AR department in APAC including China  To form new collaborative relationship and thereby ensure sustainable implementation of the global processes  Secure timely processing of orders/deliveries/payment posting/invoicing  Support sales in credit limit decisions  Timely collection of receivables  Drive process improvement  Challenge business on credit risk mattersDo you have what it takes?  1-2 years of professional working experience, preferably in a related accounting/ financial role or a position where capabilities are transferable  Analytical, detailed and high-quality oriented  Manage multiple tasks successfully in a hectic working day  Microsoft Excel at advanced level  Experience in working in highly collaborative environments  SAP knowledge preferred  English and Mandarin language skills at advanced levelJoin the global LEGO¬Æ teamWhat‚Äôs in it for you? Here are some of what to expect:Family Care Leave ‚Äì We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.Insurances ‚Äì All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.Wellness ‚Äì We want you to be your best self, so you‚Äôll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are basedColleague Discount ‚Äì We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.Bonus ‚Äì We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you‚Äôll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.Your workplace ‚Äì Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children‚Äôs Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children‚Äôs Rights.Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

title: Regional Talent Manager, SEAO, Cartier
description: Want to join Cartier HR team leading the talent management activities in South East Asia  Oceania?Join us NOW as our Cartier Regional Talent Manager!HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?  Your deep understanding and love for the human nature and its diversity, your ability to properly detect and assess unique personalities and highly skilled Talents who can successfully contribute and blossom within Cartier organization, your strong business acumen, as well as your capacity to network inside and outside the organization will make your role impactful.  With your contribution, Cartier‚Äôs uniqueness will find a new resonance amongst Talents in South East Asia  Oceania and will boost the Maison awareness and attractiveness as an employer.  You will also play a pivotal role in accompanying the Maison ongoing and future transformations with a competency approach.YOUR MISSIONS1. Talent Management  For key positions in the Region, analyze succession gaps, retention risks and impact of vacancies. Design appropriate intervention plans and ensure implementation within the Region.  Facilitate Regional talent roundtables and work with other Regions and Central teams on talent identification to build specific career plans and provide necessary exposure for identified potentials.  Coordinate mobility for international and regional talents, in close collaboration with Cartier and Richemont stakeholders.  Lead the annual Organization  Talent Review (OTR) within the Region, closely partnering with Local HR and Managers.  Contribute to Organization Design and evolution  Key point of contact for Leadership and HR teams for international Talent Management related topics.2. Employer Branding  Talent Acquisition  Locally adapt and implement Cartier employer branding strategy in SEAO markets.  Build and leverage sustainable partnerships with key universities in the Region.  Build the talent pool for the Region with a strong networking approach, constantly looking for internal and external talents to enrich and elevate the global competency and diversity level of the Region.  Support recruitment goals for key positions: briefing meetings, final interviews, assessment, and decision-making process.3. Talent Development  Build Talent market intelligence (supply and demand, strengths and challenges, competition organization‚Ä¶)  and anticipate how social, client and luxury industry evolutions will impact competencies internally and externally.  Identify internal short-, mid- and long-term talent competency needs and define action plan for critical competencies/metiers, including insource  outsource approach.  Work closely with Managers, HR and LD teams to build and implement individual development plan for key talents.  Co-design and/or implement programs focused on leadership (LEAD, Development Center, Management Trainee Prgm, etc.)HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?  You have 7-8 years‚Äô experience in Talent Acquisition/Management, preferably in a Retail industry and matrixed environment  You are resourceful, pro-active and able to take initiatives, while being able to understand the Maison vision and guidelines  You are open-minded, curious, creative with a disciplined eye  Your strong interpersonal skills allow you to influence and work effectively with the different stakeholders; and teams enjoy working with you because of your positive mindset and ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude  You are fluent in English, but we also value Chinese, Thai or Malay languages as a plus  You are open to travelling in the Region (when possible again)HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?  A great chance to be part of a very dynamic team in a fast developing Region undergoing several transformations.  An opportunity to work with various teams and nationalities.  Potential opportunities within Cartier and the Richemont Group to help you develop and take your career to the next level.YOUR JOURNEY WITH US:  After being shortlisted, you will meet the Richemont Regional Talent Manager to get to know you  You will then meet with Cartier Regional Senior HR Manager, Richemont HRD and Cartier Regional CEO to assess your fit to this role and give you an overview of the team dynamics and Maison culture  If you are the successful candidate, discover and immerse yourself in the beautiful world of Cartier

title: technology recruiter
description: Nomad-Search is a Tech-enabled Recruitment platform focusing on the built-Environment and Technology sector. We are passionate Technology Consultants that aim to help propel the leaders of today and groom the talents of tomorrow.As true talent partners of early-stage start-ups, we are focused on the organic acquisition and of senior personnel in the market through our interactive and consultative recruitment approach.1. Role DescriptionThis position will be working closely to the Lead Consultant/Managing Director. During this tenure, he/she will be undergoing a very specific market road map to fully understand the industry allocated to. The aim of this tenure is to provide these consultants with the importance of how to be precise, confident, and leadership to drive recruitment as their own business while being mentored. Here at Nomadic Generations, we want to provide a platform that is beneficial to kickstart a career in recruitment with the best foundation possible.2. Specific ResponsibilitiesIndividuals to be involved in:a) Active resourcing for candidates via:- Linkedin- Jobstreet- indeed- Referrals *- Eventsb) CV Boosting- Assisting acquired candidates to clean-up/update- CVs to be sent out to clients to ensure required details are highlighted to streamline hiring processes.- Tailoring, copywriting, and restructuring of candidates portfolios- Structured analysis of minimalistic and effective copywritingc) Business Development- Engage new Clients to onboard and promote quality consulting services for recruitment purposes.- Pulling in new Jobs/Requirements for clients- Generating new leads on emerging markets and cold markets- Consulting clients on market analysis and educating on recruitment approaches and standards- Contract negotiation with clientsd) Assisting Lead Consultant with other ad-hoc duties in relation to recruitment services.- Market Research- Integration of Technology- Sales review- Etc.3. title: Customer Service and Operation Associate
description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION    The EtonHouse International Education Group is headquartered in Singapore with 120 schools in over 11 countries. Together, these schools provide high quality education to over 12,000 children globally. Over the last 26 years, EtonHouse has been at the forefront of international education offering innovative pre-schools and K-12 schools across Asia.In the early years, an inquiry-based Inquire-Think-Learn curriculum, inspired by the Reggio Emilia approach is followed. For the Primary, Secondary and High School levels, EtonHouse offers the globally recognized International Baccalaureate (IB) Programme and IGCSE qualifications. The EtonHouse group has 5 IB schools in Singapore and a total of 12 IB schools globally.Corporate Website: http://www.etonhouse.edu.sg/    RESPONSIBILITIES    This position requires the candidate to work closely with the leaders of Operations and Client Service team of managing the centre. This position will provide customer care services to students and their parents, as well as operational support for the team. Essentially this position will be required to build strong and trusting relationships with internal and external customers and internal departments.Responsible for the opening, closing and running of the premises.Reception duties, answering any phone and email enquiries.Deliver a professional and high-quality service experience in a customer-facing role.Acquire a strong working knowledge of the organisations programmes and services.Handle customers queries, feedback and enrolment promptly and professionally.Provide customers with clear explanations on our programmes while at the front desk.Maintain close liaison with all other departments in order to have a good understanding of the operational flow and ensure a seamless client experience.Take the extra mile to engage customers.Develop great rapport with parents, children as well as teachers to build brand loyalty.Perform any other duties and responsibilities as and when assigned by Management.QUALIFICATIONS    Diploma/Degree Holder.5 day work week. Required to work weekday evenings and weekends.Strong proficiency in written and spoken English.Being effectively bilingual would be a strong advantage.Candidates who have worked in the hospitality or education industry are most preferred.Possesses emotional maturity and passion for customer service.Familiar with CRM systems and practices.Good team player, possesses the ability to work with minimal supervision.Positive, extroverted and outgoing personality.Well-groomed with a professional disposition.Flexible, able to manage change and ambiguity well and able to work under tight deadlines.Careful, meticulous, with an eye for detail.Well-organised, methodical with strong time-management abilities to manage multiple tasks.    OTHER INFORMATION    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.    Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - EIH - HQ

title: Sourcing Specialist (Senior Consultant)
description: About our ClientOur Client is an MNC and has a market lead position in the Services industry, with a multi-million turnover in worldwide markets. The company has a vision to combine innovation, knowledge and products. With increasing demand and new business ventures, they are currently looking for a Sourcing Specialist to be an integral part of their business to assist and continue to improve the Value Chain.Job DescriptionYour major responsibilities will involve managing your category portfolio mainly in Professional Services and Facility Management as well as extensive stakeholder engagement. This is a strategic Procurement position.Your other responsibilities include:   Sourcing strategy ownership within your Professional Services and Business Process   Outsourcing categories   Strategic sourcing and negotiation with Vendors and Suppliers   RFP/RFQ   Perform root-cause analysis and identify gaps for improvements   Extensive stakeholder engagement   Client engagement and client facingThe Successful ApplicantYou should possess a degree in Supply Chain or equivalent related studies and you must have a minimum of 5 years of experience in Procurement or Category Management. Experience in FMCG/Famp;B/e-Commerce sectors will be an advantage. You should also be strong with analytics as well as be sensitive to trends. Strong communication and negotiation skills with the ability to work in a fast paced and collaborative environment is essential.What‚Äôs on Offer?You will be in an organisation that takes pride in their excellent vision for the future. The company has an Aussie culture and takes pride in work-life balance. High performing employees are recognised and rewarded with competitive remuneration packages, personal development awards, annual salary reviews and short-term incentive programme. Some core benefits include health and welfare insurance subsidies.

title: Asia Metals & Mining News Team Leader - Singapore
description: Bloomberg News is the biggest financial and business news organization in the world. We lead the way in breaking news and providing analysis on financial markets, from intraday coverage through in-depth features. We are known for our quality, accuracy and ability to deliver news investors can use. It's what keeps us inventing and re-inventing, all the time.We are looking for a team leader to manage coverage of the metals and mining industry in Asia. You will oversee all areas of reporting and be responsible for a dynamic array of stories, including financial markets from gold to copper to steel, breaking news on giant mining conglomerates like BHP and Rio, decarbonizing some of the most polluting industries, and chronicling the growth of the battery metals business.The role covers all of Asia, and you will help a team of experienced reporters in India, Singapore, Hong Kong, China, Japan and Australia connect the dots across regional and global markets.We'll trust you to:  Oversee a busy team of experienced reporters across Asia  Conceive and drive the execution of breaking-news and longer-form stories on diverse topics spanning financial markets, big miners, climate change and emissions, government policy, technological innovation and more  Coordinate and collaborate across the newsroom, including with the markets teams, government, economy and global business  Be creative and flexible with new story-telling formats, with an emphasis on cross-platform innovation  Hire and develop talent with an emphasis on diversity and champion the ambitions of a competitive groupYou'll need to have:  A minimum of 5 years of recent financial journalism experience  Experience working in a real time news environment  Experience managing and/or mentoring individuals  A vision for the team, its coverage and direction  Impeccable news judgment and strong editing skills  Experience producing stories under deadline pressure  Experience in cross-team collaboration  A record of creativity and innovation  Fluency in both written  spoken EnglishIf this sounds like you:Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/aboutWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
