title: Field Support Engineer
description: The RoleTesla Motors is seeking a Field Support Engineer in Asia Pacific market. This role is at a key connection point between our worldwide service centers and the development and production base in Silicon Valley, California and Shanghai, China. The responsibility is to keep our vehicles on the road through proactive analyses of the vehicle fleet and to reduce their time spent in service centers by effective remote/on-site diagnostic work. This engineer needs to be able to efficiently work with large amounts of data in order to process information and make the correct conclusions in a timely manner. A strong technical background in diagnosing complex electromechanical systems with heavy software content and deployed in safety-critical applications is required. This engineer must be passionate about diagnostics, must be a strong critical thinker with great fluency understanding technical system-level architecture and issues. Additional training expertise and proven ability in supporting technicians/workshop staff.Field Support Objectives:Get failed vehicles properly diagnosed, properly repaired, and back in the hands of customers quickly by providing engineering support to aftersales teams (service, customer support).Responsibilities  Debug systems and perform diagnostics on field failures both remotely - looking at data logged by the vehicle, and directly in the field  Provide technical support in order to minimize vehicle downtime, through day to day coverage of internationally distributed service cases  Regular collaboration with Regional Technical Support Specialists to ensure consistent and stable global service operations  Provide Technical information/support to the Regional Technical Specialist network  Provide assistance to the training team on developing advanced Technician training courses  Support technicians in the field with troubleshooting techniques and remote diagnosis, travel to perform field diagnosis or repair. The position may sit within a certain region and require daily support  Recognize trends and patterns in field failures and provide written feedback to Product Support Engineers to drive future designs  Assist Product Support Engineers to ensure new issues are fully investigated and that countermeasures are in place  Assist and support Product Support Engineers, Product Excellence, and Failure Analysis team members to perform further root cause analysis on field failures by component/subsystem owners where necessary  Assist projects and support Product Support Engineers to evaluate vehicle new design features/fixes and perform regional testing  Assist improving service diagnostic tooling and equipment. Both at a Software and Hardware level  Support with high level Incident response requests  Availability for occasional off-hours work and traveling  Support market specific feature and homologation verification activitiesSkills  Strong ability to work and communicate effectively with her/ his team and peers within the service engineering organization  Strong ability to be self-directed and work independently, with strong organization and documentation skills  Exceptional capacity for managing simultaneous activities and challenges  Strong analytical problem solving skills and hands-on experience with hardware, tools, instruments, CAN or similar protocol analysis  Experience with complex automotive and electromechanical systems, preferably electric vehicles or high voltage DC systems such as DC storage or DC-DC converters  Skilled with common workplace and database software (MS Word, Excel, Visio, Access, etc.)  Able to read and interpret mechanical drawings and electrical schematics, experience with CAD systems such as CATIA a plus  Experience with Service Engineering teams and working practice with Engineers within certain subsystems  Experience with environmental and safety requirements a plus  Experience with OEM Diagnostic equipment, tooling and advance troubleshooting methods. Using Python, C++, Qt, UDS is preferredQualifications  Bachelor degree or higher in automotive or mechanical engineering preferred  Minimum 2 years‚Äô experience as diagnostic/master technician or field support engineer  Possess good communication skills  Broad Automotive experience preferred

title: Full Stack Developer 1450
description: Main ResponsibilitiesAs Full Stack Developer, you will be involved in innovative   and fully DevOps oriented teams in order to execute our projects for both the Asian Region and the World. Your technical appetite as well as your architecture, design and coding skills will help us deliver the best solutions for the bank. Not only Java. Transforming our applications to micro service architecture enabled us to truly be polyglot.  We are embracing wider range of   programming languages such as Go, Kotlin, Node.js and Python.This position is for the new CACIB strategic program, named LOANSCAPE. It is multiyear program. The program targets to:  Build a new platform to interconnect investors, lenders and clients on syndicated markets  Build a digital platform for clients and investors  Manage large lender pool deal, different loan format, institutional investors and multi-product  Increasing agility lead by more focused and structured transactions  Implement solution aligned with regulatory requirements (Basel IV, IFRS 9).The solutions are built in Paris and in Singapore.Scope of Work  Plan, design and implement end-to-end software solutions for the bank.  Use and contribute to build an efficient CI/CD software factory.  Interact with product owners and Subject Matter Experts to define solutions.  Quality-first, Agility and Continuous Improvement mindset.Required Skills  Curious and passionate about technologies  Practitioner of life-long learning  Experienced in Cloud native Java and passionate to learn others languages like C#, Go, C++, Python, Kotlin, R or Node.js  Experience with Vuejs or Angular, REST, gRPC, GitLab, Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka or RabbitMQ will be a plus.  Excellent understanding and experience of Agile (Scrum, Lean Start-Up, Safe, ‚Ä¶) principles  Good knowledge of DevOps  Excellent analytical skills  Excellent oral and written communication  Understanding of project management practices (PMP, Prince2 is a plus)Interested applicants, please email your resume to Shaun Quek Yew MengEmail: shaunquek@recruitexpress.com.sgCEI Reg No: R1660732EA Licence No:   99C4599

title: Global Logistics Analyst/Associate
description: This role will help ensure all freight shipments to/from and across all DCs are scheduled, shipped and received on time. This role will work cross-functionally with Procurement, Production, Operations, and Finance to be the single point of contact for all freight shipments beginning to end, booking, arranging pickup, transit updates and delivery. Strong interpersonal and communication skills

title: Research Assistant (Centre for Advanced 2D Materials)
description: The candidate will work at the Centre for Advanced 2D Materials (CA2DM) at the National University of Singapore in a highly international environment with state-of-the-art equipment and facilities. The candidate will assist and conduct experimental work in synthesis, functionalisation and characterisation of 2D materials.QualificationsCandidates must hold an internationally recognised Bachelor or MSc degree in Chemistry from an internationally recognized university. Previous experience in chemistry laboratory would be essential. title: Assistant Outlet Manager
description: The Assistant Outlet Manager assists the Outlet Manager/Operations Manager in implementing business plans. He/She is involved in staff control and handling people issues.
